loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites D. is from the village of Naga, Jimenez, in Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years-old and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Marites has recently started opened a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community.

In 2009, Marites joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC, which was used to invest in expanding the business. Marites is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stock for her store. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marites from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue to make improvements to her house.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for general store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth M. is 53 years-old, married, and lives at Poblacion, Siayan, in Zamboanga del Norte. She has four children. She spends her life with her husband. She has been a member of PAGLAUM since August 2007, and is now applying for a loan of 25,000 pesos to buy additional stock to sell in her sari-sari (convenience) store, including rice, laundry items, seasoning, goods, toiletries and other household items.

Elizabeth successfully manages her business and is able to cover her daily consumption needs as well as save for the future.

loans.use: additonal stock for general store

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
It is hard to imagine how a woman can be pregnant every other year - twelve times so far - plus take care of all of the children, be a good housewife and mother, and still have enough energy to run a business sewing clothes for other people, but that's what Purita G. has been doing most of her life. She is married to Manuelito G., and they live in the village of Purok 2, Carabalan, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental, where Manuelito also farms the small agricultural land that they own.

They married very young. Their oldest child is now 39 years-old, and with a new addition to the family almost every two years, Purita figured that the income her husband earned in farming was just not going to be enough, especially as there is always the danger of the crop failing because of bad weather, pests and other unexpected conditions that could affect production. Knowing that she could earn an income by making use of her dressmaking skills, Purita decided to start this venture using a small amount of capital from their family funds.

As her dressmaking business became popular, she needed additional capital so that she could service her customers faster, but, because they were poor, she knew that no-one would lend her the much-needed capital. When a friend told her that she could borrow funds from NWTF-Project Dungganon without providing any property as collateral, that she only needed to attend a short seminar to learn how Grameen-method microlending could work for her and four other members of a group, she asked her husband's permission and joined in 2000.

Armed with her loan, she was able to improve her dressmaking business.When she paid off her loan on time, she was able to borrow a bigger loan in the next cycle due to her good credit record. This has made a big impact in her family's lives, allowing her to help pay for their household expenses and even set aside a small amount for the future. Aside from dressmaking, Purita also began selling different household goods during market day in Barangay Carabalan, where she lives. Since market day is only once-a-week, she sells the goods from home the rest of the week. She also sells coconut wine in her community. After all business expenses, Purita earns an average net profit of PHP 3,000 per month from her business activities.

She continues to strive hard and look for other business opportunities so that she could provide her children with a better life. She knows that she still has a long way to go, as her youngest is just 10 years-old, but she is happy that the older children are now gainfully employed and only four are still in school. She knows that with great perseverance, steadfast industry, and faith, she will surely achieve all the she aspires for her children and herself.

For her twenty-second cycle loan she borrowed PHP 18,000 as additional capital for her business and for the farm. She maintained her good credit performance with NWTF-Project Dungganon, fully paying the loan on time without any delays. For her twenty-third cycle she plans to borrow PHP 20,000 for her business, and intends to use some of the income for house repair and improvements.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda M. is from the village of Poblacion 1 , Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Gilda is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Gilda owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Gilda has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gilda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gilda is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Gilda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business . 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena R. is from Bañadero, Ozamiz City. She is 61 years old, married with 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari store business, selling a variety of products to local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 10,000.00 PHP a month.

In September 2006, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living condition and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC with the amount of 40,000.00 PHP.She is now requesting a new loan of 50,000.00 PHP which will be used to buy more variety of products to sell to her neighbors. This will be her 8th loan availment from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve their living standard and to live with a healthy life.

loans.use: use to buy more grocery stocks

loans.name: Sahil

texts.en: Sahil was born in 1987. He lives in Fuzuli region. This young man is single. 4 years ago he started sheep breeding business. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 16 sheep for improving his sheep breeding business.

loans.use: to buy 16 sheep

loans.name: Jeremy

texts.en:
Jeremy O. is 38 years-old and married to Allen O., who is a truck driver for a cargo forwarder. They live in the village of Bulubitoon, Brgy. Miranda, Hinigaran, in Negros Occidental with their three children, who range in age from six to twelve years-old. Jeremy's mission in life is to help her husband raise their three children well, and provide them with a good future through education. In the short term, she plans to earn enough income to defray their small family's household expenses.

Her aspirations for her family became more attainable when she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to access the microcredit loans it offers using the Grameen methodology. She used the first loan as capital to set up her own general store. She was very happy when she saw that even with just a small amount of capital and its small returns, she was able to help provide for her family and set aside some savings for future security. She was able to increase her next loan amount by paying back each weekly installment on time, and paying off the loan within the set term. As a result, she was able to expand her business and started a food vending business. She knows that she is well on her way to attaining her dreams, as each new loan has also increased her monthly income. At present, she earns an average income of PHP 8,000 per month from her business activities.

In her previous ninth loan cycle, she borrowed PHP 16,000, which she used as additional capital in her business. She maintained her good track record by paying each installment on time, and paying back the full amount within the set loan term. Jeremy plans to borrow PHP 17,000 for her tenth loan cycle to buy stocks for her business, such as the very in-demand firecrackers and fireworks, in preparation for the coming holiday season.

Jeremy is shown in the attached picture with her 2 sons.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Stock for business

loans.name: Ban

texts.en: Mrs. Ban T. is a villager in Sisla village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. Aside from this farming, she is a pig breeder. In farming plantation, she now faces a problem because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive and she will use the rest of the loan to buy pig food to feed her pigs. Her husband, Mr. Nhen Trai, is a rice wine maker in the local village. Mrs. Ban T. is 39 years old and the mother of four children four of whom are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Toeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Toeun M. is a farmer who lives in Deum Por village in Kandal province. She now faces a small problem on this plantation because she does not have enough money to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field to cultivate rice. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

Mrs. Toeun M. is 42 years old and a widow with four children, two of whom are construction workers while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Sem

In these businesses, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy pig food, fertilizers and hire a laborer to plow the field; thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Kheiv Mok, is a cart driver who can make a small income to support the family. Mrs. Sem T. is 60 year old and the mother of a child who is a farmer.

Mrs. Chan Thoeun Y. is 30 years old and the mother of two children one of whom is attending primary school while the other is too young to work or study because that child is at the age of five years old. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy rice seeds and she would use the rest of the loan to buy a boat and fishnets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.name: Yorn

She would also use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her crops.

Mrs. Yorn B. is a widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is a farmer.

loans.name: Khien

She has two children, one of whom is a farmer and the other is a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers to support the field and make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Nai

Since the second business is going well she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy one more cow for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Kong Seourn, is a construction worker who can make a small income to support the family. Mrs. Nai K. has seven children two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny C., a resident of Chamka Doeub village in Takeo Province, owns a small piece of land upon which she cultivates rice. Also a cow breeder, she now wants to expand the operation and so is requesting a loan to buy an additional cow. Her husband, Mr. Khun em, shown on the right in the photo, is a laborer who makes a small income that helps support the family.

Mrs. Ny C. has six children, two of whom are laborers while another one is a construction worker. Two others are attending the local school and the youngest one is yet too young to work or study. Her husband is also shown on the right of the photo.

loans.name: Savoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Savoeurn T., who lives in Deum Por village in Takeo Province, owns a small piece of land upon which she cultivates rice. Because she lacks sufficient funds, she is requesting a loan to buy rice seeds for cultivation and more fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Ong Nhorn, shown on the left of the photo, helps her on the farming. Mrs. Savoeurn T. has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds for cultivating.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita H., who lives in the village of Vasquez Ext., Brgy. Carabalan Road, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental, is a 64-year-old widow and mother of 12 children, seven of whom already have their own families, while five of the younger children still live at home. As a widow for sometime now, she is used to feeding such a large family and has gained her community's respect because of the way she has raised her children to have integrity and moral fiber.

When Melita was widowed, she had to rely on the income from her general store. To augment her only source of income, Melita decided to make use of her cooking skills and expanded her business to include food vending, and this additional venture enabled her to support her children. But as her capital became insufficient to generate the income to cover the family's needs, Melita decided to join NWTF-Project Dungganon after she heard from some of her friends about how it could help her. After getting her children's agreement, she joined NWTF-PD in 1990.

The loans from NWTF-PD enabled her to expand the operations of her general store and food vending business. Using her dressmaking skills, she also started making ready-to-wear dresses to sell to her neighbors, and the cumulative income allowed her to support the education of her children. Three of her children have helped out in the family expenses since they graduated from school and began earning their own income. Her business now nets her an average profit of PHP 2,000 per month.

In her previous loan she borrowed Php 11,000 which she used as additional capital for the general store and food-vending business. The loan was fully repaid on time. She plans to use her 16th cycle loan amounting to PHP 11,000 to purchase additional items for her RTW business and the general store. The income from these will be used for her food-vending business.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a mere $1 a day, to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To buy additional items for her ready-to-wear clothing business and her general store

loans.name: Koem Ly

Mrs. Koem Ly M. is a farmer who owns a 1 hectare field of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Aside from this plantation, she is a pig breeder. Since her pig breeding business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing three more pigs and feed.

Mrs. Koem Ly M. is 26 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Chhet Sam, is a construction worker. He is on the right in the photo. They live in Chamkar Deap village in Takeo province. She hopes to increase their income and improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy three pigs and feed

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

Her husband, Mr. Chrun Sao, helps her in the business. Mrs. Sarou K. has a child who is attending a primary school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for sell to earn more income.

loans.name: Vanny

In this plantation, they face an obstacle because their field is infertile soil. Thus, Mrs. Vanny K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make the crop more productive. She is 51 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is a recycling collector while the others two are farmers and the remaining two are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make the crop more productive.

loans.name: Yim

Aside from this plantation, she is duck breeder to make duck eggs for sell in the local market. Since her poultry business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more 100 ducks for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Nhoung Bross, is a recycling collector. Mrs. Yim K. is 28 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.name: Tahir

loans.use: to buy 4 calves

loans.name: Sehrinaz

texts.en:
This kind woman is a mother of 3 children. She lives in Fuzuly region. 4 years ago she started sewing business. 
Sehrinaz was born in 1952. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy cloth and necessary things for improving her business.

loans.use: to buy cloth and necessary things for improving her sewing business

loans.name: Estelvina Irene

texts.es:
La señora Estelvina M. tiene 49 años de edad, vive en el anexo de villa libertad de la capital de Managua, casada, su esposo de profesión albañil, le ayuda económicamente, tiene cuatros hijos, mejorar su nivel de vida por medio del aumento de sus ventas. Su negocio  es la venta de 
Cosméticos, ropas, desde hace siete años tiene su negocio el cual ha ido aumentando las cantidades de inventario. Ha encontrado dificultades en este transcurso de tiempo como pérdidas de mercaderías por clientes que no pagaron, por que da al crédito como al contado. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lograra comprar mercadería como: ropa interior, zapatos, perfumería y artículos del hogar logrando una variedad de productos y mayores utilidades, lo cual espera mejores expectativas. Agradece a la institución por hacer posible este incremento de mercadería.
texts.en:
Estelvina M. is 49 years old and lives in the Villa Libertad section of the capital city, Managua. She is married and has four children; her husband is a mason by trade and helps her economically. Estelvina wants to improve the family's quality of life by increasing her sales. Her business is selling cosmetics and clothing. During the seven years that she has operated her business, her inventory has been gradually expanding. She has faced some difficulties over the course of time, such as the loss of merchandise to customers who do not pay, since she sells on credit as well as for cash. Thanks to the loan from Afodenic, she will be able to purchase additional types of merchandise such as underwear, shoes, perfumes and household items, broadening the variety of products and thus increasing her potential profits, for which she has high hopes. She is grateful to the institution for allowing her to expand the range of merchandise she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing additional merchandise such as underwear, shoes and perfume

loans.name: Juana Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Juana S. de 45 años de edad, habitante del barrio Villa Reconciliación, soltera, tiene tres hijos, como planes seguir creciendo en su negocio  para obtener mayores utilidades,  madre soltera y por dificultades que se presentó ella inicio con su propio negocio con pocas cantidades de mercadería, desde hace once años tiene su pulpería en el tiempo que lleva con su negocio ha ido aumentando su inventario. Agradece a la institución por el préstamo ya que será invertido en compra de productos como: granos básicos, lácteos, golosinas, gaseosa, y productos de limpiezas. Y ofrecer a sus clientes la variedad. El cual espera captar clientes nuevos, y poder ofrecer a su familia mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Juana S., 45, lives in the Villa Reconciliación. She is single and has three children. She plans to for her business to keep growing to get better profits. As a single mother facing some difficulties, she started her own business with a small amount of merchandise. She has had her mini market for 11 years. In the time she has had the business she has increased her inventory. She is grateful to the institution for the loan that she will use to buy products like basic grains, dairy products, sweets, soft drinks, and cleaning products. This will provide her customers with variety. She hopes to get new customers this way and be able to offer her family better opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains, dairy products, and sweets

loans.name: Cristhiam Valeska

texts.es: La joven Cristhiam B. de 30 años de edad, soltera  reside con sus padres  en barrio Máximo Jerez en la capital de Managua, joven emprendedora tiene su propio negocio una pequeña ferretería donde vende variedad de productos de calidad accesible al bolsillo del cliente. Este negocio lo inicio en sociedad con su hermano, pero luego le compro su parte, el cual administra sola. Desde hace cuatro años, Este es su primer ciclo en Afodenic y lo hizo con el propósito de invertir en productos de mayor rotación, como: zinc, perlinez, golosos, bidones de pintura en variedad de colores ya que estos meses se vende mucho por los tiempos de navidad. Se siente contenta por el financiamiento ya que lograra captar clientes nuevos, como mejorar las ventas al vender lo que el cliente demanda, también por la taza de interés baja que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Young woman Cristhiam B. is 30 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the Máximo Jerez neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She is a young entrepreneur who has her own business in a small hardware store where she sells a variety of quality products that are affordable for her customers. She started this business in partnership with her brother, but later she bought his share of it, and she has run it by herself for four years. This is her first loan with Afodenic and she did it with the purpose of investing in a better rotation of products such as zinc, beams, sweets, and color paint barrels since in these months they are sold a lot because of the Christmas season. She is content with the financing since she will be able to obtain new customers and be able to increase her sales along with her customers’ demand. She is also grateful for the low interest rate that the institution offers.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of zinc, beams, and paint barrels

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: La señora Juana López de 43 años de edad, su negocio es la elaboración de manualidades, hace bellos manteles bordados,  cortinas los cuales los vende al extranjero. Desde pequeña aprendió a tejer pero nunca imagino que seria su profesión, la cual hasta hoy ejerce para ayudar a su familia. Reside en el barrio Laureles Sur en  la capital de Managua, su esposo  es mecánico, tiene dos hijos  el mayor casado y uno menor que estudia, sus planes es poder terminar de hacer su casa. Con este financiamiento comprara lana, tela, para hacer sus manualidades  y poder abrir mas mercado en el extranjero ya que como gustan mucho son muchos los pedidos que le hacen por su estilo bonito. Agradece Afodenic por hacer posible aumentar el inventario de su negocio lo cual es de muchos beneficios para la captación de clientes, como las ganancias que obtendrá mediante las ventas.

loans.use: Comprar lana, tela, para invertir mas en las ventas

loans.name: Florinda Dominga

texts.es: La señora Florinda Dominga es originaria de la  aldea Vasquez del municipio de Totonicapan es casa con  cuatro hijos es viuda, hace diez años inicio con su negocio la gran dificultad que se tiene es la falta de capital que se tiene para incrementar su capital su principales punto de venta los dias martes y sabado  en la plaza del mercado municipal de Totonicapan en la venta de verduras y frutas, con los ingreso que obtiene por la venta ha podido casar adelante a su familia hoy necesita del apoyo de ASDIR de un credito para surtir su producto.

loans.use: Ampliación de Capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora Maria R. es originaria del la comunidad de chuixchimal del municipio de Totonicapan a tres kilometros  de la ciudad ella inicio su propio negocio hace quince años y vende todos los dias en el interior del mercado municipal de Totonicapan en la venta de verduras,frutas, y pollo ella solicita un credito en las oficina de ASDIR para surtir su mercaderia por motivo que se aproxima la fecha de los difuntos y las fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria R. is from Chuixchimal, Totonicapan, three kilometers from the city. She began her own business 15 years ago. Every day, she sells fruit, vegetables, and chicken in the Totonicapan municipal market. Mrs. R. requests a loan through the ASDIR office to stock up on merchandise, because The Day of the Dead and the year-end holidays are approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in Capital

loans.name: Rosa Jazmina

texts.es: La joven Rosa S. de 29 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua,, trabaja en venta en una tienda  del uno dos tres donde venden variedad de productos, tiene dos años de laborar y su mayor deseo es poder hacer un cuarto y tener sus propias cosas para un futuro, el cual en unos meses será madre aunque sea madre soltera hará lo posible para que no le falte nada. Vive con sus padres los cuales siempre la apoyan. Este es su segundo ciclo en Afodenic el cual comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y otros para hacer su cuarto y poder estar en mejores condiciones cuando nazca su bebe. Agradece a la institución por la oportunidad de hacer posible su sueño de poder tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
The Young Rosa S. is 29 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She works in a shop where she sells a variety of products. She has worked this way for 2 years and her biggest desire is to be able to make a room and have her own things for the future. She will be a mother in a few months and being a single mother she will do everything possible so that her child won’t lack anything. She lives with her parents who always support her. This is her second loan with Afodenic in which she will buy construction materials such as: stone, cement, iron, and other products to make her room and be able to be in better conditions when her baby is born. She is thankful to the institution for the opportunity to make possible her dream of having her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a room

loans.name: Julia Patricia

texts.es: Doña Julia S. de 45 años de edad, reside en el barrio la primavera en la capital de Managua,  con tres hijos que estudian,  se desempeña como docente desde  hace quince años, el cual se graduó  en la normal y pudo a mucho esfuerzo sacar su licenciatura. Pero su mayor deseo es poder tener su propio negocio para mejorar la economía de su familia, y poder dar estudios a sus tres hijos para que gocen de  mayores oportunidades. Con este crédito es su segundo ciclo el cual comprara materiales de construcción para hacer y poner un inodoro para estar en una higiene mejor. Da las gracias Afodenic por el beneficio que obtendrá con este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Julia S. is 45 years old and lives in the La Primavera neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. She has three children who are in school. She has been employed as a teacher for 15 years; after graduating from the teacher training school she put much effort into getting her license. But her biggest wish is to be able to have her own business to improve the economic situation of her family, and allow her three children to get a good education so that they can enjoy better opportunities. With this loan, which will be her second loan cycle, she will buy construction materials so that she can put in a new toilet for improved hygiene. She is grateful to AFODENIC for the benefits that she will obtain through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials to put in a new toilet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria Pascuala

texts.es: Doña Maria Pascuala es originaria de la zona 3 del municipio de Totonicapan  es casada con tres hijo, ella inicia su propio negocio en el año dos mil  en la venta de verduras y pollo pero en el puesto donde ella vendia el negocio no hera rentable por lo que decide cambiar su negocio en el dos mil seis  en la venta de productos de plasticos desde esa fecha sus ingresos han mejorado por lo tanto necesita incrementar su producto  ya que se aproxima las fiesta de fin de año como el dia de los difuntos, como la manifiesta que es favorable compra por mayor en la ciudad de Guatemal.
texts.en:
Maria Pascuala is from the Zona 3 in the Totonicapán municipality. She is married and has three children. She started her own business in 2000. She sold vegetables and chicken. However, the place where she sold was not profitable. She decided to change her business. In 2006 she started selling plastic products. Since that time her income has improved. She needs to increase her product because the end of the year holidays like the Day of the Dead are approaching. She says that it is favorable to buy wholesale in the city of Guatemal.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Doña Francisca T. de Cuarenta y cinco años de edad casada con originaria de la comunidad de Xantun del Municipio de Totonicapan  su actividad principal es la venta de ropa para damas, ella inicio su negoci hace diez años el problema que se tiene  es la falta de capital, por ser una persona muy sencilla las instituciones bancarias no confia en ella, manifiesta que escucho un anuncio por una emisora que la asociacion ASDIR da credito con requisitos factibles ya que dicho credito lo invertira en la compra de chalinas, para esta epocas son muy famosos por la epoca de frio del departamento Totonicapan.

loans.use: Ampliacion de Capital

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is a 29 year old father of one who runs a pharmacy in Kangemi, Nairobi. He has been in this business for the last two years after working in a pharmacy. He is requesting for a loan of Ksh. 40,000 in order to add stock of medicine. He hopes to open more outlets in other regions to serve more Kenyans and start selling medicine wholesale. He describes himself as successful and hardworking.

About Kiva's partner Faulu Kenya:

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Sabas

texts.es: El señor Sabas vive con su esposa la señora Emelia y son padres de familia de dos pequeñitos y ellos iniciaron un negocio propio de elaboración y venta de tortillas de harina, negocio que tienen establecido y aun pequeño desde hace 2 años, están tramitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima como harina, rexal, manteca etc.; para elaborar su producto que está gustando a la ciudadanía ya que las colocan en tienditas de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Sabas lives with his wife, Emelia, and they have two small children. They started their own business making flour tortillas. They established their small business two years ago. They are asking for this loan to buy raw materials like flour, baking powder, and shortening, etc. to make their product. People enjoy their product, which is located in grocery stores.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make flour tortillas

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 47 year old dairy farmer who lives and runs her business in Gitaru Nairobi. She has been in this business for the last ten years and hopes to increase her stock to ten dairy cows. Ruth is requesting for her fourth loan of Kes. 50,000 after successful repayment of three loans to enable her buy an additional cow. A mother of four, Ruth hopes to be a key supplier of milk in Gitaru area. She describes herself as successful and blessed.



About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Maricruz

texts.es: La señora Maricruz I. es casada y vive en casa con su esposo el señor Francisco Javier y son padres de 2 niños hermosos, ella trabaja en una farmacia desde hace un año en el área de mostrador, su esposo labora para un taller mecánico contando con una antigüedad de 3 años. Son una familia establecida, unida y trabajadora que buscan una mejor comodidad para su familia y un mejor futuro para sus hijos, por tal motivo están tramitando este crédito ya que desean construir un cuarto en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maricruz I. is married and lives with her husband, Francisco Javier. They have two lovely children. She has worked at the counter in a pharmacy for one year. Her husband has worked in a mechanic’s shop for three years. They are an established, united, hard-working family looking for greater comfort for their family and a better future for their children. They are asking for a loan because they wish to build a room on their house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room on their house

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 23 year old mother of one. She lives and operates her retail shop in the Mukuru slums of Nairobi. She has been in this business for three years and hopes to develop it into a well established business.

She is requesting a loan of Ksh. 50,000 to enable her to add stock of household items and foodstuffs. She hopes to educate her children to the highest level and buy them a home. She describes herself as hardworking, focussed and determined.

About Kiva's partner Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

texts.en:
Dominic owns a grocery in the Kwa njenga part of the Mukuru slum in Nairobi. Dominic has requested his first loan of Kes. 50,000 in order to open another outlet after running the current one successfully for eight years. He hopes to one day open multiple locations for his grocery and start exporting fruits.  Married with two children, Dominic also cares for his parents. He describes himself as patient and honest.



About Faulu Kenya:

texts.en:
Judice is a 29 year old mother of one who lives and operates a successful secretarial services business in Mukuru slums Nairobi. She was running a grocery previously before opening this business three years ago. She is requesting for a loan of Kes. 80,000 to buy computers and printers. Judice hopes to grow her business into a well established company and buy rental units. She describes herself as determined and focused.


About Faulu Kenya:

texts.en:
Hilda is a 25 year old businesslady who runs a retail shop, a food kiosk and also imports clothes for sale in Nairobi. She had a property management business before starting the retail shop two years ago.

She is requesting for a loan of Ksh. 45,000 to add stock of foodstuffs. A mother of two, Hilda desires to bring up a stable family, grow her business into a well-known store and have an established business. She describes herself as trustworthy and hardworking.

About Kiva's partner Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi owns an education institute in Mukuru Kwa njenga slums in Nairobi. She has run this business successfully for the last four years alongside rental units and a scrap metal depot.  Naomi has requested a loan of Kes. 50,000 in order to buy more assets for smooth running of the school. Naomi hopes to give solution to the challenge of illiteracy by growing her young school into a fully fledged learning institution. She describes herself as hardworking and focussed.



About Faulu Kenya:

A 35 year-old father of three, Joseph has been running his butchery for the last four years and hopes to increase his business to admirable levels. He is requesting a first loan of Kes. 20,000 in order to open the same business in a different location. He desires to raise an admirable family and describes himself as focused and reliable.

texts.fr: Elise G. est une femme âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle habite à Assahoun, une ville située à 70 kilomètres de Kpalimé. C’est une revendeuse de tissus. Avec ce crédit, elle voudrait diversifier les tissus pour attirer la clientèle. Avec les bénéfices obtenus, elle aimerait ouvrir un compte et épargner de l’argent.

loans.name: Amancio

texts.en:
Mr. Amancio is married and  is very responsible, spiritual and entrepreneurial. His children are living in Spain to look for better and more successful work. He has statues in his house of various design to rent.
 
He has a food store. Before that, he had a service to transport children. This loan is to augment merchandise that is in demand, as well as alternative ones that would make capital. With the loan he will buy corn, maté (tea), sugar, noodles and other things to sell in his shop.

loans.use: With the loan he will buy corn, maté, sugar, noodles and other things to sell

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.en:
Mr. Cornelio is married and has one small son. He dedicates himself to sale- he has sold tapioca for six years. He has his own house and protects his tapioca there. He wants to buy a piece of land where he can store his tapioca.
He wants a Vehicle to make even more capital, and works very hard. With the loan he plans to buy a tapioca in large cuantities.

loans.use: With the loan he plans to buy a tapioca in large cuantities.

loans.name: Mouena

texts.en:
Mouena C. is a 23 years-year-old woman living in the town of Fagalii B.  She is married and has 1 child infant-aged children.  To make a living, Mouena owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Mouena has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately $600 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Mouena joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Mouena has successfully repaid a previous loan of $1000 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase harvesting equipment.  Mouena is now requesting a new loan of $1500 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Mouena plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Vasati

texts.en:
Vasati U. is a 41-year-old woman living in the town of Taufusi.  She is married and has four adult children.  To make a living, Vasati owns & operates a business selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Vasati has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately $1250 WST a month from these activities.

In 2007, Vasati joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Vasati has successfully repaid a previous loan of $1600 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  Vasati is now requesting a new loan of $2200 WST, which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business.  The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Vasati from SPBD.  Vasati plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.en:
Mr. Juan Carlos is married and has three small sons. Juan Carlos and his wife have a dinner restaurant. His wife helps in the kitchen and he attends to the clients. 

He has 16 years of experience selling antiques, but one day he wants to rent a plot of land to sell things. He is a very good entrepreneur and thinks it is very important to know about business. With the loan, he wants to buy soda, beer, oatmeal, and other things to sell.

loans.use: To buy soda, beer, oatmeal, and other things to sell

loans.name: Iuvale

texts.en:
Iuvale S. is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of Taufusi S.  She is married and has 4 school-aged children.  To make a living, Iuvale owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Iuvale has been engaged in this business for over 1 years and earns approximately 350 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Iuvale joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Iuvale is requesting for the first time a loan from SPBD.    Iuvale is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Iuvale plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Paula

texts.en:
Paula T. is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of Alamutu E. She is married and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, Paula owns & operates a business selling fried foods in the local community.  Paula has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

Paula joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Paula has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  Paula is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by Paula from SPBD.  Paula plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
Elisapeta L.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She is a 54-year-old woman living in the town of Matatufu. Elisapeta is married and has five adult children. She has just started this business and earns approximately 400 talas a month.

Elisapeta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Elisapeta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1750 talas from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Elisapeta is now requesting a new loan of 1500 talas which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her fourth loan from SPBD. Elisapeta plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

To make a living, Katarina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a bakery.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from baking & selling a variety of baked goods in the local community.  Katarina has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately $350 WST a month from these activities.

In 2006, Katarina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Katarina has successfully repaid a previous loan of $1250 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase baking equipment.  Katarina is now requesting a new loan of $1500 WST which will be used to purchase additional cooking ingredients.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Katarina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese Ulualo M. is a 46 years-year-old woman living in the town of Vailele.  She is married and has 6 children adult -aged children.  To make a living, Akenese owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling soft drinks in the local community.  Akenese has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately $520 WST a month from these activities.

In 2007, Akenese joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Akenese has successfully repaid a previous loan of $1250 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  Akenese is now requesting a new loan of $2000 WST which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business.  The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Akenese plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

loans.name: María Ángela

texts.es: María Ángela Q. R. de 34 años de edad reside Mejicanos en el departamento de San Salvador. María es madre soltera vive con su hija Jenny de 12 años de edad estudiante de básica. María se dedica a la confección de ropa hace diez años, con su experiencia ahora María confecciona ropa de bebé en grandes cantidades para ser vendida con sus vecinos y otras exportadas al país de Guatemala, el crédito que María solicita es para comprar tela que le permita aumentar la producción de ropa.
texts.en:
María Ángela Q. R. is 34 years old and lives in Mejicanos, which is located in the department of San Salvador. She is a single mother who lives with her 12 year old daughter Jenny, who is currently a student. María has been making clothes for 10 years. She currently makes baby clothes in large quantities in order to sell to her neighbors and for export to Guatemala.

María is requesting a loan to buy fabric so that she can increase her production of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Mirna De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Mirna D. Los Ángeles S. D. G. resiD. en Cojutepeque municipio del departamento D. Cuscatlán. Mirna tiene 34 años D. edad vive con su primogénito Jasón D. 2 años D. edad y su esposo que se dedica a la confección D. ropa. Mirna tiene un negocio donD. venD. accesorios para dama, ropa e insumos para confección D. textiles, Mirna solicita este crédito para comprar tela que utilizara su esposo en la confección D. trajes D. graduación que en unas semanas serán solicitados por muchos clientes, también desean surtir el negocio D. nueva mercadería.

loans.use: compra de tela para trajes de graduacion y surtir su negocio

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en:
Epenesa B. is a 19 year-old woman living in the town of Solaua.  She is married and has 1 child infant-aged children.  To make a living, Epenesa owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  Epenesa has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately $550 WST a month from these activities.

Epenesa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Epenesa is requesting for the first time a loan from SPBD.    Epenesa is now requesting a new loan of $1000 WST which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Epenesa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

loans.name: Saina

texts.en:
Saina F. is a 23-year-old woman living in the town of Samatau 3. She is single and does not have any children. To make a living, Saina owns and operates a bakery. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from baking and selling a variety of confections, such as cookies and cakes, in the local community. Saina has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 450 WST a month from these activities.

Saina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Saina is requesting a loan from SPBD in the amount of 1000 WST, which will be used to purchase baking equipment. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Saina from SPBD. Saina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:
