loans.use: To purchase baking equipment

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo D. C. is from the town of Sta.Cruz, Poblacion, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. He is 50 years old and married with five grown children. To make a living, Edgardo owns and operates a business, a motorcycle repair shop for community members. Edgardo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $87 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Edgardo joined Paglaum-MPC, a Kiva field partner, to gain access to financial services that would enable him to engage in business activities and thereby improve his living situation. He has successfully repaid previous loans which were used to purchase some materials and additional products for his business. Edgardo is requesting a new loan that will again be used to purchase materials amounting to PHP8,000. This will be his second loan from Paglaum-MPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family.

loans.use: To buy materials for his business.

loans.name: Estrilia

texts.en:
Estrilia A., 57 years old, is married to Rodelio and a resident of Siare Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. Her husband is a fisherman. The fish caught by her husband will be sold at the public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years already. 


Because they wanted to buy fishing nets, both agreed to join Paglaum MPC on January 30, 2008 to have access to a loan. But aside from financial assistance they received, they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance, savings etc. Since she wants to be more productive, she is applying for a loan amounting to 10,000PHP. She believes that with Paglaum’s help, and with the patience & diligence of her husband, she is looking forward to being a successful vendor someday and can own a stall at the public market.

loans.use: Additonal Capital for business

loans.name: María Cruz

texts.es: María Cruz A. D. F. D. 42 años D. edad, resiD. en Soyapango en la capital D. El Salvador. María vive con sus dos hijas y su esposo quien se dedica a la carpintería. María tiene una tienda con seis años D. experiencia, el negocio se encuentra ubicado en su casa donD. la mayoría D. sus clientes son los vecinos D. la zona, el crédito que solicita María es para solidificar su tienda y también la carpintería D. su esposo que urge D. materiales para aumentar la producción D. sus muebles.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Alexander De Jesús

texts.es: Alexander De Jesús A. A. reside en el municipio de Soyapango ubicado en San Salvador. Alexander cuenta con 33 años de edad, vive con su mamá, hemana y sobrinos menores de edad. Alexander se dedica a la venta de ropa y camisas elaboradas por él, Alexander es el hombre de la casa, el vela por bienestar y estabilidad económica de la familia, el crédito que solicita es para incrementar sus ventas las cuales serán de gran ayuda para los gatos de su hogar.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: José Mauricio

texts.es: José Mauricio V. A. reside en la capital de El Salvador. José tiene 32 años de edad, vive con su esposa, sus tres hijos, una sobrina y su madre. José lleva consigo una gran responsabilidad al velar por el bienestar y estabilidad económica de su familia, el se dedica a su negocio, una panadería que surte a muchas tiendas de los alrededores y colonias cercanas, José necesita de su automóvil para movilizar con eficiencia sus productos a sus clientes, el crédito que solicita es para su carro; ya que la caja de velocidades se ha arruinado y necesita cambiarla.

loans.use: Reparacion de su automovil

loans.name: Kelvin Odir

texts.es: Kelvin Odir G. Q. de 30 años de edad, reside el departamento de Cuscatlán. Kelvin vive con su esposa y sus dos hijas de 9 y 5 años de edad. Kelvin tiene su propio negocio el cual ofrece servicios de rótulos para publicidad o anuncios varios, el negocio de Kelvin tiene ocho años de experiencia al servicio de sus clientes, ofreciendo calidad y la mejor atención, el crédito que solicita Kelvin es para invertir en productos que utiliza para la producción de rótulos, ya que afortunadamente su negocio ha ido tomando fuerza y teniendo una gran demanda

loans.use: materiales para la impresion de rotulos

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia C. M. de 40 años de edad, vive en Apopa municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Su esposo y tres hijas menores de edad componen el grupo familiar de Sonia, una persona muy trabajadora y responsable. Sonia tiene un taller de costura con nueve años de experiencia, elabora variedad de ropa a la medida y otras para comercializar, el crédito que solicita es para comprar insumos para la producción de sus textiles

loans.use: Tela para la elaboracion de ropa

loans.name: Dinorah Maritza

texts.es: Dinorah Maritza M. D. H. D. 41 años D. edad resiD. en Cuscatancingo municipio del departamento D. San Salvador. Dinorah vive solamente con su hijo D. cuatro años D. edad, la casa donD. actualmente vive la alquila ya que no cuenta con suficiente capacidad económica para compra D. su casa, Dinorah tiene una panadería la cual ha instalado en su domicilio hace cuatro años, crédito que solicita es para insumos que utiliza en la elaboración D. pan.

loans.use: Compra de insumos para su panaderia

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Marta C. D. M. resiD. en el departamento D. Sonsonate. Marta tiene 51 años D. edad, es una persona muy trabajadora y religiosa, vive con su esposo quien trabaja como motorista D. transporte público y sus hijas D. 16 y 5 años D. edad. Marta tiene una en su casa la cual ha instalado después D. muchos sacrificios y ahorros que hicieron con su esposo, la tienda tiene tan solo tres años, el crédito que solicita Marta es para surtir su negocio y para poder seguir apoyando a su esposo con los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Marta C. D. M. lives in the department of Sonsonate. She is 51 years old and a very hardworking and religious person. Marta lives with her husband, who works as a public transportation driver, and their two daughters (ages 16 and 5).

She manages a grocery store out of her home. Marta started her business after undertaking many sacrifices and utilizing her husband’s savings. Her store has now been open for three years. She is requesting a loan to restock her business so that she can continue helping her husband with the family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: Salvador O. reside en el municipio de Ciudad Delgado del departamento de San Salvador. Salvador tiene 59 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad. Salvador y su esposa se sienten orgullosos de todos sus hijos a quienes les dieron una educación y ahora se encuentran trabajando. La esposa de Salvador se dedica a la venta de fruta en las cercanía de una maquila de la zona y Salvador cuenta con un taxi el cual tiene hace once años, el crédito que Salvador solicita es para revisión y reparación de su vehículo, su arma diaria de trabajo, ya que él es consciente de mantener un vehículo en optimas condiciones para dar un servicio de seguridad a sus pasajeros.
texts.en:
Salvador O. lives in Delgado City, which is located in the department of San Salvador. He is 59 years old and lives with his wife and four adult children. Salvador and his wife are proud of the fact that they were able to provide all of their children with an education. They are all currently working. Salvador’s wife sells fruit near the local grain mill. He has been driving a taxi for eleven years.

The loan Salvador is requesting will be used to overhaul and repair his vehicle, which he uses every day for work. He is conscious of keeping his vehicle in optimal condition so that he can provide secure transportation for his passengers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora Alicia A. H. reside en Mejicanos en El departamento de San Salvador. Dora tiene 43 años de edad se encuentra divorciada y vive solamente con sus tres hijos. Dora tiene su propio negocio donde vende variedad de bebidas y boquitas, el crédito que solicita Dora es para surtir su negocio ya que es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta Dora y sus hijos, con este crédito podrá aumentar sus ventas y las sus ganancias.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Esperanza Vilma

texts.es: Esperanza Vilma V. López de 51 años de edad, reside en la capital de El Salvador. Esperanza tiene 51 años de edad vive con su esposo quien trabaja como zapatero y sus dos hijas. Esperanza tiene una tienda en la cual recibe ayuda de sus hijas para atenderla, también elabora tamales para vender con los vecinos de la zona, Esperanza es muy trabajadora y ayuda a su esposo en los gastos familiares, el crédito que solicita es para invertir en sus negocio y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Esperanza Vilma V. López is 51 years old and lives in the capital city of San Salvador. She lives with her husband, who works as a shoemaker, and their two daughters. Esperanza operates a grocery store with the help of her daughters. She also makes tamales to sell to the neighbors in her community.

Esperanza is a hard worker and helps her husband with the family expenses. The loan she is requesting will be invested into her business so that she can generate more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business

loans.name: Jeremías

texts.es: Jeremías F. Q. reside en Atiquizaya en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Jeremías tiene 31 años de edad vive con sus suegros, su esposa y su hija. La familia Q. es muy unida, Jeremías tiene una venta de de materiales de construcción donde recibe ayuda de su esposa en logística de ventas, también maneja un camión de su propiedad el cual transporta los materiales de construcción hasta la puerta de sus clientes, el crédito que solicita es para invertir en su negocio comprando mayor cantidad de materiales que le permitan aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Jeremías F. Q. resides in Atiquizaya in the department of Ahuachapán. Jeremías is 31 years old and lives with his in-laws, his wife, and his daughter. The Q. family is very close. Jeremías sells construction materials and receives help from his wife with logistics. He also drives a truck, which he owns, to transport the construction materials to the doors of his customers. The loan he is applying for is for investing in his business by purchasing a greater quantity of materials that will permit him to increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock his business

loans.name: Andrés Rumaldo

texts.es: Andrés Rumaldo M., reside en Tacuba en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Andrés vive con su esposa quien le ayuda en el negocio, juntos trabajan en la tienda que se encuentra ubicada en su casa, donde vende variedad de productos consumo, con diez años de experiencia en el negocio, Andrés y su esposa son muy conocidos en la zona donde tienen una clientela muy estable, el crédito que solicitan es para surtir su negocio que carece de variedad de productos demandados por sus clientes.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: María Marta

texts.es: María Marta A. M. de 32 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Cabañas junto a su esposo y  sus tres  hijos. María ayuda a su esposo en los gastos de la familia, ya que el esposo de María trabaja como agricultor, donde recibe un sueldo muy bajo que no cubre las necesidades básica de la familia, es por eso, es que María ha instalado una tienda la cual le permite generar ganancias que son un gran soporte en la economía familiar, pero ahora María solicita de un crédito para invertir en su negocio surtiéndolo de mas productos que le ayuden a incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María Marta A. M., 32 years of age, lives in the department of Cabañas together with her husband and three children. María helps her husband with the family expenses since her husband is employed as an agricultural worker and receives a very low salary which does not cover the family’s basic necessities. That’s why María has opened a shop which allows her to generate profits that are of great support to the family finances.

Now, María is applying for a loan in order to invest in her business, supplying it with more products that will help her to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her business

loans.name: Gladys Elita

texts.es:
La señora Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado de Cuturapi del Distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente tiene 1 hijo, vive en Cuturapi y estudio educación superior (profesora).

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 5 años e inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de ferretería.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar mayor cantidad de artículos de ferretería como candados, repuestos de luz, artículos de limpieza, herramientas, palas, picos, etc. Todo esto lo lleva directamente al Cusco, la señora también se dedica a la cría de animales menores.

Su mayor deseo es tener una ferretería grande.

A ella le  gustan las reuniones, los ahorros y la puntualidad.

loans.use: Para la compra de candados, repuestos de luz, artículos de limpieza, herramientas, palas, picos, etc.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 39 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 02 hijos, La señora Rosa estudio educación primaria completa, vive en el Barrio 24 de Junio Cuturapi.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 9 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que invirtió la compra de repuestos de autos.

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra adornos para autos los trae directamente de Lima, la señora Rosa también se dedica a la cría de ganado mayor y engorde.

Su deseo es poner una tienda de auto partes en Juliaca.

A ella le gustan las reuniones donde se divierte mucho y comparte sus experiencias.

loans.use: Para la compra de adornos para autos.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
La señora Vicenta es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado D. Cuturapi del Distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 63 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada tiene 6 hijos, vive en Cuturapi sector Ventanilla y estudio educación primaria incompleta (2do grado).

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 8 años en otro Banco Comunal luego se vino a este, inicio su préstamo con la suma D. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. compra venta D. ropa.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ropa para su negocio en las ferias D. la zona, por toro lado se dedica tambien a la compra venta D. ganado mayor.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan los ahorros y la puntualidad.

loans.use: Para la compra de ropa.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Sabina es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado D. Cuturapi del Distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 56 años D. edad, D. estado civil viuda tiene 9 hijos, vive en Cuturapi sector Ventanilla y estudio educación primaria incompleta (2do grado).

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 9 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma D. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. compra venta D. cristalería.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar plásticos D. todo tamaño y calidad al por mayor para venderlo en las ferias D. la zona.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Sra. Sabina is a member of the Communal Bank “Cuturapi”, which is located in the central village of Cuturapi in Yunguyo District, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 56 years old, widowed, and has 9 children. Sabina lives in Cuturapi and has a 2nd graD. education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 9 years. Her first loan, which was in the amount of 300 soles, enabled her to increase her business capital for buying and selling glassware.

Sabina is now requesting a new loan in the amount of 500 soles so that she can buy plastics of all sizes in wholesale quantities. She plans to resell them at the regional fairs.

Her greatest wish is to continue working. Sabina enjoys her savings and the Communal Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plastics for resale

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La señora Ángela es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado D. Cuturapi del Distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 66 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada tiene 3 hijos, vive en Cuturapi sector Ventanilla y no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años aproximadamente no recuerda bien, inicio su préstamo con la suma D. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio compra venta D. ganado menor.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino y también ropa americana, en todas sus actividades siempre le ayuda su esposo.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan los ahorros y las charlas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ángela is a member of the community bank "Cuturapi" in the very small town Cuturapi of the Yunguyo District, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 66 years old and married with three children. She lives in the Ventanilla area of Cuturapi. She did not have the opportunity to study. Ángela has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for about three years. Her first loan was for 300 soles and allowed her to increase capital for her business buying and selling small livestock. Currently, she is asking for a loan of 1000 soles, which would allow her to buy sheep as well as American-style clothing. Her husband helps her in all her activities. Her biggest wish is to continue working. She likes savings and chats.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sheep and clothing

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen  es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado D. Cuturapi del Distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 65 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada tiene 2 hijos, vive en Cuturapi sector Peña y no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 9 años inicio su préstamo con la suma D. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio compra venta D. polleras.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar polleras, mantas, ponchos, también comprara ganado menor ovinos y chanchos.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan los ahorros y las facilidades en los préstamos.

loans.use: Para la compra de polleras, mantas, ponchos.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado de Cuturapi del Distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil viuda tiene 3 hijos, vive en Cuturapi y estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 9 años inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio compra venta de especerías.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar comino. Orégano, pimienta, aji, vinagre, canela, maní, airampo, etc. Todo lo compra en Desaguadero y lo entrega en Puno. También se dedica a la cría de chanchos para engorde, para luego venderlo en las ferias de la zona.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de comino. Orégano, pimienta, aji, vinagre, canela, maní, airampo, etc.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Andrea es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado D. Cuturapi del Distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 42 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada tiene 5 hijos, vive en Cuturapi  villa Rios y estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 9 años inicio su préstamo con la suma D. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio compra venta D. artículos D. ferretería.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar artículos D. ferretería, toda su mercadería la trae D. La Paz Bolivia, y lo lleva directo al Cusco la señora también se dedica a la venta D. ganado mayor.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando y educar a sus hijos.

A ella le  gustan los ahorros y la puntualidad.

loans.use: Para la compra de articulos de ferreteria.

loans.name: Vilma Gladys

texts.es:
La señora Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado de Cuturapi del Distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 1 hijo, vive en Cuturapi  y estudio educación secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 9 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta ropa.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ropa al por mayor, por otro lado también comprara ají, toda su mercadería lo adquiere en Tacna, y lo comercializa en Desaguadero, Yunguyo y Juliaca.

Su mayor deseo es poder comprarse un carro.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones.

loans.use: para la compra de ropa al por mayor, y aji.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La señora Guillermina es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado de Cuturapi del Distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 60 años de edad, de estado civil separada tiene 5 hijos, vive en Cuturapi  y no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado menor.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino para engorde los cuales los vende en las ferias de la zona.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y los ahorros.

loans.use: Para la compra de ovinos.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La señora Fortunata es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado de Cuturapi del Distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 56 años de edad (todos ya casados), de estado civil casada tiene 3 hijos, vive en Cuturapi  Sector San Juan, y estudio educación primaria incompleta (2do grado).

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 9 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado menor.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino en las comunidades de la zona y venderlo luego de su mejora en las ferias zonales, Fortunata también se dedica a la cría de ganado mayor para engorde.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y las charlas.

loans.use: Para la compra de ovinos.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
La señora Basilia es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado D. Cuturapi del Distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 41 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada tiene 6 hijos, vive en Cuturapi  Barrio Villa Pilar y estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 9 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma D. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. compra venta D. cristalería.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar cristalería como jarras D. vidrio, vasos D. champagne, vasos D. gaseosa, tazas, vasos D. vino, etc. Además utensilios D. cocina, su mercadería la compra en Desaguadero y lo lleva directo a Arequipa cuenta con la ayuda D. su esposo.

Su mayor deseo es hacer crecer su negocio.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y la forma D. trabajo.

loans.use: Para la compra de jarras de vidrio, vasos de champagne, vasos de gaseosa, tazas, vasos de vino, etc. Además utensilios de cocina

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La señora Sofía es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado de Cuturapi del Distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 4 hijos, vive en Cuturapi  Barrio 24 de Junio y estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 7 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado menor.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado menor y/o mayor para engorde y cría, para venderlo en las ferias locales.

Su mayor deseo es que sus hijos sean profesionales.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y  la forma de trabajo
texts.en:
Sra. Sofía is a member of the Communal Bank “Cuturapi”, which is located in the central village of Cuturapi in Yunguyo District, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 37 years old, married, and has 4 children. She lives in the Cuturapi neighborhood of “24 de Junio” (June 24). Sofía has an elementary school education.

She began working with Manuela Ramos 7 years ago. She started with a loan of 300 soles, which allowed her to increase her business capital so that she could buy and sell livestock.

Sofía is now requesting a new loan of 2000 soles so that she can buy livestock (small and/or large animals) for fattening and breeding. She will sell them later at the local fairs. Her greatest wish is that children become professionals. She enjoys her savings and her line of work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep & cattle

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
La señora Gumercinda es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado de Cuturapi del Distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 45 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 8 hijos (3 a su cargo), vive en Cuturapi  Barrio Tupac Amaru y tuvo la oportunidad  de estudiar.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 5 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de alfombras.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar alfombras de todo tamaño los trae directamente de Lima y  los cuales los distribuye en Puno y Juliaca.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando en su negocio.

A ella le  gustan  la armonía y la puntualidad de las socias.
texts.en:
Sra. Gumercinda is a member of the Communal Bank “Cuturapi”, which is located in the central village of Cuturapi in Yunguyo District, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 45 years old, married, and has 8 children (3 are still dependents). Gumercinda lives in the Cuturapi neighborhood of Tupac Amaru. She had the opportunity to attend school.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 5 years. Her first loan of 300 soles enabled her to increase her business capital for buying and selling rugs.

Gumercinda is requesting a new loan of 1500 soles so that she can buy rugs of all sizes. She brings them directly from Lima and then sells them in Puno and Juliaca. Her greatest wish is to continue working at her business. She enjoys the group harmony and the punctuality of the Communal Bank members.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rugs

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado de Cuturapi del Distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 51 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 7 hijos (2 a su cargo), vive en Cuturapi  Barrio 24 de junio y estudio educación primaria incompleta 2do grado.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 9 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de alfombras.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar alfombras de todo tamaño Juana viaja a Lima para adquirir su mercadería para luego distribuirlo en Puno y Juliaca.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando para educar a sus hijos.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las charlas.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana is a member of the Communal Bank “Cuturapi”, which is located in the central village of Cuturapi in Yunguyo District, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 51 years old, married, and has 7 children (2 are still dependents). Juana lives in the Cuturapi neighborhood of “24 de Junio” (June 24). She has a 2nd grade education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 9 years. Her first loan of 300 soles enabled her to increase her business capital for buying and selling rugs.

Juana is requesting a new loan of 2000 soles so that she can buy rugs of all sizes. She travels to Lima to buy the merchandise and then sells her products in Puno and Juliaca. Her greatest wish is to continue working so that she can provide an education for her children. She enjoys her savings and the seminars.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rugs

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
La señora Dionisia es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado D. Cuturapi del Distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 52 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada tiene 9 hijos (6 a su cargo), vive en Cuturapi  Barrio 24 D. Junio  y tuvo la oportunidad  D. estudiar.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 5 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma D. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. compra venta D. artesanías.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar lanas D. colores lana D. ovino y alpaca para hilado, bayetas, para la fabricación D. frazadas, bolsas, llijllas, etc. Para la exportación desD. Cuzco, y Lima.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando con los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos ya que les ayuda mucho en su negocio.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y las facilidades en los préstamos.

loans.use: Para la compra ed lana de alpaca de colores, lana de ovino, bayetas.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.es:
La señora Bárbara es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado de Cuturapi del Distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 2 hijos, vive en Cuturapi  Barrio 24 de junio y estudio secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 1 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de alfombras.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 2500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar alfombras para que su compra le resulte mejor ella viaja a Lima  y luego lo comercializa en Puno y Juliaca, trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo.

Su mayor deseo es educar a sus hijos.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de alfombras.

loans.name: Luz Nelida

texts.es:
Luz Nelida es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” del centro poblado de Pusuyo del Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltera no tiene hijos, vive en la comunidad de Jichocollo y  estudio secundaria completa.

Ella  viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 ciclos, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado menor.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ovinos, cerdos, etc. Para venderlos en las ferias de la zona.

Su mayor deseo es comprarse una casa en Ilave.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las reuniones
texts.en:
Luz Nelida is a member of the “Gregoria Apaza” Communal Bank, which is located in the central village of Pusuyo in Ilave District, Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 20 years old, single, and does not have any children. Luz Nelida lives in the Jichocollo community and completed her high school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for the past 3 loan cycles. Her first loan of 500 soles allowed her to increase her business capital for buying and selling livestock.

Luz Nelida is currently requesting another loan of 500 soles to buy sheep, pigs, etc. She will resell the animals at the local fairs. Her greatest wish is to purchase a house in Ilave. She enjoys her savings and the Communal Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep, pigs, etc.

loans.name: Yanet Giovana

texts.es:
La señora Yanet es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” del centro poblado de Pusuyo del Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente tiene 01 hijo, vive en la Av. Panamericana y  estudio secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de cereales.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 2500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar quinua, trigo, cebada, habas, etc. Los mismos que los comercializan en las ferias de la zona.

Su mayor deseo es poner una tienda de venta de ropa.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros, las reuniones y las charlas.
texts.en:
Sra. Yanet is a member of the “Gregoria Apaza” Communal Bank, which is located in the central village of Pusuyo in Ilave District, Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 28 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 1 child. Yanet lives on Panamericana Avenue and completed her high school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. Her first loan of 300 soles allowed her to increase her business capital for buying and selling grain.

Yanet is currently requesting a new loan of 2500 soles to buy quinoa, wheat, barley, beans, etc. She will sell these products at the regional fairs. Her greatest wish is to open a clothing store. She enjoys her savings, the Communal Bank meetings, and the seminars.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase quinoa, wheat, barley, beans, etc.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Maria Magdalena es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” del centro poblado de Pusuyo del Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 60 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 08 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Pusuyo, no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir estudios.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 4 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado menor.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar algunas cabezas de ovino y porcino para mejorarlos y luego venderlos en las ferias zonales.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros, las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado ovino y porcino.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La señora Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” del centro poblado de Pusuyo del Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 02 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Pichincuta, estudio educación secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 1 año y medio, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado menor.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino para mejorarlos y luego venderlos en las ferias zonales.

Su mayor deseo es convertirse en mayorista de venta de ganado.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros.
texts.en:
Sra. Gladys is a member of the “Gregoria Apaza” Communal Bank, which is located in the central village of Pusuyo in Ilave District, Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 35 years old, married, and has 2 children. Gladys lives in the community of Pichincuta and completed her high school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for almost 1½ years. Her first loan of 300 soles allowed her to increase her business capital for buying and selling livestock.

Gladys is currently requesting a new loan of 500 soles to buy sheep to raise and later resell at the regional fairs. Her greatest wish is to become a livestock wholesaler. She enjoys her savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” del centro poblado D. Pusuyo del Distrito D. Ilave, Provincia D. el Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 45 años D. edad, D. estado civil viuda tiene 04 hijos, vive en la comunidad D. Pusuyo, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 4 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma D. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. compra venta D. aves D. corral.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 700.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino  y aves D. corral, ella los adquiere en Ilave y las comunidades cercanas y los venD. en las ferias D. la zona.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Juliana is a member of the Gregoria Apaza Communal Bank in the Pusuyo community center in the Ilave district, Collao province, Puno department. She is a 45 year old widow with four children. She lives in the Pusuyo community. She did not have the opportunity to get an education. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for almost four years. She started with a loan for 300 PEN, which allowed her to increase capital in her business of buying and selling poultry. She currently needs a new loan for 700 PEN, which will allow her to buy sheep and poultry. She gets them in Ilave and neighboring communities. She sells them in regional fairs. Her biggest desire is to continue working. She likes the savings and the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep and poultry

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” del centro poblado de Pusuyo del Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 55 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 09 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Pusuyo, estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 4 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado menor y aves de corral.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar  ganado ovino y lanas para elaboración de artesanías que luego los vende en Ilave.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y los ahorros.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado ovino, aves de corral y lanas de colores.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” del centro poblado de Pusuyo del Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 05 hijos, vive en el centro poblado de Coraraca, estudio educación secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 1 año y medio, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado menor.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado vacuno para mejorarlos y luego ella los comercializa en las ferias zonales que se realizan una ves por semana.

Su mayor deseo es convertirse en mayorista de venta de ganado.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Gregoria Apaza Communal Bank in the Pusuyo community center in the Ilave district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 38, married, and has five children. She lives in the town center of Coraraca. She has a high school education. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for almost a year and a half. She started with a loan for 300 PEN, which allowed her to increase the capital in her business of buying and selling livestock. She currently needs a new loan for 3,000 PEN, which will allow her to buy cattle. She will improve them and then sell them in the regional fairs that are held once a week. Her greatest desire is to become a wholesaler selling livestock. She likes the savings.

loans.use: To buy cattle

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 4 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado menor.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá aumentar su capital en su actual negocio de trasporte urbano, dice que con ello pagara el SOAT, la señora Neri tambien se dedica a la elaboracion de artesanias.

Su mayor deseo es darles una profesión a sus hijos

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las reuniones.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 4 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado menor.

Su mayor deseo es poder comprar una casa en Ilave.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y la puntualidad.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 1 año y medio, inicio su préstamo con la suma D. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. compra venta D. ganado menor.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/.1600.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá aumentar su capital para la compra D. ganado ovino y una vaca para engorD., los cuales luego D. la mejora los comercializara en las ferias D. la zona, nos cuenta que también se dedica a la crianza D. ganado y sus chacras.

Su mayor deseo es poder comprar mas ganado y ser mayorista.

A ella le  gustan   las reuniones.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Gregoria Apaza Communal Bank in the Pusuyo community center in the Ilave district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 51, married, and has eight children. She lives in the Inticaya community. She has an elementary school education. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one and a half years. She started with a loan for 300 PEN, which allowed her to increase the capital in her business of buying and selling livestock. She now needs a new loan for 1,600 PEN, which will allow her to buy sheep and a cow to fatten. After improving them, she sells them in regional fairs. She tells us that she also raises livestock and works her farm. Her biggest wish is to be able to buy more livestock and be a wholesaler. She likes the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep and a cow

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” del centro poblado de Pusuyo del Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 02 hijos, vive en el Barrio Bellavista, estudio educación secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 4 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de cereales.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y los eventos donde participan todas las mujeres.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the Gregoria Apaza Communal Bank in the Pusuyo community center in the Ilave district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 30, married, and has two children. She lives in the Bellavista neighborhood. She has a high school education. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for almost four years. She started with a loan for 300 PEN, which allowed her to increase the capital in her business of selling grains. She currently needs a new loan for 300 PEN, which will allow her to buy different colors of wool and cloth to make embroidered handicrafts. She will also buy grains like quinoa, wheat, and barley, etc. She will sell them at the weekly fairs. Her biggest desire is to keep working to educate her children. She likes the meetings and the events in which all of the women participate.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different colors of wool and cloth; also buy various grains

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando y darles una profesión a sus hijos

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros, la puntualidad y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Delfina is a member of the Gregoria Apaza Communal Bank in the Pusuyo community center in the Ilave district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 36, married, and has three children. She lives in the Pichincuta community. She has a high school education. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramso for almost two years. She started with a loan for 300 PEN, which allowed her to increase the capital in her business of buying and selling livestock. She currently needs a new loan for 1,200 PEN, which will allow her to buy sheep, poultry, and guinea pigs to sell at the weekly fairs. Her biggest wish is to keep working and to give her children a profession. She likes the savings, the punctuality, and the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

Su mayor deseo es aumentar su capital para poner una granja de aves de corral.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones donde comparte con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the Gregoria Apaza Communal Bank in the Pusuyo community center in the Ilave district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 40, married, and has four children. She lives in the Pusuyo community. She has a high school education. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for almost two years. Her initial loan was for 300 PEN, which allowed her to increase the capital in her business of buying and selling sheep. She currently needs a new loan for 600 PEN, which will allow her to buy sheep to fatten. Later she will sell them at the regional fair. Her biggest wish is to increase her capital to be able to establish a poultry farm. She likes the meetings where she shares with her colleagues.

loans.use: Buy sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tools & other equipment to expand the business

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana M. is a 55 year-old woman living in the town of Sinamoga.  She is married and has 5 children adult -aged children.  To make a living, Ana owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fried foods in the local community.  Ana has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately $750 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Ana joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ana has successfully repaid a previous loan of $750 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business.  Ana is now requesting a new loan of $750 WST which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Ana plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria L. runs a food stall selling a variety of food products in her community. She is married and has one small child. She is a 26-year-old woman living in the town of Sinamoga. Maria has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 500 talas a month.

Maria joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Maria is requesting a loan of 1000 talas which will be used to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business. This will be Maria's first loan from SPBD. loans.name: Lhamsuren

texts.en: A. Lhamsuren is 45 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. His oldest daughter currently attends university and his younger son is a high school student. His wife is unemployed and stays at home watching after their youngest daughter, Bulganchimeg, who is 1 year old. Lhanmsuren operates a wooden products making business in his town. He started his business in 1991 with the working capital of 80,000 tugrugs (~56 USD) He has built a stable operation over the years and the successful operation has allowed him to provide for his family. Today, his working capital exceeds 600,000 tugrugs (~420 USD). In the future, to further support his family, he hopes to grow his business further by increasing the quantity and quality of products he produces. He also wishes to buy a car which will contribute greatly to his business operations. He is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~350 USD) loan to purchase more woods and supplies for his wood products business.

loans.use: To purchase more woods and supplies for his wood products business.

loans.name: Battumur

texts.en:
O. Battumur manages a raw material trading business in his town. He sells many animal products such as sheepskin. He lives with his wife and two children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. His family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home. Both his son and daughter attend a local secondary school.

Battumur started his business in 2007 with capital of 500,000 tugrugs (~ $350 US). Even with only a few years of experience in his trade, he has established a stable operation and a good position in the business community. Today, his working capital exceeds 2,600,000 tugrugs (~ $1820 US). For the future, Battumur hopes to continue to grow his business and says, "My ultimate goal is to save enough money for my children's future." He is requesting a 2,600,000 tugrug (~ $1820 US) loan to purchase more raw materials in order to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Shihihutag

texts.en: Shihihutag owns a computer and copier service business and runs it in a rented office in a busy trading center. He is 31-years-old and lives with his wife in an apartment in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He started his business in 2008 and his monthly earnings are between 600,000 and 700,000 tugrugs (~ $420 - $490 US). While he has been successful in his business so far, he has found it expensive to purchase necessary equipment and products in Ulaanbaatar. This is why Shihihutag has decided to import his supplies and equipment directly from China. He has received loans in the past from XacBank, the leading bank in Mongolia, and has always paid back his lenders on time. Shihihutag is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~ $700 US) loan so that he can begin to import computer and copier equipment from China, in order to cut down on his overhead and increase his profit margin.

loans.use: To import computer and copier equipment

loans.name: Suhbaatar

texts.en: L. Sukhbaatar is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two young children, ages 1 and 3, in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His oldest son already attends kindergarten, and his wife, a photographer, stays home with the little one. Sukhbaatar operates a vegetables trading business in his town. He provides a large selection of vegetables, some of which he harvests himself, to his customers. This year, he wasn't able to harvest carrots and must purchase them. Sukhbaatar started his grocery business in 2006 with working capital of 500,000 tugrugs (~350 USD). After several years of successful business activity he has used his earnings to provide for his family and was recently able to purchase a car. Today, his working capital exceeds 5,000,000 tugrugs (~3500 USD). For the future, he hopes for continued success and says, " My only wish is to provide for my children's future edcucation." He is requesting a 1,400,000 tugrug (~980 USD) loan to purchase carrots for his grocery business.

loans.use: to purchase carrots for his grocery business

loans.name: Tsolmongerel

texts.en: Tsolmongerel is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in the Zavkhan province of Mongolia. Her oldest daughter attends a local secondary school while her husband helps Tsolmongerel with her business. She operates a vegetable trading business where she sells her own home-grown vegetables to dealers in the local markets. She started her business in 2000 and planted many different kinds of vegetables. During the past nine years she has not only gained agricultural experience and knowledge, but also business experience and knowledge. One day, she would like to buy another hectare of land so that she can grow even more produce and experiment with new kinds of vegetables. Tsolmongerel is requesting a 1,400,000 tugrug (~980 USD) loan to help her to purchase agricultural materials so that she can grow her customer base this winter.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetabes for her business.

loans.name: Otila

texts.en:
Otila F. is a 29 year-old woman living in the town of Tufulele. She is married and has four school-aged children. Otila's main source of income is a general store that she owns and operates. She has been running this business for over five years and earns approximately $1250 WST a month.

In 2005, Otila joined SPBD to access their financial services with the goal of improving her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Otila has successfully repaid a previous SPBD loan in the amount of $2250 WST. She used that loan to expand her business. Otila is now requesting a new loan of $3000 WST, which she will use to purchase additional inventory and to have working capital on hand. This loan will be Otila's fifth from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela B. is from the village of Cabungaan Clarin. She is 60 years old, married and has one adult child. Miguela's income comes mainly from her corn sales, which she has been doing for over 35 years now and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Miguela joined GDMPC to access their financial services with the plan to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Miguela has successfully repaid her first GDMPC loan which was in the amount of 5,000 PHP. She is requesting a new second loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers. She plans to improve her family's living conditions with the additional revenue generated by the business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Avatea has been involved in her business for over six years, and she earns approximately 600 WST a month.

Avatea joined SPBD in 2009 to access financial services and engage in business activities, which will help improve her living situation.  Avatea successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD, which was used to purchase seeds, seedlings, and young crops.  Avatea is requesting a new loan of 1750 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure.  This will be Avatea's second loan from SPBD, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina L. is a 24 year-old woman living in the town of Tulaele. She is married and has 2 infant-aged children. Christina owns & operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fried foods in the local community. Christina has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 650 WST a month from these activities. Christina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Christina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

Christina is now requesting a new loan of 2,000 WST which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Christina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Isa

texts.en:
Isa T. is a 63-year-old woman living in the town of Vaimea.  She is married and has 10 adult -aged children.  To make a living, Isa owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a tailoring business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members.  Isa has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 650 WST a month from these activities.

Isa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Isa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1750 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & threads.  Isa is now requesting a new loan of 2000 WST which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Isa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en:
S. is a 37 year-old resident of Kandal Province, Cambodia. He currently catches fish to sell retail in the market and makes an average of $3 each day. For the business, he is relying on fishing around Tunle Sap Lake and the other ponds in the area of his community.

He is married to Thon, 41, who makes a living braiding mats from home to sell for a profit. On the other hand, the family has been farming for extra profit. The couple are the parents of three children and all of them are still attending school. Fishing is S.'s main source of stable income for the family's living expenses.

In order to make the business more successful, he is asking for a loan to buy more fishing tools to supply his business.

loans.use: To buy more fishing tools to supply his business

loans.name: Ghullam Saewar Group

texts.en: This is the G. Saewar group. There are three members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their businesses. Rayhana and G. Sarwar want to take a loan for their business of embroidery to buy necessary materials for their businesses. And Samya wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of general store. And also they want to complete their necessary materials for their businesses. They want to say that these loans to help businesses progress and make businesses larger are very useful. They all want to thank Kiva for making possible the process in Afghanistan to support poor people.

loans.use: their improve their business

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta S. is a 27 year-old woman living in the town of Vaimea. She is married and has 3 infant-aged children. Jacinta owns & operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fried foods in the local community. Jacinta has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 450 WST a month from these activities. Jacinta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jacinta has successfully repaid a previous loan from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

Jacinta is now requesting a new loan of 1,750 WST which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Jacinta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Thaiy

texts.en: Thaiy N., age 33, lives in a medium wooden house where she braids silk skirt for sale. Thaiy N. was married, but her husband died of senility years ago. She has two children; one of whom assists her with weaving silk, while the other one is married and lives separately. Thaiy N. has been a silk weaver for 19 years, a skill she learned from her grandmother. She sells her finished product to a middleman, who then takes it to re sell at the market in Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She has also been hired by the villagers to spin silk where she can earn extra income. Recently, a part of the raw material has been ran out from stock supply; Thaiy N. wants to resupply and is requesting a loan from HKL to purchase more silk to continue weaving.

loans.use: To purchase more silk to continue weaving

loans.name: Malahlay Group

texts.en:
Malahlay is the leader of Malahlay group, which consists of three members, each of whom would like to receive money for their businesses. Mahalay wants to take a loan to buy necessary materials for her tailoring business.

Yar Mohammad wants to take a loan to increase the stock for his business.

Alam Sha wants to take a loan for his general store.

They are thankful for the loan of 12,000 Afghanis, as it will provide a good chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for their businesses

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia G. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 45 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Antonia owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling banana cue (plantain, fried in boiling oil and held on a skewer) and potato cue (sweet potato, fried in boiling oil and rolled in brown sugar) to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Antonia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in renovating her business. Antonia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Luamoana

texts.en: Luamoana A. is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Maagao. She is married and has four adult children. Luamoana owns and operates a business providing general services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 600 WST a month. In 2005, Luamoana joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase equipment to improve her business. Luamoana is now requesting a new loan of 1750 WST which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. The loan will be her 4th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Giosita

texts.en: Giosita C. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 34 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Giosita owns and operates a specialized "uling" (charcoal) retail store, selling charcoal in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Giosita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Giosita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Charie Lynn

texts.en: Charie Lynn L. is from the village of Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 20 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Charie Lynn owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Charie Lynn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase pigs to raise and sell. Charie Lynn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina A. is a loving and caring mother to her three children whose ages range from 10 to 20 years old. With the support of her responsible husband, Marcelo, who is a farmer, Felomina had been persistent in achieving her dreams for her children. For a couple whose source of income is sporadic, giving a different kind of life to their children is very hard. However, for Felomina and Marcelo, that must not be the reason to stop working hard to achieve things that are worthwhile.

Therefore, they both decided that Felomina become a member of ASHI, the Kiva field partner in the Philippines. Through ASHI, she can have the opportunity to apply for a loan to be used for income generating activities.

After Felomina was recognized as a new member of ASHI, she submitted her proposal for a loan which is intended for starting a pig-raising business and a mini variety store. The profits she will be making from these will enable her to send all of her children to school as well as to support her eldest child in putting up his own business someday.

loans.use: To buy a piglet to raise and to start a variety store

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: T. is a widower man and the father of nine children. One of them is working in construction, while the other eight are attending school. To make a living, T. owns small business from his home. He has a generator which he uses to provide a battery charging service and is typically earning an average of $3 per day. Almost all of his customers are nearby neighbors. Additionally, T. and his wife have also cultivated rice. Recently, T.’s machine has broken which is affecting to his service. Therefore, he requested a loan of US$300 in order to replace a broken one.

loans.use: To replace a broken machine

loans.name: Evencia

texts.en:
Along with her 76-years-old husband, Evencia Valea, 75 years old lives in a beautiful and verdant municipality of Pandan in Antique province. The couple became self- supporting after all of their four children have their own family to manage. Instead of asking her children for financial support, Evencia joined ASHI in 2005 wanting to request for a loan which will be used for a business which she and her husband could do their share of managing. Evencia knew that her children are also financially incapable to sustain the needs of their own family. Therefore, not even a single cent of her loan was wasted for unnecessary things.  It was used for financing a vegetable and fish buy and sell businesses. These businesses enable the old couple have a regular meal which is three times daily for Filipino. 

Evencia is not aiming for a bigger amount of loan to apply though she is qualified. Considering her age, and health, she knows her capacity to run a business. Loan she is requesting now and in the future will be used to sustain her previous and present business. This opportunity brings joy to Evencia since this has not only enabled her to support her needs and her husband’s but this is also her means of exercise mentally and physically because she sells not just in one place but in a lot of different places which sometimes requires a lot of walking for a house to house selling.

loans.use: Will be used to increase the inventory fish for selling.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara Q. is a 45-year-old mother who dreamed nothing more in life but to be able to send her three children whose age range is from 12 to 19 years old to college and be able to give them a degree to hold forever. She envisioned this achievement not without the support of her loving husband who is a farm laborer. Together with him, Clara will surmount mountains to be able to bring their children out of the umbrella of poverty. In a beautiful place of Belison, province of Antique Philippines, Clara lives together with her family. Her husband’s income is the family’s main source of living. However, is not enough to sustain the needs of her children especially in the next years wherein their eldest will be near to graduate from college which will require a lot of school projects and trainings. With that realization, Clara then joined ASHI in their village. She applied for a loan which she will going to use for vegetables buy and sell business. This way, her husband’s income will be augmented and family’s financials will be increased. Profits she will make out of her businesses will be her means for taking steps towards the fulfillment of her dreams.

loans.use: Will be used to purchase various vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Evelynda

texts.en:
Evelynda C. is a poor woman who has not allowed poverty to deprive her for performing her reproductive and productive role as a woman. She has a two year child to nurture and a husband to support for generating a much bigger amount of income. In order to portray her role well and to give her children better future, Evelynda joined ASHI to be able to have an access to business capital.
