Thus, after she has been recognized as an official member of the said institution, she requested for a loan. Through which she will be able to put up a small variety store in her own house. 

To be able to perform her reproductive role well, Evelynda believed that first she has to perform her productive role very well by using the financial assistance she has had with ASHI in an income generating activities.  Service her business renders to all her costumers and commodities she sells in her store will not only nurture her children but people in their community as well.

loans.use: Will be used as a capital to start up a mini variety store.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: 25-year-old Kenneth C. has been concerned about the future of her two children once she will be depending her family’s economy to her husband’s sporadic livelihood. She then wanted to have her own business to manage to be able to help her husband who is farm laborer generates income for her family. She joined ASHI to be able to have the opportunity to request for a loan which will enable her to start up a sari- sari store (variety store) in her own house.  Profits she will be making out of this will be saved and will be re invested in the business while her children are still young whose age range is from two to four years old. By the time her children will be needing much bigger finances for their studies until college, Kenneth wishes that her business by then have grown through loans she received from ASHI and its partner, KIVA.

loans.use: Will be used for purchasing variety store's inventory of goods for starting up.

loans.name: Madinah's Group

texts.en: N. Madinah is a 45 year old female and married with 6 children aged 25 – 3 years as she takes care of 5 dependants. She is a business lady involved in the sale of cereals fresh from the villages and she sells from Owino market for 20 years. She is able to make 200,000/= a week as profits and this is mostly attached to her good customer care skills and having loans that increase her capital base all these years. Madinah has a dream of having to see her business boom as well as having an educated family that will be self reliant in future. Madinah needs a loan to help buy more produce like beans, Irish potatoes, cabbages and so on for resale.

loans.use: Buying more produce for resale.

loans.name: Jonna

texts.en:
Jonna O. dreamed of having her own business to manage so that her husband’s sporadic income as a farm laborer would be augmented. This would make them capable of sustaining the finances of their two children aged one and three years old.

Jonna wanted to secure the future of their children while they are young. Thus, she joined ASHI and has requested a loan which will be used to start up a food-vending business. Through the profits of her planned business, she hoped to generate savings for the future of her children and eventually to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials and ingrediets for her food-vending business

loans.name: Teo's Group

texts.en:
N. Teo is the leader of her lending group in Kamwokya. She is shown in the small photo though not in the group photo.

Teo is the single mother of four children and she single-handedly helps to take care of their needs as well as paying their school fees. She is a businesswoman involved in the sale of fish and has supplied to companies and traders in Kamwokya, Ntinda and Bukoto for twelve years.

Teo is requesting a loan to be able to buy more fish for her business expansion so that she will be able to make more profits. She is so grateful for her loans because they have really stood in for her husband and hence closed the gap.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en:
M. Betty is the leader of her lending group in Zana. She is a married lady with seven children aged between 28 and 16 years and she also helps to take care of other orphans.

Betty is a businesswoman who has had a poultry farm business for seven years. She is able to make 300,000/= as profits a month and this helps her in saving and educating her children to the higher levels. Her biggest challenge in her business is being seasonal. There are sometimes few sales and hence, less profits. 

Betty is a hardworking and self-driven lady and she needs a loan to help buy more feed for her poultry farm as well as to order more day-old chicks for farm expansion.

loans.use: To buy more feed and to order more day-old chicks

loans.name: Jonathan Muthusi

texts.en: Jonathan is married to Agnes and they have three children: Mary (18 years old), Gabriel (14 years old) and George (8 years old). Jonathan was introduced to KADET by existing group members and has no previous credit history. With his loan he will buy cereals (maize, beans and millet) which are in high demand and which will assist in attracting new clients. His area of business is within an estate where high-income earners reside. With the extra profit, Jonathan intends to expand his business. He hopes to make his shop a wholesale operation. He describes himself as focused, determined and hardworking. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase a stock of cereals

loans.name: Villamenia

texts.en: Villamenia is 59 years old.  She is married to Elizardo and they were blessed with two children and they are both married.  Villamenia is managing a sari-sari store (community based store) in their village and she is thankful for the improvement that is happening to her business.  In order for her to further improve her business and so with their way of living, she is requesting to request a loan of PHP5000 from the KIVA lenders as business capital.  This amount will be of great help for the expansion of her store.  She hopes that her requested loan will be approved. Her husband Elizardo is a private driver. The couple wanted that they could be able to sustain their needs. Villamenia and Elizardo would like to earn bigger capital for their security purposes when they get old.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Reginalda

texts.fr:
Reginalda is 51 years old and married to Albert, a cashier in a gasoline store. They have three children: Nora- 23 years old, fourth year college student;Noel- 21 years old, working at internet shop, and their youngest is Jesua- 18 years of age, 2nd year college student.  Their family are residing at Baranggay Salay, Angadanan, Cauayan City, Isabela. 

Reginalda manages a typical retail store in their village for almost four years.  She sells different commodities such as canned goods, breads and other basic toiletries.  She now would like to avail a loan amount of PHP10,000.00 that she can use for her retailing business.  She is continuously striving her very best to support her family.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Zussette

texts.en:
Zusette is 29 years old, single and has an auditory defect. but despite of this, she is still very diligent in managing her village store for almost ten years.  She plans to expand her business in order to earn more income and assist the daily needs of their family.  Aside from her store, she is also engaged in farming and hog raising business.  She is living a peaceful life together with her parents at Salay,Angadanan, Isabela, a rural and plain area.

Her weekly net income is PHP 800.00.  She wanted to make her business grow and she is now requesting to avail a loan of PHP9,000.00 to be used in her business expansion. Zusette said that there's a gradual improvement in her business, because she spent her money wisely.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her retailing business

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
N. Margaret is the leader of her lending group in Namasuba. She is a young woman who is obsessed with the desire to succeed through hard work. She is not yet married and has no child.

Margaret has a business selling secondhand clothes and has a shop in central Kampala. She joined her lending group to be able to access more capital for her business since she could not find any other alternative and, sincerely, she has found it worthwhile. She wants to be an independent lady and, even if she gets married, not leave everything to her husband.

Margaret needs a loan to be able to buy more clothes for increased variety, leading to increased sales and hence more income and profits.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a native cake vendor in their village.  She is 52 years and still aiming for a success in life. She  is living with her family in the village of Sta. Rosa, Santiago City, Isabela. She both stand as father and mother to her four children. She is happy because she is able to provide all the needs of her family. Her four children are already married.

Anita would like to buy additional native cakes so that she could generate bigger income. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan amounting PHP5,000 that will be a great help in improving her vending business.  She is hoping that the loan amount she is requesting will be granted. Anita is hoping that she could improve her way of living.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Aisha's Group

texts.en: A. Aisha is 27 years old and a female with 1 child as she takes care of other dependants. She is the leader of her lending group in Ntungamo, so hard working as she manages a retail shop in Kamuri Cell, Bwongyera for 7 years. Her major challenge is having so many defaulters in her business who take goods on credit and fail to pay hence affecting her cash flow. She is able to make 55,000/= as profits a week and these help to contribute to the family’s welfare. She has a dream of transforming her retail shop into wholesale so that she could make more sales hence more income. Aisha needs a loan to help expand her shop with more goods.

loans.use: Restocking her shop with more goods.

loans.name: Ngem

texts.en: Two persons appear in the picture are Mr. K. and his wife. K., age 56, makes a living driving a taxi motorcycle, picking up his passengers in and around his community. He is currently earning an average of $3 a day and has been running his service for a long time. He is a father of four children, three of whom are teenagers and other one is married. Most of his children are employed. His wife, Sokha, works sewing for a garment industry. She is also a good housewife who cooks delicious meals. K. is taking out his loan to buy a motorcycle for his son's commuting to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his son's commuting to work

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
"Attaining success in life starts within ourselves," said Jennifer B.. She is 35 years old, married to Jerry, a responsible father, and works as a farmer. Jennifer and Jerry are gifted with six children: Jeffrey - 14 years old, in 4th year high school; Kevin - 13 years old, in 3rd year high school; Jayson - 9 years old, in grade-IV; Angelica May - 8 years old, in grade-IV; Jennylyn - 7 years, in old grade-II; and Jay Anne Ellaine - 2 years old. Jennifer and her husband are striving hard in order to sustain the needs of their family and supply all the needs of their five children who are studying.

Jennifer raises ducks in her village. She decided to venture into this type of business to help her husband in supporting the needs of their family. She is asking for financial support of PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders as additional capital in developing and improving the business she manages.

Jennifer is aiming for success in life so she is doing her best to attain the goals she wants to happen in her life.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a vegetable vendor in her village and her weekly net income is PHP 450. She decided to obtain a loan from Kiva lenders that will be used as business capital with the hope that her income will increase. She plans to expand her business at Alicia public market, to earn more income and to purchase many vegetables that she can sell.

Cristina is 37 years old and married to Jose, a councilor in their village and also working as a farmer and a tricycle driver. They are blessed with five children: Lorie Grace - 14 years old, in 1st year high school; Wilce Joy - 13 years old, in grade 5; Melvin - 10 years old, in grade 4; Severino - 9 years old, in grade 2; and Cee Jay - 6 years old, in grade 1. They live at Salay, Angadanan, Isabela. Cristina said: “We should keep the faith from God above.”

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn Y. is 35 years old and a resident of Kampong Chhnang province, located about 90 km from the capital, Phnom Penh. She has four children: one is working and the other three are students and dependent on her. Her husband appears in the photo.

Sorn Y. currently makes bamboo baskets. She saves up over a hundred sets of bamboo baskets and then sells them to her customers for profit. Generally, her valued clients need to order a few days or a week in advance. Her husband helps her transport the finished products directly to her customers' houses.

In addition, Sorn Y. requested a loan in order to buy baskets from other weavers to sell for more income.

loans.use: To buy baskets from other weavers

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is a fish vendor. She is 45 years old and happily married to Noli. Her husband is responsible for cultivating their rice field while Florida is busy in selling fish in their village. The couple is blessed with two children: Noel - 22 years old, who just finished 2nd year college; and the youngest, Nelson - 17 years old, in 1st year college. Florida’s family lives peacefully in their village.

Florida is hoping that she will be able to develop her fish pond so that she can have more fish to sell and increase her income. Her family members are very cooperative and that is why they are happy and thankful.

Florida would like to expand her fish pond but her capital is not enough to sustain the daily feed supply of her fish. In this regard, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 which will be used to purchase a feed supply. She is hoping that her loan request will be approved.

loans.use: To buy a supply of fish food

loans.name: Uch

texts.en: There are many Cambodians who make a living as rice cultivators; one of them is Mrs. P. who has been working in this sector since 1999. She and her husband grow rice on their own farmland that they inherited from their grandparents. From this business they can generate an income of around US$ 2 per day. This humble couple has nine children; six of whom are married and live independently, while others still live in home. Due to the family's current income is not adequate to sustain their family's food. P. has decided to seek a loan to begin selling sugar cane juice. This loan will provide her with additional income.

loans.use: To begin selling sugar cane juice

loans.name: Patrick's Group

texts.en: S. Patrick is a responsible and married man with 5 children all in Primary school. He is a hardworking and friendly man with a live stock business that he has been running for 1 year. Before this business, Patrick was and is still a farmer and it’s the savings from his farming that he started up the livestock plus the help from loans. Patrick says that his main business challenge is the expensive costs of feeds plus the disease out breaks that affects the growth of the birds. He says that he is grateful for his family’s support and he would like to grow his business more and build a family house so that he could stop renting which is costly. Patrick would like to grow his business more by buying more feeds and drugs for improved quality.

loans.use: Buying more chicken feeds and drugs for improved quality.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard M. has operated his butcher shop in Naivasha town for the last 16 years.  He is 61 years old, married to Elizabeth and they have five adult children who are all working.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He is planning to buy more goats to rear and then slaughter them for sell later in the year during the festive seasons.  He wants to buy the goats now as they are also cheaper and he is preparing for the peak season.

He still plans to continue with his butcher shop as thats the only thing he has done for the last 16 years as a source of income.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke.

loans.use: Buy more goat to rear before slaughtering them for sell.

loans.name: Poeng

texts.en: L., 44, is a busy woman who attempts to earn money from many ventures. She cultivates rice as well as buying a few cooking supply from market seller to sell in retail them at her home. She is a married mother who has given birth to three school-aged children. Her husband who helps be responsible for family by driving a motor taxi. L. is applying for a loan to buy more cooking items to sell.

loans.use: To buy more cooking items to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter N. is 25 years old, married to Leah Njeri and they have one school going child.

Peter has been operating a road side cafe in Naivasha town for the last six years.  

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his first loan well which he used to make seats for his clients at the cafe premise. With the proceeds of this second loan, he is planning to diversify and start selling cereals on the side. This will enable him capitalise on the income generation as the original business and this one will give him more profit and sustainability.

He has future plans of expanding his business, buying a plot and building rental houses.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke.

loans.use: To buy cereals for sale.

loans.name: Josephine Waiyego

texts.en:
Josephine I. is married to Cyrus a Business man they have no children yet. They reside in the Eastern part of Nairobi.

Josephine oprates a retail store selling different things including maize flour, soft drinks, different grains and many more. The clients' area of business is along a main street with high population and she relies on the residents and passersby as her customers.

Josephine was introduced to KADET through existing clients, and she has no Previous credit history. She will use the loans she has applied for to increase stock in her retail store for items which are in high demand. With the extra profit she plans to expand the business further as she aspires to have a wholesale shop after expansion.

Josephine describes herself as focused and hardworking.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke.

loans.use: The loan will be used to increase the stock of Maize flour, and maize grains at this moment of high demand.

loans.name: Uk

texts.en: Uk S. currently weaves bamboo baskets for sale. She sells her finished product to people who come directly to her house, and who bring it to retail at the market. She makes many sets of baskets before selling out. She also orders baskets from the other villagers and sells them to make additional income. Uk S. is a 48-year-old married woman blessed with four teenage children who attend in the local school. Her husband is a truck driver. Uk S. is taking out her first loan to buy a plot of land in good location for farming. She will greatly grow a rice crop on her own land.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land in good location for farming

loans.name: Keziah

texts.en:
Keziah has been selling shoes in an open air market in Naivasha town for the last two years.  She is 20 years old, married to Edward Ndungu and they have a one year old baby boy.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to buy more shoes for sell to boost her stock.

She hopes to one day own a permanent premise from where she will sell her shoes from.  She also plans to diversify and even add clothes for sale in her business.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for sell.

loans.name: Kefah

texts.en:
Kefah is a qualified doctor, he has been running his own clinic and chemist in Naivasha town for the last four years.  He is 38 years old, married to Eunice Bochere and they have one school going child.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his third loan.  He repaid the two previous loans well by using the proceeds of the other loans to restock medicine in the clinic and also his chemist.  He plans to open a laboratory for his business with proceeds of the third loan and also buy lab equipments.

In the near future, Kefah plans to build an in patient ward at his clinic since at the moment he only serves outpatient clients. This will not only increase his income but also help him employ others as he gets to have close follow-up on his patients.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke.

loans.use: To open a laboratory and buying lab equipment.

loans.name: Nuth

texts.en:
Nuth T. is 61 years old and the mother of three children: one is single and the other two are married and have already started new families.

In the beginning of 1996, Nuth T. built a small store in front of her home. In her shop, she sells a variety of vegetable to the neighbors who live near her house in the village. In addition, she and her husband always cultivate crops during the approaching farming season, after the rains fall and the land is suitable for growing rice.

Nuth T. is applying for a loan to buy a water buffalo which she will use to alleviate her hard labor on the farm.

loans.use: To buy a water buffalo to alleviate her hard labor on the farm

loans.name: Aigul's Group

texts.en:
Aigul is the leader of this group. She and her husband used to live in Naryn, the most mountainous part of Kyrgyzstan, where most of the population is engaged in raising livestock. 

Aigul was not an exception. It was in Naryn where they started raising cattle, and after moving to Chui Oblast, they purchased new cattle and resumed their familiar activity. However, after a while a big ordeal awaited Aigul when her husband passed away.  The burden of supporting the whole family, consisting of herself and three children lay solely on her shoulders. Aigul did not give up and instead, kept struggling. Since then, the children have grown up a great deal. Her eldest son is 19 years old.  He has become a tremendous help to Aigul since he started working at a construction site.  Next is Aigul’s 18–year-old daughter. She is pursuing her education at Kyrgyz State University. The youngest is Aigul’s second daughter, who is 13 years old.  

Aigul milks the cows every day and earns her living by selling milk and yoghurt. For 20 years this activity has been the main source of her income. Selling milk brings her around $65 a month. Aigul needs a loan to buy one more cow to sell more milk products. She has started to think about money for her son's wedding.

Aigul’s partners are Svetlana, Kuljan and Elena. Svetlana, 56, is divorced and has two sons, both of whom live separately. Svetlana has quite an unusual way of making a living. She braids armchairs and rocking chairs from willow. She needs a loan to purchase raw materials to manufacture her products. 

Kuljan, 53, is a mother of six children. She is occupied with selling milk, yoghurt and sour cream. She needs a loan for harvesting her four hectare piece of land, and with the rest of the loan she wants to buy a calf. 

Elena, 44, has four children. For a living she sells milk, eggs and nuts. Her monthly income from selling these items is around $226. Elena needs a loan to purchase slag stone to build a shed.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy one more cow to sell more milk products

loans.name: Anarkan's Group

texts.en:
Anarkan is the leader of this group. She is 42 years old and divorced. However, her determination and strong character help her to live on. Anarkan lives with her daughter, who is 28 years old and married. Her daughter works as seamstress. An amiable personality and love for children characterize Anarkan, who works as an officer teacher in a boarding school. After getting married, Anarkan and her husband sold their old car and purchased cattle and some sheep. Since then, Anarkan has been keeping cows and sheep and has been selling milk. Now she manages to sell up to 20 liters of milk in one day. 

Working in a boarding school is quite tiring. The whole day is spent dealing with youngsters who would wear out anybody, but it is not the case with Anarkan. She finds in herself endless energy to come home after work and care for the cattle as if she just woke up in the morning. This enterprise of raising cattle together with her formal occupation brings her $300 a month. This, in turn, is enough incentive for her to keep going. Anarkan has applied for the loan as she wants to purchase a milk cow to be able to sell more milk. She is resolute about the necessity to increase her total population of livestock and about buying her daughter a flat in the same city. 

Anarkan’s partners are Natalya, Anna and Oliya. Natalya, 51, is divorced. She has only one daughter, who works as a seamstress.  Natalya  works as an educator in a boarding school and also sells milk. Natalya needs a loan to plant her two and a half hectare land with winter wheat. 

Anna, 53, is a widow. She has one daughter. Both Anna and her daughter are teachers at a boarding school. They also sell milk, yoghurt and sour cream to locals.  Anna needs a loan to purchase three tons of coal for winter. 

Oliya, 46, is divorced. She has one daughter, who works as an accountant. Oliya sells milk and works part time as a school teacher. Oliya needs a loan to buy a cow.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow to be able to sell more milk

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mr. Sophal R., age 28 (pictured with his wife) and his wife, Mrs. Ravy Phork, age 29, have been married since 1999. They have three daughters: Two sons are in school and other one stays at home. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number one about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sophal and her husband have been farming for 10 years. They do not have enough capital to use on their farm, so Sophal is requesting her firs loan of $300 to help her capital.

loans.use: To use for farming.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Né le 18 Novembre 1979 à Sikasso, Monsieur Ousmane S. est marié et réside avec son épouse à Mamassoni, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  S. après avoir mener plusieurs activités sans succès, fini par s’initier au commerce, notamment les matériels d’électricité il y a environ sept  ans. Il dispose actuellement d’une quincaillerie il y a maintenant une année. Auparavant il menait  son activité de façon ambulante et cela  au moins six années avec  une clientèle composée généralement d’entrepreneurs mais surtout des électriciens. 
Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits.
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter 10 cartons d’ampoules de différentes sortes, 30 paires de réglette, 10 cartons de contacteur, 10 paquets de disjoncteur, etc. 
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako, Bobo, Koumassi et Abidjan (respectivement au Mali, en Burkina Faso, au Ghana et en Côte d’Ivoire) avant de les revendre en détail.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born on November 18, 1979, in Sikasso, Mr. Ousmane S. is married and lives with his spouse in Mamassoni, one of the outlying neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run several businesses without success, Mr. S. ended up becoming familiarized with commerce approximately seven years ago, notably in the field of electrical supplies.

For a year now, he's been owning a hardware store. Priorly, he had been running his business as an ambulant salesman for at least six years. His clientele consists of entrepreneurs, mostly electricians. He's in high demand thanks to the quality of his products. To meet an ever-increasing customer demand, he decided to join Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, from which he's seeking his first personal loan.

With this first loan, he intends to buy 10 boxes of various kinds of lightbulbs, 30 pairs of gear trays, 10 boxes of contactors, 10 packs of circuit breakers, etc. He gets his supplies in Bamako, Bobo, Koumassi, and Abidjan (located in Mali, Burkina Faso, Ghana, and Côte d'Ivoire, respectively) and then resell them retail.

With this loan, he foresees turning a monthly profit of XOF 150'000 (ca US$ 340), to be used mainly to increase his working capital, help with the family expenses, and repay the loan. The remainder will be invested into his business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 boxes of lightbulbs, 30 pairs of gear trays, 10 boxes of contactors, 10 packs of circuit breakers, etc.

loans.name: Nurbubu's Group

texts.en:
Nurbubu is the leader of this group. She is 50 years old and has raised three children. Her eldest son works at a police station. Her middle daughter is married and her younger daughter is a college student. Nurbubu and her husband are, by their nature, very active people. Therefore, Nurbubu prefers a noisy and busy daily routine to the quietness of being at home. They sell foodstuffs in a small shop. 

According to them, it is always possible to set up a business.  In the beginning, Nurbubu did not have a container or a building to use when she wanted to start selling. So she and her husband made a small space right inside their house for their shop.  Long ago, Nurbubu already had experience selling dishes in a big market. This was an incentive for her to open a shop at home after her marriage. Investing just $45 in this undertaking, Nurbubu now earns three times as much on a monthly basis. This very same shop has given Nurbubu an opportunity to educate her children and build a new house. Now Nurbubu hopes that by using this loan she will be able to purchase more goods to enrich the assortment and increase the turnover.  Nurbubu plans to complete the building of their new house, see their son married and build a shed for keeping cattle.  

Nurbubu’s partners are Nazgul, Kanitat and Ramis.  Nazgul, 31, has three children, all of whom are school students. Her husband works as a policeman. Nazgul is engaged in raising cattle and selling milk. Nazgul needs a loan to buy a cow.

Kanitat, 47, is a mother of three children. She is occupied with animal husbandry, selling milk and also needlework. Kanitat needs this loan to cover expenses related to harvesting wheat. 

Ramis, 18, is single. Despite his young age, he and his brother, 17, already take care of his family, which consists of his mother and a five-year-old sister.  Ramis raises cattle and sells milk.  He needs this loan to plant wheat and purchase fuel.  He has decided to try farming and if everything goes well, become a farmer.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to enrich the assortment and increase the turnover

loans.name: Burul's Group

texts.en: Burul, the leader of this group, is a very experienced farmer. Her parents-in law used to keep cattle and left the cattle to her and her husband as an inheritance. That’s how Burul appeared to have inherited not only the cattle but also a way of earning a livelihood. Burul and her husband have raised five children. Her three daughters are already married and live separately. One of her sons, married, plays in a team in a traditional game of “pulling a kid”. He also lives apart from his parents. The youngest son is thirty. He does odd jobs at a factory in the capital but still lives with his parents. In spite of her age, 54, Burul eagerly manages her living herself. She sells twenty liters of milk per day and these days she is occupied with harvesting wheat. If her annual income was averaged, her monthly income would constitute $125. Burul has applied for this loan to purchase some sheep to raise and resell. Her dream is to buy accommodation for her eldest son in the capital. Burul has three partners: Cholponbai, Nestana and Begaiym: Cholponbai, 47, is the father of two children. His wife carries goods to Russia. As to Cholponbai, he trades in cattle. His son, 22, is a taxi-driver and his daughter is a high school student. Cholponbai needs a loan to purchase two calves. His dream is to have Mercedes. But first he is going to see his son married. Nestana, 20, is married and her husband works as a social worker. She raises cattle which is quite courageous of her, since she is just twenty. She invested $465 in this business, which is quite a sum for anybody in this area. She needs a loan to purchase a calf to raise and resell and another calf for breeding. Begaiym, 35, is married and has five children. Her husband produces sun-dried bricks, whereas Begaiym sells milk - nine liters per day. She needs a loan to buy a calf. Selling milk brings her $63 a month. She wants to increase her total population of livestock by having one more calf. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase some sheep to raise and sell

loans.name: Abdramane

texts.fr:
Né le 06 novembre 1971 à Sikasso Monsieur D. est marié et père de quatre  enfants dont 2 garçons et 2 filles. Il réside dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Mancourani II, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 N’ayant pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, il s’est vite initié aux activités commerciales notamment à l’achat-vente des gaz butane  et cartes de recharges téléphoniques depuis plus de 10 ans. Monsieur D. est réputé  et très apprécié. Compte tenu de peu de moyens dont il dispose, il se voit incapable de satisfaire la demande qui est de plus en plus forte. Ainsi, il intégra l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a plus d’un an. Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt, il est à son deuxième prêt individuel pour relancer son activité et diversifier ses marchandises avec les cartes de recharge Malitel-Orange. Ceci lui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et de la fidéliser.
Avec ce présent prêt, il compte acheter 170 bombonnes de gaz butane et 100 cartes de recharge de Malitel et Orange à Bamako afin de les revendre en détail à une clientèle composée de toutes les couches sociales . 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA. Les revenus réalisés de l’exercice de cette activité lui permettront de rembourser son prêt et faire face aux besoins de sa famille, ensuite investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born on November 6, 1971 in Sikasso, Mr. D. is married and the father of 4 children, 2 boys and 2 girls. He lives in a big extended traditional family in Mancourani II, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Not having had the opportunity to do well at school, he began early on to work at commercial businesses, notably buying and selling butane gas and telephone recharge cards for more than 10 years now. Mr. D. has a good reputation and is well-liked. In view of how small his working capital is, he is not able to satisfy demand, which is ever growing.

Thus, he became a member of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso more than a year ago. After having correctly reimbursed his first loan, he is on his second individual loan, geared at getting his business going well and diversifying his merchandise with rechargeable phone cards of the brand Malitel-Orange. This will permit him to better satisfy needs of his clientele and keep them coming back to him.

With this loan, he is counting on buying 170 small tanks of butane gas and 100 phone charge cards of the brands Malitel and Orange in Bamako to sell retail to a clientele composed of all levels of society.

With the loan he expects to make a monthly profit of 200,000 F CFA. This income from his business will allow him to reimburse his loan and cover family expenses, investing any remainder in his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of butane gas and rechargeable phone cards (Malitel et Orange)

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac has been employed to operate a motorcycle taxi business in Naivasha town for the last 2 years.   He is 37 years old, married to Annah Njeri and they have three school going children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend.  This will be his first loan and he plans to set up a grocery shop for his wife, to boost the family's income.

He also plans to buy his own motorcycle in future which will enable him to be self employed.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To assist wife with capital to set up a grocery shop.

loans.name: Nouhoum

texts.fr:
Âgé de 35 ans, Monsieur Nouhoum Dembélé est marié et père de 4 enfants (2garçons et 2 filles). Il réside dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie chez son père à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Nouhoum est un forgeron de couche sociale, qui n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école. Très vite il s’initia à l’activité familiale à savoir la fabrication d’objets utilitaires à base d’aluminium. Il achète l’aluminium à Bamako pour les  transformer en objets de toutes sortes : Marmite, théière, assiette, cuillère, etc.
Nanti d’une grande expérience et d’une bonne réputation, il jouit d’importante sollicitation  des clients pour la qualité de ses services. 
Compte tenu de ses moyens  très limités, pour satisfaire la demande qui est de plus en plus forte de sa clientèle, il intègre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel pour acheter, 725 kg d’aluminium afin de  relancer son activité. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150.000 FCFA qui lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et de faire face aux besoins de sa famille, ensuite investir le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: Achat d‘Aluminium.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is married to Ann Njeri,together they have 3 schooling children. Samson has been in the hotel business in Naivasha for the last 4 years. 

He heard about KADET through a friend and joined. He has applied for his first loan with which he is planning to boost and expand his restaurant so as to serve the ever increasing customers. In the future Samson plans to expand his business by opening another restaurant in Naivasha.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To boost his business

loans.name: Afaq

texts.en:
Afaq H. is 35 years old. She is married and has three children.

Since she has lived with her husband, Afaq has worked in the business of buying and selling cattle and sheep. She usually purchases cattle and sheep at the weekly bazaar which is held in a nearby village, buying at the lowest price so as to be able to increase her profits. She currently has two cows.

Now, Afaq wants to expand her business. Because her children are grown, she thinks that, with their help, she will be able to look after more cattle and sheep. She is asking for a loan of 1607 AZN to purchase young cattle and sheep. She expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase young cattle and sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new chairs, tables and utensils

loans.name: Sura

texts.en:
Sura T. is an enterprising woman who is always happy to do good work. When she was young she had a big desire for self-improvement. She has been in the cattle breeding business for about eight years. This allows her to support her three children, who are the motivation for all of her hard work.

Sura wants to increase her investment capital to be able to keep supporting them. With your support she will be able to buy new animals and expand her business. Thank you for supporting her.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Qurbat

texts.en:
Qurbat M. is 42 years old. He is married and has three children. 

Qurbat sells cattle. As a rule he purchases young cattle in the central market, feeds them, and then resells them at higher prices in the local market.

Having been in this business for eleven years Qurbat knows very well how to choose the animals, how to breed them and look after them. He gets up every morning in order to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and to generate a considerable, stable income for his large family. 

Qurbat is planning to enlarge his stock and to purchase more cattle. For this purpose he requests 1607 AZN that will purchase four calves. You can become an important part in the life of Qurbat’s family and he deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Suleyman

texts.en:
Suleyman H. is a 47-year-old farmer who believes that he is the richest man in the world, considering that he has four adult children.

Suleyman has three cattle and sells them for meat production to the local and Capital traders. He has more that fifteen years of experience in raising cattle and selling them. The meat products are in very high demand in his village.

Suleyman’s orders for this product are very high but his quantity of meat is not enough for the traders and so he decided to apply for 1607 AZN to purchase additional cattle and fodder.

Suleyman is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to improve his living with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase four calves and fodder

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
At the age of 51 Delia B. is the only one taking care of her family because she is already a widowed. She is the one earning income for the expenses in their everyday living and expenses for the studies of her 3 children, although her 2 children has a work now she never oblige them to give her some of their salaries because they have their own family, she know that they also need it although sometimes they give their mother.

Her farming business existed for 20 years now. This became their main source of income so she does her best with the help of her oldest son to make this business grow and give them enough income. When she became a member of Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), she always used the loan that she received to improve her business. So in her 8th times of making loan she will use this again for additional capital to farming business. She will buy all the necessary things needed by her business.

Because now Delia has no partner in taking care of her children she will work hard for her business to grow more, her business will became her partner to give her family a much better life.

loans.use: As additional capital for her farming business

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
Nieva D. L. is now a widow and is 62 years old. Her husband left her with one son, Manny, who helps her in their everyday living.

Nieva’s son is a farmer and that is why one source of their income is their farming business. Her son is guiding her to make the business earn more. They’ll be doing this business for a long time and that’s why she wants to continue running this.

So Nieva decided to use the loan that she received from Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. to improve this business. She will buy all the things that are needed for it to grow more.

She also wants to use the loan that she received in her other business, which is pig raising, by buying additional pigs to raise. This business also contributes income for them and that’s why, even if sometimes raising pigs is hard to do, she never gets tired of doing it.

A hope of Nieva is to increase the number of her pigs and have her farm give them enough revenue, especially so that her son’s family experiences a life that’s full of happiness.

loans.use: To improve her farm and to buy additional pigs

loans.name: Shamsaddin

texts.en:
Shamsaddin S. has raised cattle and farmed for fourteen years. With three children and the responsibility of providing food for his home, he has been able to improve his family’s financial situation thanks to the excellent care that he has given his animals.

Today Shamsaddin finds himself in need of purchasing calves to raise in order to be able to take greatest advantage of raising and selling them when necessary. For this reason he is obtaining loan in order to obtain these animals and raise them so that in time they can be used to support his family.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Azad

texts.en:
Azad A. is a 49-year-old married man who lives with his wife and four children. He has thirteen years of experience in raising cattle. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, he has become a very successful businessman.

Azad has a close-knit family that tries to help each other, so his wife and elder son help him in the business. He works very hard and spends his weekend time with the cattle, cleaning, feeding and pasturing them.

Now, Azad wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. He applied for a loan of 1607 AZN. With your help he can get ahead.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Mirismayil

texts.en:
Mirismayil M. is a young clothing merchant from Agsu, Azerbaijan. He started his small business when he was nineteen and gradually, through much hard work, he has been able to develop it into quite a successful enterprise.

Mirismayil has the qualities it takes to succeed as an entrepreneur. Goal-oriented, hard-working and punctual, he is a natural businessman.

Mirismayil has requested 1607 AZN to add to his available working capital. The ability to purchase large quantities of inventory in bulk saves time and expense for merchants such as Mirismayil. He would like to buy a supply of men's clothes for the autumn-winter season.

Mirismayil appreciates the availability of funding through AqroInvest Credit Union. It allows him to take advantage of good opportunities and focus on growing his business so that he is able to adequately provide for himself and his family.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal men's clothes

loans.name: Felicema

texts.en:
Felicema S. B. is now 64 years old and already a widow. Her husband left her with two children: Sheryl now has her own family and is working as a teacher, sometimes helping her mother with some expenses; and Pricela also helping her mother in running their business.

The main source of their income is Felicema’s variety store and also her food preparation business. Although her daughter gives her money from her salary, Felicema wants to pursue her business because this business gives them enough income for their daily expenses.

Now, Felicema will use her loan received from Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. to buy things that are needed in her two businesses. For her variety store she will buy rice, sugar, soap, canned goods, shampoo, cigarettes and other groceries. For her eatery she will buy different ingredients because she wants to diversify her menu.

Felicema swears that she will do everything to make her business grow, and for her family to experience a sumptuous way of living. She wants to help the family of her children.

loans.use: To finance her variety store and also her food preparation business

loans.name: Ilqar

texts.en:
Ilqar I. is a lively entrepreneur with a small business selling clothes for women in the bazaar of Agsu city. He is an experienced entrepreneur having been self-employed for the past ten years. Business has been good for Ilqar. There is always demand for clothing and women of Azerbaijan are coming to Ilqar`s shop to purchase something new for wedding parties.

Ilqar is married and has two children. He is doing his best to ensure that his children have a bright future.

Ilqar has requested a loan of 1607 AZN to increase his available working capital. This loan will help him purchase new inventory and continue to invest in his business. Eventually, Ilqar hopes to have his own small store.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal women's clothes

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly T. is married to Jerome T.. Joy Anne is their only daughter now in grade 1 primary level. At the age of 26 Shirly is already a business minded, always aiming high for the improvement of their business because she wants to help her husband in giving their child a better future. Her husband is now working as an agent in selling land. This is one of the sources of their income but it does not enough for the expenses in the house especially for the studies of their child. So Shirly pursue her business which is the making of Tinapa. Tinapa is a processed fish, usually made in fish that only found in the Philippines like bangus, tamban and galunggong. According to Shirly, in making a tinapa you will boil all the fish in a big bowl together with their ingredients, and then after boiling cook again in a big container. This business gives them an extra income.

So Shirly decided to use all her loan that she received from Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) in buying necessary things needed in her business because she wants to expand this to earn more income. Shirly only hoping what is the best for her family so she will never be tire of doing all the right way to improve their lives.

loans.use: Will be use to finance her business

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie A. is from the village of Mangidkid. She is 50 years old. Rosie is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Rosie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Rosie is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rosie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Isidro

texts.en:
Mr. Isidro is married and has one young son. He lives in Hernandarias in a very poor settlement. Isidro has a pantry for the neighborhood. He has have a few years selling a little merchandies and he wants to increase his merchandise as time goes on. 
Today he has a good shop and regular clients who know him in the community. He works very hard and is responsible for his commitments. With the loan he wants to buy various merchandise such as rice, sugar, and noodles for his shop.

loans.use: Rice, Sugar, Noodles

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita P. is from the village of Alegria. She is 43 years old. Teresita is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Teresita is just starting this business.

In 2008, Teresita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Teresita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Nercy

texts.en:
Nercy is married to Víctor, and they have two children, one who is 16 and another 5. They both run a grocery store in their house and are known well in their neighborhood. Mr. Víctor also works in a information enterprise called CDE.He makes a small amount of Money with other jobs. He wants a job where he can help his children and satisfy their family’s needs. 
They have demonstrated themselves to be very honest, reponsible, and committed people. 
Nercy has other loans with us, and she fulfills her obligations excellently. With the loans they plan to buy items such as rice, sugar, and noodles for their business.

loans.use: Rice, Sugar, Noodles

loans.name: Bensosa

texts.en:
Bensosa Q. is from the village of Mansabay. She is 62 years old. Bensosa is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Bensosa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Bensosa has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Bensosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bensosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Bensosa is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 20th loan taken out by Bensosa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: María

texts.en:
María is married to Nery, and they are both shopkeepers. She is 51 years old and dedicates her activities to taking care of the house. She has a small book business in her house. She also sells watches in a small center of the East City. Both work very hard, and she contributes capital with her husband. They hope to grow their businesses and augment the stock of their merchandise.

They have their own house, and one day they hope to have their own savings. With their loan they want to buy merchandise such as notebooks to sell.

loans.use: To buy notebooks for her store

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn A. is from the village of Southern Poblacion. She is 34 years old. Jocelyn is married and has 1 school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jocelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario H. Sevogia is a client of our enterprise, and he is the employee of a service station 4 km east of the city. He also has a place in his own house where people can pay bills on Mondays. He has one son with Jorgelina Quiroga Trinidad, and she also sells clothes independently.

They work very hard and demonstrate a good history of repayment with our Foundation. With the loan they plan to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael is married and has three children. They have a grocery store in their house, in a very poor area of the neighborhood.

Rafael works as a teacher and also in the construction business. He wants to start a small business to make some capital. With the income he wants to buy necessities for the house and educate his children.

Rafael has demonstrated himself to be very honest, responsible, and committed. He took other loans from us and completed the loans excellently. With this loan, he plans to buy various merchandise like sugar, rice, noodles, etc.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his store

loans.name: Romelia

texts.en: Romelia A. S. started a committee of women in 2006. She lives in an apartment 4 km away from the east city. She is the mother of 10 children, but only 2 are dependent on her. She operates a foundation with Isabel Vallareo, her neighbor and hard worker. She also has a small pantry shop. With her loan she wants to buy merchandise for her grocery shop.

loans.use: Merchandise to sell

loans.name: Veronica De Los Angeles

texts.es: Verónica de los Ángeles B. está casada con su esposo Mario por lo que juntos tienen 3 hijos a su cargo, ambos con muchos esfuerzos tratan de salir adelante para que a sus hijos no les falte el pan de cada día. Verónica se dedica a una pulpería, hace más de 9 años que trabaja en este negocio, por lo que le ha ido muy bien y ha sido muy beneficioso. El sueño de Verónica es tener un restaurante ya que a ella le gusta mucho cocinar, además este sería un gran negocio en su comarca. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas en general, refrescos naturales, pan, jugos y gaseosas.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Rony

texts.en:
Rony J. B. D. is a client of our enterprise and has a small child who is a year and a half. He is dedicated to buying, selling, and distributing balances for domestic animals and getting them vaccinated. 
He always distributes coconuts in his car about Km 6 Villa Elvira west of the city, where you can find micro-lending businesses. He tries to be a moral person that will pay back on time. With his loan he plans to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.use: buying merchandise

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: La Sra, Betty se dedica a la elaboracion de comida, hace ya aproximadamente 26 años, ella juntamente con su hija cocinan desde las 3 de la madruga, para que todo pueda estar listo ya para las 8 de la mañana, posteriormente procede a comenzar la preparacion de  los almuerzos para que este quede listo para las 11 de la mañana y se  proseda a la atencion de medio dia, que ademas le bastan tan solo 2 hrs. para terminar los 90 platos completos, tiene bastante clientela..

loans.use: Compra de sillas, mesas y manteles nuevos.

loans.name: Tiburcio

texts.en:
Mr. Tiburcio is 64 years old, is separated, and has five children. All are over 18 and don’t depend on him financially. He is humble and active, and his children help him in his Enterprise.

Mr. Tiburcio started to become an artist, but realized that it wasn’t a marketable profession. He wishes he had a good job and could obtain a good business so he doesn’t have to depend on his children. He wants to create another business  - a service to rent pool tables. With the loan he plans to buy pool tables to rent.

loans.use: To buy pool tables to rent

loans.name: Sergio Jacinto

texts.es: El señor Sergio Jacinto tiene su Kiosco el cual ya lleva mas de 8 años en ese puesto, con dulces , caramelos, galletas y refrescos los cuales vende a los que pasan por el lugar que es bastante concurrido.Tambien el señor es portero por las noches del Edificio "Asbun", que vive en las mismas instalaciones junto a su esposa y su hijo, trabaja como portero ya hace 6 años. El destino del credito es para comprar mas golosinas y mas refrescos por que es un lugar bastante transitado.

loans.use: Capital trabajo

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Mrs. Ma. Elena M. is from Brgy. Taloc, Bago City. She is 35 years old and married with two school age children. Her husband, Porperio, is employed as a family driver while Mrs. M. was staying at home to raise the children. However, the salary of her husband could not sustain the needs of the whole family, so she decided to join the project and obtain her first loan of PHP 3,000. She used the loan to buy assorted goods, such as thread, candles, sponges, and other household necessities to display in the local marketplace during the town's market day. Subsequently, she became aware of the income potential if she traveled from town to town at each town's market day. The business now earns her an average monthly profit of PHP 25,000.

Her last loan of PHP 10,000 was fully paid after paying each weekly installment on time. Now she is borrowing PHP 10,000 on her 14th cycle loan to continue having sufficient capital for inventory to sustain her traveling store.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for inventory

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: La sra. Elsa trabaja con la institución desde el año 2006, en un grupo solidario, descansó por un tiempo y ahora trabaja con su crédito individual, se dedica al tejido de busos, chompas, frazadones para bebés, y demas productos que le pidan; empezó con el tejido a mano, luego se compró su máquina tejedora con el crédito que le otorgamos, ahora tiene dos máquinas tejedoras y tiene más productos que ofrecer. Vive en la casa de su mamá, junto a su esposo que trabaja en un canal de televisión, y sus tres hijos que estudian en un colegio de la zona; es muy conocida en la zona por sus tejidos. Invertirá el crédito en la compra de una máquina recta y comprará  lana para  los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Elsa has been a solidarity group member with Emprender since 2006. She took a break for a little and now works using an individual loan. She weaves sweatshirts, jackets, sweaters, baby clothing, and other items that are requested. She began sewing by hand but later bought a sewing machine with a loan that she was received. Now she has two sewing machines, allowing her to offer more products. She lives in her mother's house with her husband, who works for a television channel, and three children who attend an area high school. She is known in her region for her weaving and sewing. She will invest this loan in the purchase of another sewing machine and wool for all of the orders she has.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and wool

loans.name: Walter Mauricio

texts.es: El señor Walter G., de 42 años de edad, reside en el barrio Healeah en la capital de Managua, casado, su esposa le tiene tres hijos de 13,15 y 17 años de edad,  y se dedica a la venta de ropa, cosméticos y otras variedades, para ayudar a sus hijos ya que los tres estudian y son muchos gastos. Don Walter fotógrafo profesional con 21 años de experiencia, de día a día sale a tomar sus fotos en diferente parte de la capital, su dificultades es que no trabaja con tecnología de punta por no tener el dinero suficiente para comprar los artefactos, ya que tiene que cubrir los gastos para su familia. Con este ciclo es su sexto  en Afodenic el cual invertirá en la compra de  una computadora para realizar trabajo de retoque en las fotografías digital. Entre sus planes es poder seguir mejorando la infraestructura de su casa que por ser los materiales caro ha ido poco a poco mejorando. Agradece a la institución por el financiamiento el cual se beneficiara para lograr su trabaja y vender mejor imagen lo que atraerá mejores ventas.
texts.en:
Mr. Walter G. is 42 years old. He lives in the Healeash neighborhood of Nicaragua’s capital, Managua. He is married and he and his wife have three children ages 13, 15, and 17. His wife sells clothing, cosmetics, and various other things to help pay the bills since all their children are students, which is expensive. Mr. Walter has been a professional photographer for 21 year. He goes out daily to take pictures in various parts of the capital. His problem is that he doesn’t work with point technology since he can’t afford to buy the equipment since he has so many household bills. With his sixth loan with Afrodeni, he will purchase a computer so he can edit digital photographs. He also hopes to continue to improve his home’s infrastructure. He has been making improvements slowly since the materials are expensive. He is grateful for this financial institution that helps him to create better pictures so he can make better sales.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer to be able to edit pictures.

loans.name: Leonarda Yamileth

texts.es: Leonarda Yamileth C. O. tiene la actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Leonarda tiene 42 años y tiene 4 hijos a su cargo, que son la razón por la que ella trabaja tan fuerte. Ella dio inicio a este negocio por cuenta propia, ella empezó a ofrecer ciertos productos como cremas y colonias a ciertas amistades cercanas, por lo que esto le logro dar resultado ya que recogía algo de dinero y esto fue ocupándolo para invertir en más productos. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de calzado, ropa, cremas, camisetas, pantalones y perfumes. Su deseo es comprar su propia casita en donde pueda vivir con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Leonarda Yamileth C. O. sells general merchandise. She is 42 years old and cares for her four children, who are the reason for her hard work. She started as an independent businesswoman by offering creams and colognes to a few close friends. This undertaking gave good results and she invested some of her profit in more products.

Leonarda applies for this loan to have working capital to buy shoes, clothes, creams, shirts, pants and perfumes. Her wish is to buy her own small house in which she can live with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gertrudis Alexandra

texts.es: Doña Gertrudis López de 45 años de edad, vive en el barrio 380 de la capital de Managua, comerciante de venta de ropa, calcomaniílla, pulsera y accesorios para el cabello, tiene once años en las ventas. Casada y con dos hijos de 5 y 16 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja en el área de informática en una empresa de telecomunicaciones, unos de sus planes es poder terminar de construir su casa. Aumentar el inventario de su negocio para mejorar las ventas ya que en los últimos años ha disminuido. Con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción para remodelar un cuarto y poder dar a sus pequeños hijos condiciones mejores. Agradece a Afodenic por el financiamiento para hacer las mejoras a su vivienda el cual es de gran beneficio para las familias nicaragüenses.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para remodelar un cuarto

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Mrs. Teodora N. is from Prk. San Jose, Brgy. Calumangan, Bago City. She is 53 years old and married to Ernesto N.. She has six school age children.

She has been a member of the NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999. Before she joined, Teodora already had a small vegetable farm, but she kept it for their family's consumption only. When some of her neighbors started inquiring about buying some of the vegetables that her family could not consume, Teodora got the idea that it would be a good income source if she increased her production and sold vegetables in the local market. As the volume of production grew, she started building good customer relations and soon had many regular customers, some of whom bought vegetables in bulk. Teodora also raised pigs in her backyard as a supplementary source of income. All these ventures were made possible because she is able to access loans for capital from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and the relationship prospers because Teodora always pays her weekly installments on time and fully pays her loan within its loan term.

Because her vegetable farm can for now sustain itself, Teodora plans to expand her pig fattening business. She is planning to borrow PHP 25,000 for her 8th cycle loan for this specific purpose.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Jose Tomas

texts.es: El señor José Tomas E. de 41 años de edad, reside en el barrio 380 en la capital de Managua, trabaja de operario en la alcaldía de Managua, tiene dos años de experiencia, casado, su esposa le tiene tres hijos todos estudian, su esposa vende comida rápida en el portón principal de una universidad para obtener ingresos y aportar a los gastos. Su meta es poder terminar de construir su casa y ayudar a sus hijos a que estudien. Con este financiamiento comprara zinc, para cambiar el techo de casa que esta en mal estado y poder dar a su familia una casa digna. agradece Afodenic por el apoyo que ha dado con los préstamo ya que ha logrado con cada financiamiento  hacer una mejora a su casa.
texts.en:
Señor José Tomas E., age 41, resides in Barrio 380 in the capital city of Managua. For two years, he has worked as a laborer in the Managua city hall.
