He is married with two children who are students. His wife sells fast food at the main gate of a university in order to obtain income and contribute to expenses. Señor E.’s goals are to be able to complete the construction of his house and to help his children finish their education.

With this financing he will buy zinc in order to change the roof on his house, which is in a bad state, and give his family a suitable home. He thanks Afodenic for the support that it has given with loans since he has succeeded with each in making an improvement to his house.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy zinc in order to change his house's roof, which is in bad condition

loans.name: United Group

texts.en:
United Group is a group of five borrowers led by Saah M.. He is 29 years old and a single father of two children, both five years old and in kindergarten. Saah also cares for two siblings. Saah is a college student. He lives and works in WestPoint, a slum north of the capital Monrovia, Liberia.

Saah's business is general home use products. He buys them wholesale and sells to the residents of downtown Monrovia, Liberia.
He started this business with LD $2500.00 and has been running his business for six years. Saah takes care of his children with the income from this business. He approaches his customers in a very good manner and sells good products to them to encourage them to always come and buy from him.
Saah is hoping to expand his business in the future.
He needs this loan to purchase more general home use products in order to expand his business.
He dreams of giving him and his family a better life.

loans.use: To purchase more general home use products

loans.name: Pauline Menongbé

texts.fr: S. Pauline Menongbé est née en 1966 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative du Bénin. Pauline Menongbé est mariée à KOUGBENOU Dansou, un chauffeur. Le couple a six enfants tous encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Adjarra dans la Commune de Porto-Novo depuis vingt et un an. Pauline Menongbé et son mari supportent ensemble les charges de la famille. Pauline Menongbé vend des tissus, des couvertures et des bijoux de façon ambulante et ceci depuis dix ans. Pauline Menongbé a eu déjà deux crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Pauline Menongbé sollicite aujourd’hui encore un troisième crédit d’ALIDé pour augmenter la taille de son activité.
texts.en:
Pauline Menongbé S. was born in 1966 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Bénin. Pauline Menongbé is married to KOUGBENOU Dansou, a chauffeur. The couple have six children for whom they are still responsible. The family has been living in Adjarra in the commune of Porto-Novo for 21 years.

Pauline Menongbé and her husband support their family together. Pauline Menongbé has been selling cloth, coverlets, and costume jewelry on foot through the neighborhoods for 10 years. She has already received two loans from ALIDé, loans that she reimbursed apropriately. She is now requesting a third loan from ALIDé to be used to grow her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cloth and costume jewelry

loans.name: Tania Marleni

texts.es:
Tania es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Tania es soltera, tiene 21 años y vive con sus padres, estudiante de Contabilidad, Tania tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García en donde vende carne, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su mama.
Tania necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra carne.
Los sueños de Tania son terminar sus estudios y tener un hotel.
texts.en:
Tania is a member of the Communal Bank “Tulipanes” (Tulips). She is 21 years old, single, and lives with her parents. Tania is studying accounting. She has a vending post at the Nery García Market where she sells meat. Her mother helps her with this business.

Tania needs a loan of 1050 soles to buy more meat. She dreams of finishing her studies and opening a hotel.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat

loans.name: San Antonio De Padua Group

texts.es: Es un grupo nuevo muy responsables en sus pagos, venden en un solo lugar se conocen bien. Su grupo se llama "SAN ANTONIO DE PADUA", donde, el Banco de Emprendimiento esta en su 2º Ciclo, la  mesa directiva esta conformada la siguiente manera,  como presidenta esta  la señora Rossemary V. ,ella es lider de su grupo,muy responsable, vende pollos frito en carrito, tiene 3 hijos, es casada su esposo trabaja en la policia. Como tesorera esta la socia Evelin F. C.  quien es muy responsable y conocedora del manejo del efectivo. Tiene 1 hijo vive en concubinato vende CDs,  el credito lo utiliza para  aumento de capital. Como secretaria esta la socia Carla T. Illanes vive con sus padres es soltera no tiene hijos, estudia Barbulario,el credito lo utiliza para aumento de capital, ella tiene la venta de refrescos.
texts.en:
This is a new group in which the members have been responsible with their payments. They all sell at a single location that is well-known. The group is called “San Antonio de Padua” and the members are in their 2nd loan cycle. The board consists of the following members: Sra. Rosmery V. serves as the president and leader of the group. She is very responsible. She sells fried chicken from a cart. Rosmery has 3 children and is married to a police officer. Evelin F. C. serves as the treasurer. She is very responsible and is known for being an effective manager. She has 1 child with her live-in partner. Evelin sells compact discs and will use her loan to increase her capital. Carla T. Illanes serves as the secretary. She is single, does not have children, and lives with her parents. Carla is studying speech communications. She will use her loan to increase her capital for her soft drinks business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for improving their businesses

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Maria es casada, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Maria vende cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, sus ventas en gran parte son al crédito.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cosméticos.
Los sueños de Maria son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una tienda de cosméticos.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Communal Bank “Tulipanes” (Tulips). She is 38 years old, married, and has 2 children. Maria sells cosmetics by catalog and offers her products to friends and relatives. Most of her sales are made on credit.

Maria needs a loan of 1050 soles to buy more cosmetics. She hopes that her children become professionals and dreams of opening a cosmetics store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Maria es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Maria vende cosméticos por catálogos, que ofrece a amigos y familiares, además Maria prepara harina de cereales que prepara en su casa y los vende a pedido.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Maria sueña con tener un puesto para vender sus productos y tener una casa propia.

loans.use: Para la compra de cereales.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda L., who lives in the village of Buenavista Sibong, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental, is 40 years old, married, and the mother of two daughters who are 8 and 12 years old. Emelda dreams of securing the future of her family and lifting them out of poverty by giving her daughters an education, sending them to earn college degrees when they grow up. She is very optimistic that she will achieve this goal because her daughters excel in school - both earning first honors in the past year.

At first, only her husband was engaged in selling “Balut” around their community, neighboring villages and the nearby towns, but even with his best efforts, his income could not provide for everything that the family needs. Since "Balut" is such a popular Filipino snack, Emelda knew that if she helped her husband and sold "Balut" in other places, she'd would earn an income, and this is what she did. When she was able to save enough, she put up a small general store adjacent to her house, but she also continued with her "Balut" vending.

When she needed fresh capital to expand her business, she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005. She reciprocates the support provided by NWTF-PD by paying back her weekly installments on time and paying the loan in full within the set loan term. Emelda has continuously maintained her good credit standing, and the loans she takes help her increase her income potential. Her present average monthly income is PHP 9,000, which enables her to save for her daughters' future education.

For her previous loan, her twelfth, she borrowed Php 10,000 as additional capital for her “Balut” business. Now that she has fully repaid that loan within its term, she plans to take another loan of PHP 13,000 for her 13th cycle loan which she plans to use to purchase additional inventory and working capital for her business. She intends to use the income from this loan to continue supporting the household expenses and the education of her daughters.

Emelda is shown in the picture posing inside her general store with some of the "balut" eggs.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a mere $1 a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory and working capital for her Balut business

loans.name: Enma Rita

texts.es:
Enma es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Enma es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Enma tiene un molino en su casa en donde procesa cereales variados en harinas, sus ventas los realiza a diferentes instituciones. Además Enma brinda servicios de molido.
Enma necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo y cebada.
Enma sueña con ampliar su local y buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Enma is a member of the Communal Bank “Tulipanes” (Tulips). She is 39 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 2 children. Enma has a mill in her home where she processes different grains into flour. She sells her products to different institutions. She also provides milling services.

Enma needs a loan of 2100 soles to buy wheat and barley. She dreams of expanding her business and providing a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wheat & barley

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es: La señora Feliciana se dedica ala venta de ropa  de hombre y de mujer el cual lleva hace 8 años en el comercio, tambien en su tienda vende ropa interior al por mayor y menor, vive en casa alquilada mas de 8 años, el destino del credito es para poder traer mercaderia de la ciudad de La Paz, el cual le sale mas barato comprando de ahi. Vive con sus hijos que no dependen de ella, tiene dos tiendas de ropa,que crecio con emprender y es clienta antigua.

loans.use: Capital Trabajo

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Aurora es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Aurora tiene un salón de belleza llamado Aurora, actividad que realiza eventualmente. Además Aurora junto a su esposo tienen un carro con el cual realizan transporte publico.
Aurora necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de neumáticos.
Los sueños de Aurora son mejorar su negocio y comprar otro carro mas moderno.
texts.en:
Aurora is a member of "Banco Comunal Tulipanes. She lives with her significant other, she is 31 years old and has 2 children. Aurora has a beauty parlor named Aurora where she works eventually. Besides, together with her husband they own a car used for public transportation.

Aurora needs a loan of 600 soles to be invested in buying tires. It is her dream to improve business and purchase a more modern car.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires for a vehicle.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Delia es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Delia vive en el distrito de Kimbiri en la selva ayacuchana, en donde tiene una tienda de abarrotes actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Delia tiene un carro con el cual realizan transporte publico.
Delia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Delia son comprar un terreno para construir su casa y que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of "Banco Comunal Tulipanes". Delia lives with her significant other, she is 30 years old and has 2 children. She lives in the district of Kimbiri in the ayacuchana forest where she works daily at her grocery store. She also owns a car used for public transportation.,

Delia needs a loan of 1050 soles to be invested in buying rice and sugar. It is Delia's dream to buy a plot of land to build her house and that her children study.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice and sugar for a grocery store.

loans.name: One Business Group

texts.en:
One Business is group of four borrowers led by Patricia S.. She is a 28-year-old high school graduate and a single mother of a 6-year-old child who attends kindergarten. She lives in Waterside, a commercial area of downtown Monrovia, Liberia.

Patricia's business is clothing.She buys clothes wholesale and sells at retail to the residents of downtown Monrovia, Liberia.
She started this business with LD $5000.00 and has been running her business for eight years. She hopes to expand her business to a bigger store.
Patricia sells quality products and gives her customers a better approach to encourage them to always come to patronize her business.
She needs a loan in order to purchase more quality goods to expand her business.
Patricia dreams of giving her children a better education and good health care.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing

loans.name: Glendise

texts.es:
Glendise es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Glendise es casada, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, Glendise viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende frutas y de las ferias compra cereales, quesos, productos que vende en los mercados y de casa en casa.
Glendise necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo y cebada.
Los sueños de Glendise son terminar de construir su casa y comprar otro terreno.
texts.en:
Glendise is a member of "Banco Comunal Tulipanes". She is married, 39 years old, and has 3 children. Glendise travels to different regional markets to sell fruits and to buy cereals and cheese to be sold on the markets and from door to door.

Glendise needs a loan of 1500 soles to be invested in buying wheat and barley. It is Glendise's dream to finish building her house and buy another plot of land.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wheat and barley.

loans.name: Angeles Mirelly

texts.es: La señora Angeles tiene su puesto de comida en el pequeño mercado de la Zona Florida Sud, vende con su suegra con cual lleva hace 5 años en ese sector, el destino del credito es para comprar sillas y mesas, tambien verduras para cocinar, y asi preparar sus platos de comida por que esta frente a la aduana, la señora tiene bastante cliente, su esposo es transportista de larga distancia, el cual se pierde por semanas y ella se queda sola con su hijo y viven en la casa de su suegra, la que tambien es cocinera y esta en ese puesto mas de 10 años.

loans.use: Capital Trabajo

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita.
Maruja es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Maruja tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende verduras, abarrotes, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Maruja necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Maruja son tener estabilidad económica y brindar educación a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maruja is a member of "Banco Comunal Morenita". She lives with her significant other, is 33 years old and has 2 children. Maruja has a general store at her house where she sells vegetables, groceries, and fruits on a daily basis.

Maruja needs a loan of 2000 soles to be invested in buying rice and sugar. It is her dream to have economic stability and offer schooling to her children so they may become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice and sugar.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita
Miriam es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Miriam junto a su mama tienen un restaurante actividad que realizan todos los días, además Miriam trabaja en una institución como personal administrativo. Además su esposo tiene un taller de fibra en vidrio.
Miriam necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en el negocio de su esposo.  
Los sueños de Miriam son que sus hijos sean profesionales y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Miriam is a member of "Banco Comunal Morenita". Miriam lives with her significant other, is 30 years old and has 2 children. Together with her mother, Miriam owns a restaurant where she works on a daily basis, and besides she works as an administrator at an institution. Her husband owns a fiberglass workshop.

Miriam needs a loan of 900 soles to be invested in her husband's business. It is Miriam's dream that her children become professionals and get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in husband's business.

loans.name: Roberto Angelo

texts.es: Angelo es una joven muy hábil, se dedica a la confección de calzados de mujer. Comenzó con esta actividad gracias a su tio quien le enseño la profesión. Realiza calzados de cuerina y ahora quiere hacer calzados de cuero por lo que solicita el crédito para comprar una máquina más grande y con más fuerza. Angelo vive en la casa de su tía, la señora María Dolores, quien trabaja como empleada en el Hotel Camino Real y además ella recibe renta como administradora de su auto que hace trabajar de taxi. Ellos viven en la zona de Alto Pampahasi. Angelo vivía en la Ciudad de Cochabamba donde aprendió a hacer trabajos en bronce.
texts.en:
Angelo is a very able young man, dedicated to making women's shoes. He began this activity thanks to his uncle who taught him the profession. He makes shoes from imitation leather and now he wishes to make leather shoes, for which reason he asks for a loan to buy a larger and more powerful machine.

Angelo lives in his Aunt Maria Dolores' house. She is employed in the Camino Real Hotel and also receives income from her car which she lets out as a taxi. They live in the Alto Pampahasi zone. Angelo used to live in the city of Cochabamba where he learned to make objects in bronze.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY A MACHINE TO SEW LEATHER AND 2 SETS OF SHOEMAKER'S LASTS

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita.
Nancy es soltera, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Nancy tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite.
Los sueños de Nancy son que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the village bank Morenita. She is single, 35 years old, and has 3 children. She has a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables and fruits. With the help of her children, Nancy operates this business every day.

Nancy needs a loan of 1200 soles which she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar and oil.

Nancy dreams that her children will be professionals and that she can grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, sugar and oil

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita.
Victoria es casada, tiene 52 años y 3 hijos, Victoria se dedica a procesar cereales, en maíz pelado, trigo pelado, harina de trigo, quinua lavada, actividad que realiza en su casa.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de maíz.
Los sueños de Victoria son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y tengan un negocio.

loans.use: Para la compra de maíz.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita.
Julia es casada, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos, Julia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes y bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hija. Julia tiene proyectado viajar a las ferias.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Julia sueña con ampliar su tienda y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Morenita Communal Bank. Julia is 48, married, and has four children. Julia has a store in her house where she sells groceries and drinks. She does this every day with her daughter’s help. Julia plans to travel to the fairs. Julia needs a loan for 1,200 PEN, which she will use to buy rice and sugar. Julia’s dreams are to expand her store and that her children finish their education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Mondukpè Bénédicte

texts.fr: A. Mondukpè Bénédicte est née en 1970 à Tanzoun. Mondukpè Bénédicte est mariée à HOUNYE Alphonse, un ferrailleur. Le couple a quatre enfants encore à sa charge. La famille vit depuis quinze à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative du Bénin. Mondukpè Bénédicte vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille grâce au revenu de son activité. En effet, Mondukpè Bénédicte vend à manger de façon ambulante. C’est du riz et du haricot que Mondukpè Bénédicte vend depuis bientôt cinq ans. C’est à Ouando, un marché de Porto-Novo que Mondukpè Bénédicte fait ses provisions. Mondukpè Bénédicte a eu déjà deux crédits de ALIDé. Mondukpè Bénédicte a bien remboursé ces deux crédits et sollicite aujourd’hui un troisième pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de riz, de haricot  et de bidons d’huile d’arachide.

loans.name: God Friend Group

texts.en:
God Friend is a group of five borrowers led by Grace S.. She is 51 years old and married with six children aged 19-29 years old.  Their educational levels are 10th grade-University level.
Grace is a 9th grade dropout due to poverty.
She and her family live and work in Water Side, a commercial area in downtown Monrovia, Liberia.
 
Grace's business is preparing and selling food to residents of downtown Monrovia, Liberia.
She started this business with LD $1000.00 and has been running this business for eight years. She hopes to expand to a restaurant.
Grace gives her customers a good manner of approach and prepares her food nicely and cleanly. That's why she has so many customers and has reached this far.
She needs this loan in order to purchase more food ingredients to serve her customers.
Grace dreams of giving her children a good education and better medical care.

loans.use: To purchase more food ingredients

loans.name: Kuña Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Guillermina D. and her friends have formed a comittee in their community. The committee of Kuña Pyapy Mbarete is in the fourth cycle of their 17th member, and is a very important Group in the neighborhood to be single and responsible for themselves. They own a savings account of 2,759,322 guaranís. 
The women withdrew a loan of 300,000 to 1,100,000 guaranís to buy merchandise for retail, such as clothes, fruits, drinks, etc. 
Each woman is using the loan to purchase different things. Guillermina D. is using her loan to buy and sell tapioca. Florencia E. is using her loan for domestic goods. Amanda G. is using her loan to buy and sell clothes. Norma Brande is using her loan to buy and sell personal clothes. Inocencia S. is using her loan to buy and sell fruits and vegetables. Dora A. is using her loan to buy teaching supplies. Rosa L. is using her loan to buy and sell grocery items. Alba G. is using her loan for a cafeteria. Epifanía F. is using her loan to buy and sell drinks. Ramona D. is using her loan to buy and sell clothes. Alicia

loans.use: food, clothes, drinks, cleaning products

loans.name: Geralyn

texts.en:
Being a single parent is not easy because you have to be both mother and father to your child. But this is what Geralyn C. does. She is a 29-year-old single mother with an 11-year-old child, and they live in the village of Brgy, Canroma, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental. She dreams of giving her child a better future and a good education while providing them both with a good life and financial security.

Because of her dreams for her child, Geralyn is determined to find ways to reach her goals. That's why she opened a general store and joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004. This turned out to be a good partnership. NWTF-PD lends her capital which she pays back on time, and she has become an active member of her group and its center. She earns an average of PHP 6,000 monthly from her hard work and industriousness.

For her previous loan, which was her sixth, Geralyn borrowed PHP 19,500. The loan increased her revenue and her profits. She is applying for a new loan for the same amount to buy additional inventory and as a source of working capital. 

She is proud of her achievements, both in business and as a single parent, and knows that she will continue to have the trust and confidence that NWTF-PD by continuing her good credit rating.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through our programs, these women have progressed from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable, thanks to our Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory for her general store, and also to have more working capital

loans.name: Noel

texts.es: El señor Noel V. de 43 años de edad, es taxista con cinco años de experiencia, vive en el barrio 380 de la capital de Managua, casado, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 8 y 12 años de edad, que estudian, ella hace nacatamales para vender y poder ayudar a su familia con los gastos, desde horas muy tempranas don Noel se levanta para dar un chequeo a su taxi para salir brindar el servicio a sus pasajeros. Este es su onceavo crédito en Afodenic y con cada crédito ah mejorado su vivienda, como su unidad de taxi. Con este crédito comprara materiales de construcción para terminar de construir la cocina de su casa. Y poder tener la comodidad y aseo en su hogar. Se siente contento por los financiamientos que ha dado la institución ya que solo a través de ellos ha logrado las mejoras necesarias de su vivienda. Y como muchas familias Nicaragüenses poder tener una casa digna para su familia.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion y poder terminar de construir la cosina

loans.name: Cora Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Cora del Socorro S. de 49 años de edad, madre soltera de un hijo de 17 años de edad, que estudia, trabaja como conserje en un colegio americano desde hace 24 años, reside en el bario Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, una de sus deseos es poder ayudar a su hijo a que sea un hombre honrado y preparado ante esta sociedad, ya que ha muchos esfuerzos ha sobresalido a delante para lograr tener su propia vivienda ya que es lo mas caro de lograr para muchos hermanos Nicaragüense por que todo esta caro y solo mediante el financiamiento podremos comenzar hacer posibles las metas. Este es el onceavo crédito en Afodenic el cual comprara zinc, perlines y otros para poner el techo a la sala y una parte a los cuartos. Espera seguir en su empleo, a si como poder tener mejores prestaciones sociales.
texts.en:
Cora del Socorro Sequeiro is a 49 year old single mother. She has a 17 year old son who goes to school. She has worked as a janitor in the American School for 24 years. She lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital of Managua. One of her wishes is to be able to help her son become an honorable man who is prepared for this world. She has put forth much effort and has been able to get ahead. She has her own house, which is very hard for many Nicaraguans to do because everything is expensive. Loans are the only way we can begin to reach our goals. This is her eleventh loan with Afodinic. She will buy zinc sheets, beams, and other things to be able to put a roof on the living room and a part of the rooms. She hopes to continue with her work in order to have better benefits.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy zinc sheets and beams to put a roof on the living room and a part of the rooms

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La joven María V. de 25 años de edad, vive en memorial Sandino, tiene un hijo de cinco años de edad, madre soltera, con su propio negocio una pulpería lo inicio hace dos años y medio con porciones pequeñas de productos, durante este tiempo ha encontrado dificultades con las bajas  económica del país y menos ventas, tiene en primer instancia la construcción de un cuarto para protección y seguridad de su familia ya que donde habita su casa es sencilla mitad de piedra y madera es por eso la urgencia de poder tener algo mas seguro, anteriormente trabaja como operadora en la zona franca y desde ese tiempo inicio la remodelación y anexos de su vivienda. Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloques, arena, zinc y una puerta. Obteniendo la comodidad y seguridad a al misma vez. Dando gracia a la institución por promover el financiamiento para su vivienda. Espera mantener el margen de venta para seguir mejorando día a día su negocio

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion como:piedra arena, cemento ,hiero y otros para hacer un cuarto

loans.name: Huacchacunapac Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal HUACCHACUNAPAC; están ubicados en la comunidad campesina de Ccapana, en el distrito de Quispicachis, en el departamento de Cusco, a 4 horas de la misma ciudad el Cusco.

Nuestros socios son un grupo de 14 miembros, todos ellos alternan sus actividades principales con diferentes comercios, principalmente ellos son agricultores, tienen en su mayoría tierras de cultivo, de papa, maíz; seguidamente a esta actividad tenemos a los ganaderos, que son socios que compran ganados vacunos y los engordan y reproducen, para así mejorar sus razas o vender sus crías, también sacan derivados de la vaca, como son la leche fresca, el yogurt natural y queso de la zona; otros socios venden los productos secos, como son semillas, pallares, maíz, cereales, habas, entre otros. Nuestros socios solicitan el préstamo para así seguir invirtiendo en mejorar su producción y su calidad de vida mediante sus actividades.

Nuestros socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank HUACCHACUNAPAC live in the rural community of Ccapana, in the Quispicachis district of the Cusco region, which is four hours from the city of Cusco. This bank has 14 members who are engaged in a variety of business activities. Principally they are farmers, cultivating land to produce potatoes and corn. Others are engaged in the production of livestock; they purchase cattle and fatten them and reproduce them so that they can improve their breeds and sell their calves. In addition they produce dairy products from the cows, such as fresh milk and natural yogurts and cheeses. Other members sell dry products such as seeds, lima beans, corn, cereals and beans, among others. This group is requesting a loan to continue investing in improving their production and their quality of life through these activities. The group members appreciate and value the loan granted through these means, and commit to making the payments on the debt in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Maria Raquel

texts.es: La joven María R., tiene 26 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo. Como madre soltera la seguridad de su familia es primordial, trabaja en su negocio de comercializar ropa para damas y caballero. Desde hace siete años vende en su casa y lo inicio con fondos propios, cantidades pequeña. Gracias a los préstamos en Afodenic a logrado ir aumentando su inventario, con el préstamo que ha solicitado en Afodenic es para comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, cerámica, arena y cerámica para poner en la parte de la sala obteniendo una mejor comodidad. Unos de sus proyectos a corto plazo es tener en su casa una tienda en la cual se venda no solo ropa sino artículos para el hogar u otros productos que le generan mayores utilidades. Da las gracias ala institución por el beneficio de lograr los objetivos de hacer la mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
María R. is 26 years old, single, and has one child. Like any single mother, providing security for her family is of utmost importance. María earns a living selling clothing for women and men. She started her business seven years ago selling clothes out her home. Using her own funds, she bought and sold a few quantities at a time. Thanks to loans from AFODENIC, she was able to increase her inventory.

She is now requesting another loan from AFODENIC to buy construction materials such as cement, ceramics, and sand in order to finish part of her living room to make it more comfortable. One of her short-term projects is to have a store where she sells household items in addition to clothing. María hopes this will help her generate more income. She thanks the Institution for assisting her with making improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials needed to finish a living room

loans.name: Salomon

texts.es: El señor Salomón de 55 años edad, habitante en el barrio Healeah, tiene un hijo de quince años, unos de sus proyecto en terminar de construir su vivienda. Tiene su propio negocio una pulpería en su casa de habitación, desde hace diez años tiene su negocio lo inicio con pocas cantidades de productos y con fondos propios, ha encontrado dificultades como la falta de financiamientos. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lo invertirá en  la compra de nuevos productos como: frutas, vegetales, carne de res y pollo. Aumentando sus ventas generándole mayores utilidades. Lo cual aumentara las ventas, ya que invertirá en consumo diario de los alimentos de los capitalinos.
texts.en:
Salomón, 55, lives in the Healeah neighborhood. He has a 15 year old son. One of his projects is to finish building his house. He has his own business, a store, which is in his house. He has had the business for ten years. He started with small quantities of products and his own funds. He encountered difficulties, like the lack of financing. Thanks to the loan from Afodenic he will buy new products like fruit, vegetables, beef, and chicken. This will increase his sales and generate greater profits. He will invest in food that the residents of the capital consume daily.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains, chicken, fruit, and others

loans.name: Silbio Antonio

texts.es: El señor Silbio Antonio Cáceres C. , tiene la edad de 40 años habita en el barrio , San Juan de los Ríos , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ya que ellos tienen tres hijos a su cargo , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios , don Silbio desde hace 31 años se dedica a la agricultura ya que fue beneficiado con las reforma agraria . Le agradece a la institución por su buena aprobación ya que durante ocho ciclo le hemos brindado apoyo financiero para que obtenga mejores precio en la venta del producto. Con este financiamiento comprara fertilizantes y venenos y poder aplicar al cultivo para una mejor producción lo cual es de mucho beneficio ya que vende su productos a mejor precio en el mercado.

loans.use: Comprar fertilizantes y venenos para una mejor produccion

loans.name: Sara Gabriela

texts.es: La señora Sara Gabriela López Pérez , tiene la edad de 54 años , habita en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como cobrador para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen seis hijos , ya todos son casados e independiente , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña Sara desde hace 16 años se dedica a la agricultura ya que sus padres le heredaron para que la trabajara , ella esta contenta con el apoyo que le hemos brindado al sector agrícola ya que son muchas personas que se benefician así como ella que logro mejorar la producción y venderla a un mejor precio y cancelar su préstamo. El financiamiento será para comprar fertilizantes y aplicar al cultivo. Sus planes es poder hacer toda su casa de concreto para mayor seguridad y presentación
texts.en:
Sara Gabriela López Pérez is 54, and she lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla division with her husband. He works as a conductor to help her with the household expenses. They have six children. All of them are married and independent. The family plan is to improve their living conditions. For 16 years Sara has been a farmer. She inherited it from her parents so that she could work. She is happy with the support we have offered the agricultural sector because there are a lot of people who benefit like she has. She was able to improve production, sell at a better price, and repay her loan. The loan is to buy fertilizers to put on her crops. Her plan is to be able to make her whole house concrete. This will look better and provide greater security.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to put on her crops

loans.name: Pablo Emilio

texts.es: El Joven Pablo Emilio A. M., tiene la edad de 23años habita en San José de los ríos ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su padres, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar sus padres , el joven agradece a la institución ya que gracias al financiamiento obtenido logro cancelar en tiempo y forma ; a la vez estableció ¼ de piñas mas para seguir trabajando las tierras que su papá le facilito para que las explotara cultivándola .Se siente contento por el apoyo que se le brida tanto a él como a  otros agricultores para que en futuro puedan vivir cómodamente. Comprara con préstamo insumos agrícolas para mejorar sus cultivos.

loans.use: Comprar insumos agricola para mejorar los productos

loans.name: Erick Antonio

texts.es: El señor Erick Antonio E.  tiene la edad de 37 años habita en el barrio santa Rosa ubicado en la cuidad de Masaya, junto a su familia, el es soltero, pero tiene a cargo una niña de diez años que actualmente estudia su primaria, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, él desde hace tres años se dedica a la venta de zapatos usados y nuevos, se siente contento por la aprobación de su préstamo ya que con el crédito anterior logro mejorar su negocio hasta invertir un poco en su vivienda , los planes hacia un futuro es lograr establecer una tienda de calzado, y ir aumentando  su negocio. Comprara zapatos para adultos como para niños.
texts.en:
Erick Antonio E., 37, lives with his family in the Santa Rosa neighborhood, which is in the city of Masaya. He is single, but he is raising a ten year old girl who is currently in primary school. The family plan is to improve their living conditions. For three years he has been selling new and used shoes. He is happy that his loan was approved. With his previous loan he was able to improve his business and even invest a little in his house. His future plan is to establish a shoe store and to expand his business. He will buy shoes for adults and for children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes for adults and children

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Five months ago, Viviana took the plunge and bought a beauty business. She had been thinking about starting her own business in order to progress economically and, specifically, give her daughter better opportunities. She says that every day brings a new challenge, but she enjoys confronting these challenges in order to maintain a successful business.

Now, she will use her ACCION USA loan to put a deposit on a rental contract for her storefront. She hopes that, in the future, her young business will bring her and her daughter a better and more prosperous life.

loans.use: To put a deposit on a rental contract for her storefront

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia es socia del Banco Comunal Musuq Rumi que significa Nueva Piedra en quechua.
Aurelia es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 1 hija, Aurelia tiene una tienda en un local alquilado que se encuentra cerca del mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde vende golosinas en general, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su esposo.
Aurelia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas.
Los sueños de Aurelia son tener otra sucursal y que su hija culmine sus estudios.

loans.use: Para la compra de gaseosas.

loans.name: Sonia Mirtha

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Musuq Rumi que significa Nueva Piedra en quechua.
Sonia es casada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Sonia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual de su hermana.
Sonia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Sonia son que su negocio crezca y que sus hijos salgan adelante.

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, azúcar.

loans.name: Mayda

texts.es:
La socia Mayda, pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKAY HUAYNA”; ubicado en el valle sagrado de los Inkas, exactamente en la provincia de Urubamba.

Nuestra socia tiene años de edad, 33 años de edad y es madre soltera,  tiene 2 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella vende cosméticos en el municipio de Urubamba, nuestra socia vende por catálogos y luego los distribuye a quienes le hayan pedido, espera al día de pago y los visita nuevamente a sus clientes y cobra lo que le deben. Nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para poder adquirir un mayor número de productos y de este modo tener una buena y surtida mercadería.
 
La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mayda is a member of the Llankay Huayna Communal bank, which is located in the sacred valley of the Incas, exactly in the Urubamba province. Our member is 33, and she is the single mother of two children. She alternates her activities between her household chores and her business. She sells cosmetics in the Urubamba municipality. Our member sells by catalog. She later delivers them to the people who have placed orders. She waits until the payday, and then she visits her customers again to collect what they owe. Our member needs a loan to be able to acquire a greater number of products. This way she will have good, well stocked merchandise. Our member values and is grateful for the loan given by this means. She promises to make her payments on the established dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja es socia del Banco Comunal Musuq Rumi que significa Nueva Piedra en quechua.
Maruja es casada, tiene 34 años y 3 hijos, Maruja viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende pescado, pollo y de las ferias compra quesos, animales menores que vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Maruja necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de queso y cerdo.
Los sueños de Maruja son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maruja is a member of the Musuq Rumi, which in Quechua means New Rock, Communal Bank. Maruja is 34, married, and has three children. Maruja travels to different regional fairs where she sells fish and chicken. At the fairs she buys cheese and small animals, which she sells in the city of Ayacucho. Maruja needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy cheese and pork. Maruja’s dreams are that her children become professionals and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cheese and pork

loans.name: Aparicio

texts.es:
Aparicio es socio del Banco Comunal Musuq Rumi que significa Nueva Piedra en quechua.
Aparicio es casado, tiene 49 años y 6 hijos, Aparicio viaja a las ferias de la región en donde compra animales, la carne lo vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho junto a su esposa.
Aparicio necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno.
Los sueños de Aparicio son educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Aparicio is a member of the Musuq Rumi Communal Bank (which means 'New Rock') in Quechua, Peru. He is 49, married and has six children. Aparicio travels to buy cattle, and sells the meat at the market in Ayacucho with the help of his wife. He needs a $700 loan to buy more cattle. He dreams of being able to provide all his children with good education so they can become professionals, and to improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El socio Miguel,  pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKAY HUAYNA”; ubicado en el valle sagrado de los Inkas, exactamente en la provincia de Urubamba.

Nuestro socio tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente, el socio aún no tiene hijos y se dedica a realizar muchas tareas de albañilería y construcción, nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de algunos materiales y hacer un capital de trabajo para realizar obras. 

El socio valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal Musuq Rumi que significa Nueva Piedra en quechua.
Lucia es soltera, tiene 54 años y 3 hijos, Lucia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Lucia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Lucia son ampliar su negocio y brindar estabilidad a sus hijos.

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz y azúcar.

loans.name: Milda

texts.es:
La socia Milda, pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKAY HUAYNA”; ubicado en el valle sagrado de los Inkas, exactamente en la provincia de Urubamba.

Nuestra socia tiene  35 años de edad, es conviviente, la socia aún no tiene hijos , nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella se dedica desde siempre al cultivo de hortalizas y de muchas variedades de flores, el río grande una zona bastante fértil para estos productos, nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para la fertilización de tierras, semillas, y distribución de las mismas.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
La socia Delfina, pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKAY HUAYNA”; ubicado en el valle sagrado de los Inkas, exactamente en la provincia de Urubamba.

Nuestra socia tiene 36 años de edad, es casada 2 tiene hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella se encarga de la crianza de animales menores, ella cría cuyes al por mayor para luego venderlos y algunas aves de corral, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: Capital para mejorar su pequeño negocio.

loans.name: Yohny

texts.es:
La socia Yohny, pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKAY HUAYNA”; ubicado en el valle sagrado de los Inkas, exactamente en la provincia de Urubamba.

Nuestra socia tiene 33 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos y nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella tiene su tienda de abarrotes en su casa, la socia está situada en el barrio más tradicional de Urubamba junto a bellos pisonays, son árboles antiguos y frondosos, nuestra socia tiene este negocio desde hace 5 años, la socia requiere el préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio e implementarlo aún más.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner, Yohny, belongs to the communal bank "LLANKAY HUAYNA", located in the sacred valley of the Incas, exactly in the province of Urubamba. She is 33 years old, has 4 children, and alternates between her household chores and retail trade. She has her grocery store in her house, which is situated in the most traditional neighborhood of Urubamba, alongside beautiful pisonays, which are lush, ancient trees. Our partner has had this business for 5 years and requires this loan to reinvest in it and further develop it. Yohny values and appreciates the loan provided through these means and is committed to follow through with her payments in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in her grocery store.

loans.name: Blanca Namerta

texts.es:
Blanca es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta.
Blanca es separada, tiene 53 años y 4 hijos, Blanca tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 D. abril en donD. venD. ropa, además Blanca viaja  a las ferias D. L. región en donD. venD. ropa. Además Blanca confecciona ropa típica.
Blanca necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. ropa D. bebe y telas.
Los sueños D. Blanca son tener mas capital y aumentar su mercadería.

loans.use: Para la compra de ropa de bebe y telas.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta.
Angélica es soltera, tiene 24 años y vive con sus padres, estudiante de Contabilidad en la universidad, Angélica junto a su hermana tienen una tienda de abarrotes en la casa de sus padres, donde vende frutas, verduras, carnes.
Angélica necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azucar.
Los sueños de Angélica son comprar una casa, ampliar su negocio y vender ropa por mayor.

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, azucar.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
La socia María, pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKAY HUAYNA”; ubicado en el valle sagrado de los Inkas, exactamente en la provincia de Urubamba.

Nuestra socia tiene  32 años de edad, es natural de Lares, nuestra socia es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia tiene un restaurante al cual se dedica el día entero, la socia solicita el préstamo para poder reinvertir en su restaurante e implementarlo.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member María, belongs to the communal bank “LLANKAY HUAYNA,” located in the sacred valley of the Incas in the Urubamba province.

Our member is 32 years old, native of Lares, a partner and has 5 children. María alternates from household work and retail commerce. María has a restaurant where she works all day and requests the loan to reinvest in and make use of her restaurant.

This member values and is thankful for the loan awarded by this resource and likewise will undertake to carry out with the payment of her dues in the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to reinvest in and manage her restaurant

loans.name: Dania

texts.es:
Dania es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta.
Dania es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Dania tiene un kiosco dentro de la ciudad universitaria en donde brinda servicio de fotocopiado, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo, además vende golosinas.
Dania necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas y papel.
Los sueños de Dania son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Para la compra de golosinas y papel.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta.
Marina es casada, tiene 42 años y 6 hijos, Marina tiene dos puestos en el mercado F. Vivanco en donD. venD. verduras y frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. sus hijos.
Marina necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. manzana, pera, verduras.
Los sueños D. Marina son aumentar su mercadería y brindar una buena educación  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marina is a member of the Maria Antonieta Communal Bank. Marina is 42, married, and has six children. Marina has two stalls in the F. Vivanco market. She sells fruit and vegetables everyday with her children’s help. Marina needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy apples, pears, and vegetables. Marina’s dreams are to increase her merchandise and to give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy apples, pears, and vegetables

loans.name: Josue

texts.es:
Josué es socio del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta.
Josué es viudo, tiene 46 años y 5 hijos, Josué tiene un carro con el cual realiza taxi en la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Josué necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de neumáticos y el mantenimiento de su carro.
Los sueños de Josué son comprar otro carro mas moderno.

loans.use: Para la compra de neumáticos y el mantenimiento de su carro.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta.
Marlene es soltera, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Marlene viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende quesos y cereales que adquiere en los diferentes pueblos de la región de Ayacucho.
Marlene necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales y quesos.
Marlene sueña con brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Marlene is a member of the Maria Antonieta Communal Bank. Marlene is 28, single, and has two children. Marlene travels to the Ayacuchana jungle where she sells cheese and basic grains, which she gets from different towns in the Ayacucho area. Marlene needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy basic grains and cheese. Marlene’s dreams are to give her children a good education and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains and cheese

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada.
Teodosia es casada, tiene 49 años y 3 hijos, Teodosia tiene un puesto propio en el mercado 12 D. abril en donD. venD. ropa D. niños, además los días domingos venD. en las ferias D. la región.
Teodosia necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. polos y conjuntos.
Los sueños D. Teodosia son que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Para la compra de polos y conjuntos.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada.
Julia es casada, tiene 49 años y 1 hijo, Julia tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende diferentes productos como artículos de escritorio, libros, artículos de mercería, juguetes, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su esposo. Además Julia los días domingos vende ropa en las ferias.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de juguetes.
Los sueños de Julia son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar su negocio y tener un local propio.

loans.use: Para la compra de juguetes.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada.
Marisol es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 2 hijos, Marisol tiene un taller de confección de prendas de vestir a pedido, en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de personal, además sus prendas los vende en las ferias.
Marisol necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas.
Los sueños de Marisol son construir su casa y tener un taller mas grande.

loans.use: Para la compra de telas.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada.
Rosa es soltera, tiene 50 años y 2 hijos, Rosa tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende ropa juvenil, además en campaña escolar vende útiles escolares.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones y casacas.
Los sueños de Rosa son comprar un mototaxi y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Alborada Communal Bank. Rosa is 50, single, and has two children. Rosa has a stall in the 12 de Abril Market where she sells children’s clothing. Also, she sells school supplies during the school year. Rosa needs a loan for 2,400 PEN to buy pants and jackets. Rosa’s dream is to buy a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pants and jackets

loans.name: Señor De La Picota Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Señor de la Picota inicia su  tercer ciclo con 16 socias.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de leña, comidas, abarrotes en general, quesos, artesanías, cereales, ropa y tejido de chompas.
Como es el caso de Lucy que es soltera, tiene 53 años y 6 hijos, Lucy realiza servicios de preparación de comida para diferentes eventos, además teje chompas a mano, de acuerdo a los pedidos.
Mientras que Candelaria es viuda, tiene 70 años y 7 hijos, Candelaria vende quesos y chicharrón que compra en las ferias y lo en la ciudad de Lima de casa en casa, además teje chompas a pedido.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 600 soles, 750 soles, 900 soles haciendo un total de 12000 soles en prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra de lana, quesos, arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, carne, leña y artesanías.
Los sueños de las socias son ser empresarias, tener casa propia, mejorar sus negocios, tener una asociación de tejedoras y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Para la compra de lana, quesos, arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, carne, leña y artesanías.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita is 46 years old and she is married to Macario. The couple are thankful because they have been gifted with four children, two of them are already married and the other two are: Maricel-20 years old, college graduate and Marco-16 years old, 4th year high school. Estrelita would like to improve their way of living through the business she manage. 

Estrelita is managing a sari-sari store in the village. She is working hard to make her business improve while her husband is busy cultivating their rice fields. Estrelita would like to expand her store but her capital is not enough that is why she would like to ask for additional capital to the KIVA lenders.  She is requesting a loan amounting PHP5,000 that will serve as additional capital for the maintenance of her store for the benefit of their family.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en:
Chuon D., 28, is a low-income person living in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Here she has her own small business: she sells sugarcane juice to students at the local public high school.

Chuon D. was married years go and has two school-aged children, while her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver.

Chuon D. would like to operate her business at the school but she is required to pay the cost of renting her place. Therefore she would like a loan to help pay those fees so she can continue operating her business there which is an attractive place for generating extra income. She proposes to use the rest of the loan to buy a machine for taping sugar cane.

loans.use: To pay the cost of renting her place and to buy a machine

loans.name: Magie

texts.en:
Magie is 30 years old. She is married to Baltazar Sr., a farmer, and they have two children: Ejay - 4 years old, a preschool student and Baltazar Jr. - 5 months old. They live in Barangay Salay, Angadanan, Isabela, a peaceful and environmentally friendly area.

Magie has managed a typical retail store for almost five years and her weekly income is PHP 500. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders to use as additional capital.

When she has enough income, Magie plans to have a livestock business next month. She said: "We should learn how to value money, especially when you have a lot of obligations."

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
C. is a 29 year old married woman. Since 2000, C. has owned a small shop out of her home where she sells Chinese noodle to her villagers or someone who crosses the street. She is typically earning around ten dollars per day.

She is married to Mr. Channy, 43, a military policeman. This couple has no children and they plan to have a child next year.

C. would like to pursue a loan of US$500 to be used to decorate her existing shop in order to attract more customers and profits.

loans.use: To decorate her existing shop in order to attract more customers and profits

loans.name: Chansokha Sam’S Group

texts.en:
Mr. Chansokha S. (shown in the picture his group member) was selected to be a group leader for a loan from Maxima. In the group are two families including him. All the group's members live on an island in MeK. River approximately 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

1-Mr. Chansokha S., 29, and his wife, Mrs. Sreylot K., 28, were married in 2003 and just a 2 year-old son. He has been a silk weaver for over 10 years, a skill he learned from his aunt, while his wife is a garment factory worker. In the past, she used to be a silk weaver as well. 

By the way, the house where he lives breaks down in some parts he wants to repair it, but he doesn’t have money. So, he is requesting a loan of $250 to make the repairs.

2-Mrs. Sokhen K., 30, and her husband, Mr. Thol Pho, 33, were married in 2001 and just a young daughter-who attends school. Sokhen has been a silk weaver since she was 15 years old and taught her husband to become a silk weaver as well. 

She is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.use: To repair a house where he lives.

loans.name: Man

texts.en: Man R. is an older woman, 61 years old, and is the mother blessed with a daughter and a son. Two of her children are employed: her son sells baggage in the market and her daughter is a staff for an entertainment center. They also provide their income to contribute their family’s living expenses. Man R. was married, but her husband died of senility years ago. To earn a living, Man R. sells Khmer noodle to her nearby neighbors who live in the village. Man R. will be using her first loan to help increase her son business capital. Note: Man R. was not available for photographing, so her son is shown instead.

loans.use: To help increase her son business capital

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga C. and her husband, Mr. Ang Chea, have been married since 1986 and have three children: one daughter, who sells vegetables, and two sons. One of them is in university. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 
 
Nga and her husband are farmers. They grow many types of vegetables, such as tomatoes, papayas, and spinach, on their own farmland. They sell their products to middlemen in the village who then sell the products in Phnom Penh. 

One of Nga’s sons is attending university and she hopes to support her son's further education so he has a good job when he is finished with his studying. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $500 to pay school fees for her son. She will use part of her loan for farming as well.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son who attends university

loans.name: Vineth

texts.en:
Vineth D. P. is a 32-year-old woman who has just started her own family. She is married to a 27-year-old tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) driver and has given birth to a baby girl named Anthea four months ago. Vineth loves her baby so much that she dreams of nothing in life but the best she can offer. For her, the best time to prepare for her daughter’s future is now.

Vineth joined ASHI a month ago to be able to have an opportunity to get a loan to start up a business which will be her source of income. After she was recognized, she applied for a loan amounting to Php5,000. This will be used for her dress, curtain and bedding manufacturing business. Her profits will augment her husband’s income and will be saved for the needs of her child. Through ASHI and the loans she can request in the future, Vineth hopes that her business will grow and that she will be able to employ a sewer to increase the volume of her products.

loans.use: Will be used to purchase materials for a dress making business.

loans.name: Morm

texts.en: Mrs. Morm P., 56, is married to Som Rith, 62 years old, and they were given birth to eight children. Four of them are single and other four are married and have already started new homes. Morm P. has built a few rooms which she rents them out to garment workers for fee. In addition, she sells a little snack food in front of her home for her villagers, while her husband is a civil seven officer who has been retired for years. Morm P. is applying for a loan in order to build more rooms for renting.

loans.use: To build more rooms for renting

loans.name: Fritzel

texts.en: 31-year-old Fritzel J. is requesting a loan amounting to Php5,000 after she was recognized as an official member of ASHI last month in September. The loan she is requesting will be a great opportunity for her to start up her envisioned variety store business. Through having the said business, Fritzel is expecting she will take a part in the family's finances. She can augment her husband’s sporadic income from being a farm laborer, and therefore they can provide the basic and necessary things her four children (whose age range is from three to ten years old) need daily. When the time comes that her business has grown through loans she had received from ASHI, her profits will be her means to support the financial needs of her children in school.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for a variety store which she will be starting up.

loans.name: Echeverie

texts.en:
Echeverie S. is a 35-year-old wife of a fisherman. She wanted to augment her husband’s income to be able to sustain the needs of their five children, whose age range is from six months to 17 years old. Last month (September), Echeverie joined ASHI to be able to have an opportunity to request a loan, which she will use for supporting her husband’s fishing business. Through her requested loan, she hopes to buy a boat of their own to be managed by her husband, and to buy another bigger one with her next loans to increase the volume of fish she can sell.

Through the loans she requests through ASHI, Echeverie believes that together with her husband, she will be able to rise above poverty.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat and necessary materials needed for fishing

loans.name: Juvean

texts.en:
Juvean Q.’s source of income for the family is their tricycle (motorcycle with a sidecar), managed by her husband. The said tricycle was already old and used before it was given to her as her inheritance. Nevertheless, this has provided well in her life, especially for Juvean’s four children whose age range is from seven to 13 years old. Since this is the main means of transportation of people in their municipality and within their village, the income it generates can at least provide them with food for the day.

Juvean joined ASHI last month in September because she wanted to sustain their tricycle. She is requesting a loan through ASHI which will be used to renew their tricycle license and to continue its operation. Someday, she hopes that she will be able to request a much bigger loan amount which will enable her to buy a new tricycle for better presentation, which will attract passengers’ interest. The profits she will be making in this business will be the means for her to be able to send all of her children to school until graduation in college. By then, their standard of living will have changed.

loans.use: To pay for the renewal of the tricycle's license.

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Mrs. Navy S., 44, and her husband, Mr. Pho Pheng, 47, have been married since 1988 and have four children: three daughters and one son. One of their children has full-time employment, two are in school and the other one stays at home. They are living on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Navy has been a silk weaver for 23 years, while her husband has been a construction worker for 22 years. He works in his village. Because silk weaving is the main business for supporting Navy’s family, as well as for other people who live in the same area, Navy is requesting a loan of $150 to purchase silk materials for continuing her business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria O. is a 37-year-old woman whose dream is to build a house of her own which is strong enough to shelter her six children from any form of harm. Together with her laborer husband, Gloria has not stopped dreaming of a better life for their children. She joined ASHI for the opportunity to ask for financial assistance, which she will use for their fishing and chainsaw rental business, which is managed by her husband. By strengthening their source of income through loans, Gloria will have her own business to manage too. She will sell the fish that her husband will catch, and their income will be much greater so that she save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: To repair and maintain a fishing boat and a chainsaw.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie M. is from the village of Mohon. She is 40 years old. Elvie is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Elvie owns & operates a "sari-sari" store business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Elvie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elvie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvie has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elvie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Rang

texts.en: An small-sized wooden house in Siem Reap is the location of Mrs. K.'s home and grocery store. She usually buys produce in bulk from a marker supplier and sells it from her house. Normally, she can make average income of $3.00 per day. She has been running her business since early 2007. Her husband, Chomreun, age 23, helps her with the business, and who appears in the picture. This youngest couple is newly married with no child. K.'s investment is main source of income for the family and she recently sold all of the produce in her store. Therefore, she would like to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: 31-year-old Jean F. is a member of KIVA field partner in the Philippines which is ASHI for five years. Along with her children who range in age from nine to 11 and husband who is a farm laborer, she resides in a nature rich municipality of Sebaste in Antique province. There she practiced her reproductive and productive role being a woman. Her loan in ASHI was used to start up a business she can manage herself to be able to have her own income to support her family needs especially that of her children.  Presently, Jean’s income through her small business is not yet enough to support her dream of giving her children best things in life. Her husband’s income is sporadic and insufficient for a support. Therefore, she wanted to request a much larger amount of loan from ASHI to grow her business.  With ASI and KIVA Jean believes that she has a lot of things to do in life for her family through her business.

loans.use: Will be used for a wholesale buying and selling of rice and for an additional capital in growing a variety store.

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en:
S. is 29 years old and a resident of the Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She makes a living raising pigs, which she sells for slaughter in four months time after raising them. She has been raising pigs for about four years.

S. is married with three children, all three of whom are attending school. She is married to Thear who is 30 years old and a construction worker. S. is applying for a loan as capital to purchase a piglet to raise in a new stall that she built.

loans.use: To purchase a piglet to raise in a stall that she has built

loans.name: Savat

texts.en:
Mr. Savat E., 30, and his wife, Mrs. Sophea Soy, 28, have been married for ten years and live about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have three sons, one of which attends school; the other two are still quite young.

Since 1999, Savat has been growing rice. In addition to the farming, he drives a motor taxi. His wife has been working in a factory for ten years. Savat doesn’t have enough capital to maintain his farm, so he is applying for his first loan in the amount of $500 to pay the salary for hired help and to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: To pay the salary for hired help and to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea R. is 27 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. She earns a living by raising a few pigs in a stall next to her house. She will raise two lots of pigs per year and sells them to the slaughterer every six months. She is married with two kids who are sill young and under her care. Her husband is a local fisherman and also Tuk Tuk driver. Chea R. requested a loan of US$700 to be used to purchase a pumping machine for irrigating to clean her pigpen. With the remainder of the loan she will buy more piglets to breed.

loans.use: To purchase a pumping machine for irrigating to clean her pigpen

loans.name: Lal Agha

texts.en: Lal Agha son of A. is single and he lives with his own family. He is a very honest, hard working and talented man. He works in Jalalabad city and has been working in the same area for more than 9 years. During this time, he has not been able to increase his business of potatoes, onions and fresh vegetable business. He trying money time but he couldn’t when he found the AFS (Ariana Financial Services and Joint Stock Company) he applied for an individual loan to buying more vegetables for his shop. He is happy with this loan process in Jalalabad Afghanistan and hopes that this can be a successful process in his country in the future.

loans.use: He want to completed his stocks

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sin S. is a young married woman who is 23 years old. She is currently a good mother caring for one lovely young child. To earn a living, she works sewing clothes for a garment industry at Phnom Penh and is getting a salary of $120 a month, while her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver.

Sin S.’s husband has been using his motor for his service for years, so his motor is now too old and not attractive to customers. Therefore, Sin S. would like to seek a loan of US $500 which will allow her husband to renovate his old motor. (Mrs. Sin S.'s husband appears in the picture).

loans.use: To renovate an old motorbike

loans.name: Abdull Wahid Group

texts.en: A. Wahid is the group leader of the A. Wahid group. There are three members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan to grow their businesses. They are requesting a group of loan 20,000 Afghani.Shafeqa wants to take out a loan for her business of quilt.Najellah wants to take out a loan for the business of tailoring. And A. Wahid wants to take a loan for his business of taxi driver. They thank Kiva lenders that can support poor people.

loans.use: they make larger their business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more vegetables

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Hog raising is the main source of income for Rosita A., a 53 year-old woman from the Philippines. Rosita is very diligent in her business, and she is thankful that her family is in good condition, through the guidance of our Lord Almighty. Her husband Amado is in the farming business, and they are blessed with three children who have all been married.

Rosita wants to continue her hog raising business, and she would like a loan of 5,000 PHP from KIVA lenders. She plans to use the loan to purchase feed, which will support the growth of her hogs. As a result, she can minimize her expenses in going to the market. She would be grateful if her loan request is granted.

Rosita and her husband are striving hard to earn more profits so they can save money for their future, and improve their way of living.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo is 36 years old and is from the village of Calamagui, San Pablo, Isabela.
