He is married to Judith and they are blessed with six children: Angelou, 13 years old, a high school freshman; Avelyn, 11 years old, a grade school student; the twins, Roderick and Rodrigo, who are now 9 years old and are also in grade school; Radolfo, 2 years old; and the youngest is Rodolfo Jr., 1 year old.

Rodolfo helps his wife in her vending business, especially when he is not busy tilling their farm. His wife sells different vegetables and processed food like longganiza (sausages flavoured with indigenous spices) in the village. Rodolfo is also the one who plants vegetables in their farm which they also sell after harvesting.

However, lack of capital hinders them from improving their business. With this in mind, Rodolfo volunteered to assist his wife in looking for financial support from Kiva lenders. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 that will be used to purchase more processed foods and additional vegetables that they believe will result in increased income.

loans.use: To purchase more processed foods and additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Wahedullah

texts.en:
Wahedullah, son of Sayeed N. lives, in Nangarhar, Jalalabad. He is married and he has a spare parts shop. When he started this business for the first time, he had a small business and he was very weak, but when he got an individual loan he really improved a lot in his business and is furthering his business, attracting some good number of customers, making a good income for his family, and repaying the loan without any difficulty and on time. 
Therefore, he has requested his second-cycle loan to enlarge his shop and continue his business with even more success. He is sure that he can be a good business dealer in the future. 
He is happy with this loan of 50000(AF). He would like to thank both Kiva and AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company) and all lenders around the world who help workers and people who would like to be strong in their businesses. Finally, he wants to say that this process is a successful one in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To enlarge his shop

loans.name: Wally Baba Group

texts.en: Wally Baba is the group leader of Wally Baba group. There are four members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan for progressing the business and making it larger. So they are requesting a group loan of 56000 Afghani. Farei wants to take loan for the business of embroidery. A. Zai wants to take a loan for a general store. Uasamen wants to take a loan for the business of bead working. Sabera wants to take a loan for her husband who sells fruit. They are very happy from this process of loan.

loans.use: For expanding business

loans.name: Amena Group

texts.en: Amena is the group leader of Amena group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their business. There requested a loan of 25,000 Afghani.Amena and Nawid want to take a loan for there business of tailoring. And Garan Aqa wants to take a loan for his business of taxi driver. There expand and progress for their business. Also Fahem Ahmad wants to take a loan for his business of color selling. He wants to make larger his business. With this loan they can make larger their business and support their families and make better future for their families they are really happy with this process in this poor country.

loans.use: they make larger their businee

loans.name: Donata

texts.en:
Donata is 34 years old. She is from the village of Calamagui, San Pablo, Isabela where farming is the  major source of income of the residents. The couple were blessed with three childre and all of them are studying.  Her husband Ronald is 39 years old and is working as a security guard.

Donata is raising pigs for eight years. She engaged in this business with her desire to assist her husband in providing the daily needs of their family and also to send their children to school and hoping that they may finish their college education.  For this reason, Donata and husband are working hard for their future. Sometimes, her children are also helping her in the maintenance of her hogs especially during weekends. 

She believes that with their cooperation and patience, a lot of improvement will happen to their business.  In this regard, Donata wanted to asks for additional business capital from the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5, 000.  She intends to use the loan to buy sufficient supply of feeds for her hogs to grow healthy and free from sickness.

loans.use: To purchase sufficient supply of feeds

loans.name: Ameenullah

texts.en: Ameenullah son of Shir Mohammad he is marred and has a video CD Shop in Jalalabad city and he have good experience in his business. He has already successfully completed his first cycle loan and expanded his stock. Still, he wants to further expand his business with full success, so now he has requested his second cycle loan to enlarge his shop so as to attract more customers and make good income to help his family. He is happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: Buying necessary things for his shop

loans.name: Masoda Group

texts.en:
Masoda is the group leader of the Masoda group, which has four members.  All of them want to receive money for their business.
Naw Gull and Norya want a loan for their business of tailoring. They want to buy a new machine for their business. Masoda wants a loan for her business of leather sewing. She wants to buy necessary materials for her business. Gullahlay wants a loan for her husband’s general store. He wants to complete his stock. They are requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000 Afghani.
With this loan they can make their businesses larger and support their families and make a better future for themselves and their families in the future.

loans.use: They want to increase their businesses and make a better future

loans.name: Muhlali Hamad Group

texts.en: Muhlali Hamad is the group leader of Muhlali Hamad group. There are two members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan for progress her/his business. Muhlali wants to take a loan for the business of embroidery. Hamad wants to take a loan for the business of vegetables selling shop. And they are requested a group of loan 28000 Afghani. And they thank AFS and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For progress business

loans.name: Gheta Group

texts.en:
Gheta is the group leader of Gheta group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive a loan for his/her own business. Their requested a group loan of 40000 Afghani.
Raqya and Zakera want to take a loan for her business of beading and Gheta wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of general store.Gullaly wants to take a loan for her business of husband’s. The all wants to buy necessary materials for their businesses. 
They want to say this loan is very use full because this loan can provide a good chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their business and become stronger in there business and life this group wants to thank this process of loan in Afghanistan

loans.use: they are expand and progress for their business

loans.name: Sorm

texts.en:
C., 52, is a low-income person living in Banteay Meanchey province. She is married to Sameoun, 62, who appears in the picture above, and who owns a motor which he uses for a taxi service. They have four children: One is married and lives separately, two work as motor-taxi drivers, and another one is attending school.

C. is currently a domestic tailor who sews her nearby neighbors’ clothes. Also, she owns a few rooms which she rents out to people for a fee. To better satisfy her customer's requirements, she is looking for capital in order to build more rental rooms.

loans.use: To build more rental rooms

loans.name: Cherisa

texts.en:
Cherisa is a vegetable vendor from the village of Calamagui, San Pablo, Isabela. She usually roams around her village driving her pedicab (a bicycle with a sidecar and three wheels) to sell various vegetables. Most of the time she can earn a weekly income of PHP 750. She is thankful that, with her business, she is able to help her husband in supporting their financial and basic needs. She hopes to develop her vending business into a more organized and stable source of income.

Due to lack of financial capital, Cherisa is encouraged to borrow additional capital of PHP 7,000 from Kiva lenders. She will use the loan as rolling capital and to purchase more vegetables to sell. Cherisa is doing her best to be able to assist her husband in sending their children to school and to provide the daily needs of her family.

Cherisa is 54 years old and married to Joey, a carpenter. They are blessed with four children: Joven - 17 years old, a first year college student; second is Jonald - 15 years old, a high school student; third is Joy - 13 years old, a freshman high school student; and Joshelle – 6 year old, in grade one. Cherisa hopes that her children will all finish their studies in order for them to have a bright future.

loans.use: To buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy has owned and managed a general store business in her village for twenty-eight years. Her business has been her partner in providing for the educational needs of her five children. She is 44 years old and still very active in making her business a success. Her two children are still studying and are already in the college level.

With her desire to send her children to college and finish their studies, she is doing her best to send them to school. She wants to borrow PHP 22,000 that will serve as additional business capital for her store. Some of the things that she will purchase are canned goods and other basic commodities needed at home. She believes that, with the support of Kiva lenders, nothing is impossible.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Fazella Group

texts.en: Fazella the group leader of Fazella group. They live in district 4th Kabul Afghanistan and there are four members in this group. The total requested amount is 56000 Afghani. And each of them would like to receive the loan for her own business. Fazella and Shayma want to receive a loan for their tailoring business.Sanam wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of general store. And Fowzeya wants to take a loan for her business of fresh fruit. They would like to admire this process and want to thank form Kiva too.

loans.use: They want to improve in there businesses to help there family butter

loans.name: Pashton Group

texts.en:
Pashton is the group leader of the Pashton group, which has three members. All of them would like to receive money for his/her business.
Pashton and Fawzeya want a loan for the business and Roshan would like a loan for her general store. They all want to see progress in their business and earn more money to better support their families. 
They say that these loans can be very useful because they provide a chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their business.

loans.use: expand their business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: For progress business

loans.name: Jojie

texts.en:
"Perseverance and creativity is needed in managing a small business," said Jojie. She is 26 years old and still single. She has a strong determination to succeed in life and is doing her best to achieve her dreams.

Jojie is weaving and selling hammocks as her source of income. She would like to buy additional materials needed in weaving hammocks but her capital is insufficient. For this reason, she is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders. She will use the loan to purchase the necessary weaving materials to improve her business. She prays and hope that her loan will be granted by the lenders for the development of her small business.

loans.use: To buy the necessary weaving materials for making hammocks

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
“Patience is the key to success” said Carol. She is patiently maintaining a food vending business in their village and sometimes also offers catering service for additional source of income.  For her to expand her business, she is now requesting to avail a loan amount of PHP7,000 from the KIVA lenders. This amount will be of great help in assisting her to purchase more commodities she needed in cooking foods. 

Carol is 38 years old, married to Armando who is sacrificing to work in another country to provide a better life for his family.  Their two children are: Jhun Karl - 6 years old and Edrick James - 4 years old. Their children are about to study next school year.

loans.use: Additionla capital for her food vending business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites C. is engaged in mushroom production. She also sells her own produced goods in her village and sometimes in their public market. Her husband assists her in developing their mushroom business, in order to generate bigger harvests to meet their family's needs. She and her family are living in Villa Magat, San Mateo, Isabela. 

She wanted to buy more seedlings and other needed farm supplies for the productivity of their mushroom business. She hopes that, through their farming activity, they can overcome the hardships of life. In this regard, Marites is hoping to avail of a loan from Kiva lenders, in the amount of 5,000 PHP, to pursue her business plans. 

Marites is married to Efren, who is engaged in farming and fishing and also assists her in her mushroom production. They are blessed with an 18-year-old son named Jeffrey, who is presently taking his criminology course in college. The couple is hoping that they can sustain all the needs of their only son through their hard work in the business.

loans.use: Additional capital for her mushroom production business

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is already 28 years old and still single. She is a responsible daughter and helps her parents in supporting their daily needs through her direct selling business of AVON products.  She is persevering to succeed in the business to give her family a progressive living someday. Her family is residing in the agricultural based community of Barangay Villa Magat San Mateo, Isabela. Framing is their family main source of income. 

Christina wanted to request for an additional loan from the KIVA lenders lenders amounting to PHP5, 000. She will use the amount in purchasing more AVON cosmetics, apparels and other products that she can offer to her customers.  She believes that the more capital she will roll in her direct selling, the higher the income she could get.

loans.use: Additional capital for her personal product sales

loans.name: Avaz

texts.en: Avaz was born in 1955. He lives in the Fuzuli region. He is married and has 6 children. Ten years ago he started a cattle breeding business. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 Azarbaijani manat to buy 3 calves for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy 3 calves

loans.name: Remelyn

texts.en: Remelyn D. is vendor of cradle in their village. She is married to John, a construction worker and blessed with two children: Jonalyn-2 years old and Jomell-10 months old. Remelyn would like to buy additional materials like threads she needed in making a cradle.  This is the reason why she is asking for a loan capital from the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5,000.00.  This will serves a big help in their family most especially in sustaining financial needs of her children.

loans.use: Additional capital for business development

loans.name: Mohammad Yasof Group

texts.en:
M. Yasof is the group leader of M. Yasof group. There are four members in this group. All of them want to receive a loan for their business.

M. Yasof and Samea allah want to take a loan for the business of selling mobile. They want to make larger their business. Farhad wants to take a loan for his business of fresh fruit selling. They want to buy necessary materials for his shop. He completes his stock. And they thank they loan of 42000 Afghani. 

They want to say this loan is very useful. Because this loan can provide a good chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their business

loans.use: they make larger their business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma V. is happily married to Rodolfo V.. She is 54 years old and resides in the village of Angoluan, Echague, Isabela. Her husband is responsible for cultivating their rice field while she makes and sells cradles in their village. They have three children and all of them are already married.

Norma is aiming for the success of her business. She is striving hard to make her dreams come true. Lack of funds motivated her to seek financial assistance. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva lenders that she can use to purchase the materials for making cradles. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted by the lenders.

loans.use: Materials for making cradles

loans.name: Galib

texts.en:
This young man is single and lives in Fuzuli region. He is enjoying with his cattle breeding business. He has been in cattle breeding business for 4 years. 
Galib was born in 1989. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 4 calves for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy 4 calves

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
“Achieving success in life is not that easy,” says Carmen C. of Barangay Villa Magat San Mateo, Isabela. Carmen is 41 years old, she is a single parent to her two children who are Rheden - 18 years old, and King Klay - four years old. Her eldest is a graduate of two year course in college while her youngest is in kindergarten.

Carmen manages a general store. Her daily income from the business is used to support the studies of her children to give them a bright future. She wants to improve her business and be able to increase her income. However, she does not have enough capital to use, thus she wants to ask for a loan from Kiva lenders of 5,000 Philippine pesos. This amount will be of great help in maintaining her business and increasing her store's inventory. Some of the things that she will buy are canned goods, basic commodities and toiletries. She is doing everything to develop her business and to sustain her family needs.

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena S. is a 45 year-old mother of seven children whose age range is from one to 16 years old.  Her dream of giving her children better future and life outside the umbrella of poverty are her strength and motivation to join and get a loan from ASHI and to take risk in running a business. Depending on her husband’s small income for their daily finances, her children could not have gone to school and have not been able to have their meals in regular basis. When Magdalena joined ASHI in 2005, she has put up a duck raising business which she and her husband could manage in addition to their rice farming business. However, profits they had with their businesses are not enough to sustain the needs, and education of their children as well as in growing the business. Especially, rice farming is seasonal. Loans she gets through ASHI is a great opportunity she had to sustain her business while maximizing there daily income for a necessary expenses of the family.  

Loan Magdalena is now requesting will be intended for the expenses required by the rice farming preparation and maintenance until harvest season.

loans.use: Will be used to pay for the purchases needed as farm inputs for the rice production (rice farming) business.

loans.name: Filipinas

texts.en:
“Do not do unto others what you don’t want others to do unto you”, this is the guiding principle in life of Filipinas T..  She is 37 years old, married and blessed with one child.

Filipinas is engaged in the sari-sari store (community based store) business for almost eight months.  She wanted her business to grow and with this she is borrowing a loan of PHP5,000 from the KIVA lenders.  She plans to purchase different commodities like canned goods, coffee, candies and other basic commodities that are in demand in their village. She hopes that through the loan, her business will continue to improve.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Chhauy

texts.en: Actually, fish is the main source of food for everybody in Cambodia, and almost all of the Cambodian people depend on catching fish to earn a living. One of these people is Mr. S., who is 40 years old. He wakes up when the sky is still dark in order to prepare his equipment to fish in and around the creek in his community. After he has finished fishing, he provides the fish for his wife to sell at the local fish market. S. is taking out his loan to buy more essential fishing tools in order to accumulate a greater quantity of fish. Note: Mr. S.'s wife is shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more essential fishing tools in order to accumulate a quantity of fish

loans.name: Palwasha Group

texts.en: This is the Palwasha group. There are three members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their businesses. Palwasha and M. Alam want to take a loan for their carpet weaving business to expand and progress for their businesses. And Shayma wants to take a loan for her quilte business to open a shop in future. And also they want to complete their necessary materials for their businesses. They want to say that these loans to help businesses progress and make businesses larger are very useful. They all want to thank Kiva for making possible the process in Afghanistan to support poor people.

loans.use: they buy necessary materials for their business

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely B. is 44 year old member of ASHI who requests for a loan that would assist her in growing her hog fattening (pig raising) business and tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) for hire business which she plan to start up with. These businesses are her main source of income spent for the needs of her three children who are in high school and for their other family daily expenses. Once her business have grown through the loans she requested, she would set aside some of her profit in preparation for the expenses of her children in going to college. 

Pio,  Fely’s husband will be the one to manage their tricycle for he had been a driver of other people in most of his life. With the businesses Fely is working hard on, she hoped to change her children’s standard living while they are still young and that all of them will be able to graduate from college to be able to get good and well compensated employment someday.

loans.use: Will be used to purchase additional piglets for a hog fattening business and a sidecar for a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) for hire business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 54 years old and married to Mario.  They are happily living in the village of Sta. Rosa, Santiago City, Isabela. They are gifted with seven children, four of them are married.  

Rosita is engaged in the buy and sell business of recycled materials in their village such as empty bottles,cans and other plastic materials. She would like to seek for financial assistance of KIVA lenders to lend her a loan of PHP5,000.  She will wisely use the loan to buy more recyclable materials that she can sell in the junk shops and generate bigger income.  

Most of her income are being budget to support the needs of their family especially for the education of their youngest daughter. Her children who are still living with them are: Michael-24 years old, elementary graduate; Mary Rose-23 years old, who is a graduate of Hotel and restaurant management and the youngest is Abegail-12 years old, 1st year high school student.

loans.use: To buy more recycled materials

loans.name: Mrs. Boeb Nget Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan which consists of nine people is located in Sla village in Takeo province and they all will use the loan in different purposes. Mrs. Boeb N. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members and she is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for living.  In this farming, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive and she will use the rest of the loan to buy pesticides to kill all kinds of insects. She is 38 years old and the widow with three children who are all attending the local school. 

Five members in this village loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: V. is a newly married man age 31, and he and his wife have one lovely young child. V. currently uses his own motorcycle to run a taxi service, picking up passer-by who need to go to anywhere in Phnom Penh town. He usually generates an income of $4 each day to contribute his family's financial crisis. At the same time, he also goes to buy vegetable in bulk for his wife to sell at the market for additional profits. V.'s income is decreasing frequently due to his motor is not attractive to the customer. Because of this, he would like a loan of $700 to replace his old one. V. was not available for photographing, so his wife is shown instead.

loans.use: To replace his old motorbike

loans.name: Rutchel

texts.en: 53-year-old Rutchel M. is requesting for a loan which will enrich her dried fish and “bagoong” (fish sauce) selling business through her membership in ASHI. Through her loan, she can increase the inventory of vegetables, fruits,dried fish and fish sauce she sells in her store in the market. Together with her 53 year-old husband, this business is managed and enhanced to generate bigger profit. Profits and income of this business is maximized for Rutchel’s family daily expenses and for her only child’s financial need in college taking up Bachelor of Science in Education. As her child’s graduation approaches, expenses it requires continuously increases thus, Ruthchel’s business has to grow and profit more.  Someday, when her child graduates, she will be saving her profit to be able to buy a land of their own where she can build a strong house for her family and her child’s family in the future.

loans.use: Will be used to pay for the inventory of vegetables, fruits, dried fish and bagoong (fish sauce) for selling business.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Mrs. S., age 55, and is a resident at the fringe of Phnom Penh Capital, where she has owned a plot of farmland since 1979. She grows a variety of crop, which she plants twice a year. She is a good widowed mother of five children; three of whom are students and are assisting her on the farm, while the other two are garment workers. S. said that she is lacking some money to greatly grow her crop; thus, she would like to request a loan from Kiva's partner HKL. She will be used her loan to purchase fertilizer, seed, and other essential farm supply for planting.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seed, and other essential farm supply for planting

loans.name: Kiet

texts.en: Kiet D., 32, lives in Phnom Penh. To earn a living, Kiet D. sells various types of meatballs that she buys in bulk on credit from her regular supplier. She typically makes around of $5 USD income a day to help support her family's living expenses. In addition, her husband plants a few crops and is a fisherman.  Kiet D. has five single children, three of whom are working in different occupations. Kiet D. currently needs to pay a lot of money to the owner of the market kiosk which sells her product. To eliminate this fee, Kiet D. would like a loan of $1000 USD to buy her own kiosk in the market.

loans.use: To buy her own kiosk in the market

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe is a balut vendor in his village. Balut is a fertilized duck or chicken egg with a nearly-developed embryo inside that is boiled and eaten in the shell. It is commonly sold as street food in the Philippines.  He usually roams around their village at night to sell his balut eggs.  In addition to this business, he also assists his wife in managing her general store.  To further improve their small businesses, he is asking for a loan amount of 12,000 PHP.  He plans to use the loan to purchase more stock for her store and also to buy more balut to sell.

The couple is hoping to provide for the educational needs of their children through the income from their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his wife's store and improve his egg vending business

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion C. is 68-year-old owner of a store that sells ready to wear goods such as T-shirts, pants, shorts, and other related items. This business was started through a loan she got through her membership in ASHI nine years ago. Asuncion has been through a lot of tribulations in sustaining her business and supporting her family needs. Loans she has availed through ASHI then until now became her means to overcome diversities in life including those of her business. Giving up was not the option she had in her mind instead she continuously requests for a much bigger amount of loan to be able to sustain the growth of her business. Presently she requests of a loan which she will going to use to pay for the inventory of good she will purchase for her business. 

Considering her age and her husband’s age that is 70, Asuncion hoped that as soon as her business is well established and sustainable, she will employ people to work with them so that she will have time for herself and her husband.

loans.use: Will be used to pay for the goods she will going to sell.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza manages a general store in the village of Baculud, Amulung, Cagayan. She helps her husband earn a living through her store.  She is married to Feliciano, who is presently working as a soldier and they were gifted with a daughter. 

Annaliza sells different merchandise.  But aside from this, she also sells vegetables that she displays in front of her store.  Her income in just enough to maintain her business.  With her desire to further develop her store into progress, she is now asking to avail a loan of PHP10,000 from the KIVA lenders. The amount will serve as additional capital for her to purchase more stocks for her store.  According to Annaliza, all their sacrifices in improving their livelihood are for the future of their family for she believes that “success begins from humble beginnings”.

loans.use: Additional capital for her general store business

loans.name: Mrs. Samphors Maen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank which located in Bang Bat village in Takeo province is made up by nineteen people and they will use the loan in different purposes. Mrs. Samphors M. owns a small grocery store to sell in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for loan to buy more grocery goods for selling. Her husband, Mr. Tuy Chamnan, is a construction worker who can make a small income to support the family. Mrs. Samphors M. is 36 years old and the mother of two children who are all attending the local school. 

Ten members in this village loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for loan to buy more grocery goods for selling.

loans.name: Sabuhi

texts.en:
Sabuhi has been in the beauty salon business for three years. He plans to improve his business by increasing the number of his clients.  He has applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy the necessary items to improve his beauty salon. 

Sabuhi lives in the Fuzuli region. He was born in 1982 and is single.

loans.use: to buy the necessary items to improve his beauty salon

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic has been engaged in the manicure and pedicure business for four years.  She is 42 years old and she is married to Carlito, a carpenter.  They are blessed with three children and all of them are enrolled in the public school in their village in Baculud, Amulung, Cagayan. 

Marivic wanted to purchase different cleaning materials for her manicure and pedicure business.  For this reason, she would like to borrow a loan of PHP 3,000 from the Kiva lenders.  She will also buy different colors of nail polish for her female customers. Her daily service is sometimes tiring but she keeps doing it because she wants to improve their way of living.

loans.use: To purchase cleaning materials for manicure and pedicure business

loans.name: Hazrat Wali

texts.en: Hazrat Wali, the son of Gull Wali, lives in Jalalabad Nangarhar.  He is marred and the father of two sons. He has a retail shop and has been involved in this business for more than 6 years. Every day he works hard to expand his business so he has requested an individual loan to enlarge his shop and buy more food items for his business. He is happy with this loan and he would like to thank the lenders who help poor people around Afghanistan.

loans.use: Buying food and other things for his shop

loans.name: Mrs. Sokit Chann Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people who located in Thnal Teaksen village in Takeo province made up the village bank loan and Mrs. Sokit C. is a village bank president. She owns a small restaurant in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to bU. more ingredients for her current business so she decided to ask for a loan to bU. them. Her husband, Mr. Ven Na, is a farmer and he also helps his wife on the current business. Mrs. Sokit C. is 37 years old and the mother of three children two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is on the age of two years old. Mrs. Phuong Dara who is a group guarantee is also presented in the picture with the village bank loan.

Two members in this village loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her current business.

loans.name: Joylyn

texts.en:
Joylyn is 30 years old and she is married to Domino, a tricycle driver and a farmer. Their marriage were blessed with five children:DJ- 14 years old, 2nd year high school;Divina Joy- 13 years old,is also a 2nd year high school student;Joycel- 9 years old, grade 4 student;Jelly- 5 years old, grade 1 and their youngest is John Paul- 3 years old, already in preschool.  They are residing in the simple village of Salay, Angadanan, Isabela.  

Joylyn is engaged in a typical retail store for almost two years with a weekly net income of PHP1,000.00.  She wanted her store to improve and with this she is asking to avail a loan of PHP11,000.00 that will be used to purchase different grocery items that she can stock in her store. She said that industriousness is one of the major characteristics when starting a business.

loans.use: Additional capital in her retail store

loans.name: Chuong

texts.en: Mrs. T. is 42 years old and is the owner of a small shop in Phnom Penh. She sells food and drinks to the customers who are students or passengers who walk up her restaurant. T. is a good cook and has run this business with her husband since 2005. The business is going well because she is a good cook and the shop is located in an attractive place. She and her husband have two children, both of whom are teenagers and are in school. T.'s husband is a kill in repairing vehicle and he wants to use his knowledge to earn money but he lacks capital. Therefore, T. would like a loan which enable to her husband to begin a service of repairing vehicle.

loans.use: To begin a service of repairing vehicle

loans.name: Emin

texts.en: Emin is single and he lives in Baku. He sells furniture. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy furniture for improving his business, which he started 3 years ago. He was born in 1985.

loans.use: to buy furniture

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 47 and is married to Vicente, a farmer who also works as a tricycle driver.  They have four  loving children: Michael - 22 years old, a nursing graduate who is taking a review course; John - 18 years old, a 1st year college student; Dave - 15 years old, a 4th year high school student and their youngest, Jaira - 7 years old, grade 2. They live in the village of Salay, Angadanan Isabela. Their house is near the rice field, which is one of the major sources of income in their village. 

Eva has managed a food vending business for almost 12 years and sometimes she sells vegetables for additional income.  Her weekly net income is PHP 1,700.00, and she decided to request a loan of PHP10,000.00 that she can use as business capital. This amount will be used to buy the necessary commodities she needs for her food production business.  She said that " we should be content with what we have right now because it is better to live a simple life".

loans.use: To buy different commoditites for her food business

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: S., 42 years old, is a vegetable seller from Phnom Penh City. She runs her business in the area of the Prek Tmey Market and sells different kinds of vegetables like cabbages, potatoes, and morning glories. She currently earns an average of $5 a day and has been running the business for more than nine years. S. is married to Mr. Roeun who is a military policeman. She has four children, two of whom are married and live away from home, while the other two are students. S. finds it hard to traveling to anywhere, because she doesn't have her own vehicle for riding purpose. Thus, she will be used her loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Touch Cheng Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Touch C. is the village bank president of a group of nine people who all live in Smaong village in Takeo province. All the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Srey Touch is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it S. she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding.  She will use the rest of the loan to buy more pig food for her pigs. Her husband, Mr. Saes Thida, is a cow breeder. Mrs. Srey Touch is 31 and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is 4 and is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Mrs. Heng Hin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people who live in Svay Chal village in Takeo province made up the village bank loan and they will use the loan which they obtained in different purposes. Mrs. Heng H. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a fruit seller. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fruit to re-sell and she would use the rest of the loan to buy fishnets for her husband’s fishing business. Her husband, Mr. Prum Sitha, is a construction worker and fisherman. Mrs. Heng H. is 39 years old and the mother of four children three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is staying at home because that child is too young to work or stuD.. 

Three members in this village loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fruit to re-sell and she would use the rest of the loan to buy fishnets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en: Naila is a mother of 4 children. She lives in Fuzuli region. She has been poultry business for 5 years. She was born in 1968. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy poultry for improving her poultry business.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Mrs. Norm Chhoem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Norm C. is a village bank president who has been selected by eight members in Prech village in Takeo province. All the members will use the loan which they obtained in different purposes. Mrs. Norm C. is a fruit seller in the local market. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fruit to re-sell in the market. Mrs. Norm C. is 51 years old and a widow with two children one of whom is a recycling collector and the other is a student. 

Six members in this village loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fruit to re-sell in the market.

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en: Chhay P., 39, is a cake seller. She sells her produce to buyers who are villagers or passer-by and is typically earning an average of $3 a day. As another source of family income is from her husband working as a policeman. This couple has given birth to four children who are going to school. Chhay P. conducts her business more smoothly and there are many customers who recognize the delicious cake she made. To fulfill more her customer's needs, Chhay P. is borrowing a loan to enlarge her investment.

loans.use: To enlarge her investment

loans.name: Pascal's Group

texts.en:
(Pascal, in the small photo, is part of the group, though not in the group photo)
M. Pascal is the leader of his lending group in Mityana. He is 45 years old and married with 3 children, ages 23, 20 and 18,  and also takes care of 2 dependents. Pascal has sold agricultural produce for 20 years. He is happy that he is doing what he does, but his business is often faced by the changing seasons and the price fluctuations. He is such a friendly and hard working man and he would like to expand his business by constructing stores where he can keep his produce safely as well as raising the standard of living for his family. Pascal needs a loan to help purchase more produce for resale, since loans have improved his business since he has been using them.

loans.use: Buying more produce for resale.

loans.name: Rose Eden

texts.en:
Rose Eden D. is a 44 year-old vegetable vendor. Her excellent performance in ASHI in terms of repayment and business all throughout her membership made her one of the most outstanding member. Despite the financial struggle she had in all of her life since birth and during marriage especially on raising her 11 children whose age range is from six to 25 years old, she had manage to remain strong and happy. Her loving husband who is a driver has been so supportive to her especially on her desire for requesting bigger amount of loan. As agreed by both of them, Rose Eden is now requesting for a much bigger amount of loan which will be used for buying a new motorcycle intended for a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) for hire business to be managed by her husband. This is to replace their old second hand motorcycle which was bought more than five years ago.

Tricycle is one of the most common means of transportation people in the municipality take in going to different villages and neighboring municipalities. 

Though at some point of her life, Rose Eden is so disappointed because three of her elder children had decided to stop schooling yet she never loses hope that the rest of them aside from her disabled child will be pursuing their education. She hoped that through her continues loaning, she will be able to grow her business to be able to sustain the education of their children and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Will be used to pay for purcahsing a motorcycle needed for her tricycle (motocycle wit hsidecar) for hire business.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal  and is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to sell.  Cicilia is 40 years old and is Widowed.   She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Koem Seang Morn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people who live in Trapeamh Srang village in Takeo province made up the village bank loan and all the members will use the loan in different purposes. Mrs. Koem Seang M. is a village bank president and she is a farmer who owns 1-hecta field to cultivate rice to earn for living. Her husband, Mr. Maen Run, is a fisherman who now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy fishnets so Mrs. Koem Seang M. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets for her husband business. Mrs. Koem Seang M. is 39 years old and the mother of four children one of whom is employed in a garment factory while others two are attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is on the age of six years old. 

One member in this village loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans so this person is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fishnets for her husband business.

loans.name: Asenso

texts.en: Asenso M. is currently in the business of baking and selling bread  and is requesting a loan to purchase more baking materials .  Asenso is 35 years old and is Single.   She has no children.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more baking materials

loans.name: Adull Zohor Group

texts.en: A. Zohor is the group leader of Adull Zohor group. They are three members in this group. They are wants to take a loan for expanding business and make it larger. So they are requested a group of loan of 30000 Afghani. A. zohor wants to take a loan for the business of fruits selling cart. Esha wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring.Rohina wants to take a loan for her husband who his general store. So they are very thankful from Kiva lenders that can support all entrepreneurs

loans.use: they make larger their business

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en: Mercedita R. is one of the best members of ASHI. Aside from maintaining an excellent performance in repayment, business and attendance in ASHI, she has also maintained her attendance to the needs of her children at home and in school. Despite many challenges in her life, she never gave up fighting against poverty. Her dressmaking and tailoring business has grown and requires more capital to sustain her business. She became the producer of uniforms for one of the biggest colleges in the municipality. At the same time, the expenses have increased for her two children in college, one in high school and for her adopted child. Because of this, Mercedita requests a bigger loan through ASHI so that she can support the growth of her business and be able to meet the growing demands of her customers. Without capital Mercedita’s business will not grow and she will not be able to help her children graduate from college or help the people in her village that she employs as dressmakers.  At times, her children and her husband, who is a fisherman, help her in minor processes of dressmaking.

loans.use: Will be used for purchases needed for her dressmaking and tailoring business.

loans.name: Mrs. Man Ton Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Man T. is the village bank president of a group of twelve people who live in Trapeang Srang village in Takeo province. She is a farmer and owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to make a living. Her husband, Mr. K. Muth, is a fisherman and he now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy a new boat, and his boat is old. In order to deal with this, Mrs. Man T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a boat for her husband. Mrs. Man T. is 48 and the mother of four children; three are attending the local school and the other is a fisherman.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a boat for her husband

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch S. is 24; she is married and has two children. To earn a living, she sells a variety of flowers that she buys in bulk from her wholesale supplier. She sells to people who need flowers to decorate parties or ceremonies.  Her husband helps her sell flowers. She is taking out a loan to buy more flowers to  sell.

loans.use: To buy more flowers to sell

loans.name: Eyima

texts.en: Eyima M. is currently in the business of selling phaste and cold drinks and is requesting a loan to open up a shop.  Eyima is 26 years old and is Married with a husband that is an administrator. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hous for rental purpose BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. loans.name: Mrs. Nara Toun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan which located in Spean Thmar village in Kandal province consists of 23 people and all the members will use the loan in different purpose. Mrs. Nara T. is a village bank president and she is a perfume seller. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more perfume products to re-sell for an income. Her husband, Mr. Prum Sophal, is a construction worker and he is also a farmer. Mrs. Nara T. is 30 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or stuD. because that child is on the age of 2 years old. All the members are shown in the picture B. some of whom are blocked.

Eight members in this village loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more perfume products to re-sell for an income.

loans.name: Awate

texts.en: Awate Y. currently sells at a shop and is requesting a loan to purchase beans and cooking oil. Awate is 35 years old and is married with a husband that is a driver. She has 3 children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase beans and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Khak

texts.en: Mrs. Khak K. is a farmer in Phnom Lon Tas village in Takeo province. She owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice and her husband, Mr. Siv Yong, is a cow breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it through a loan to buy more cows for breeding and selling. Mrs. Khak K. is 41 years-old and the mother of three children.  Two of the children are employed in Casino club and the youngest one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more cows.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: San

texts.en: San S. M. is 29 years old and a resident of Kandal Province, Cambodia. She earns a living as a tailor, providing her service to neighbors, sewing both traditional clothes and modern clothes for wedding parties. She runs her business very well and a lot of customers recognize the good service she provides. From her business, she can earn an average of US$ 5 per day. She is a married and the mother of two children, all of whom attend school. Her husband helps be responsible for family by driving truck for a company. San S. M. is facing difficulty with transportation to anywhere due to she has no her own vehicle for riding. Therefore, she would like a loan to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Mike's Group

texts.en: K. Mike is the leader of his lending group in Mityana. He is a hard-working, friendly, and determined man with a produce-selling business that he has been running for a very long time. Mike is well connected among the farmers that provide and supply him with produce, and he is happy that he makes some profits that help him run his family plus pay his children’s school fees. He has a dream of expanding his business by having a second store, so as to increase his income and hence his profits. Mike needs a loan to help restock his business with more produce so that he can make more profit from it.

loans.use: To buy more produce for resale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice J. is currently in the business of selling used clothes and is requesting a loan to purchase used shoes to sell.  Alice is 42 years old and is Married with a husband that is a mechanic. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a super market BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase used shoes to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Sokhom Touch Group Loan

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhom T. is the leader of a four member group in Pou Khvet village in Takeo province. She is a Khmer cake maker. Her husband, Mr. Heng Soeun, is a farmer and cultivates rice on a piece of land he owns. The couple also acts as a rice middle-man. Since their business is doing well, they want to expand it by purchasing more rice to re-sell to earn more income. Thus, Mrs. Sokhom T. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She is 49 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school, while the youngest is too young to work or study. Mr. Heng Soeun came to request the loan, so he is presented in the picture instead of Mrs. Sokhom T.. 

Only one member in this group has an end-of-term loan, while the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, as they allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more rice to re-sell to earn more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow, ten pigs, and pig food for breeding.

loans.name: Simon's Group

texts.en: S. Simon is a very hard working man and a produce seller in Mityana Central market. He says that he has not been facing many challenges in business except the poor transport system which is costly, the rainy season that affects some crops as well as an off season. Simon is able to make 150,000/= as profits a week and this is mostly attributed to the 15 years of experience in business as well as the good quality of his produce. Simon has a dream of improving the quality of his business by having a variety of produce sold as well as improving his family house and initiating other projects in future. Simon is a father of 8 school going children as he takes care of two more dependants and since he has used more money to pay school fees, he needs a new loan to help purchase more produce like a sack of millet, maize, beans so as to increase stock.

loans.use: Purchasing more produce for increased stock.

loans.name: Aciy

texts.en: Aciy G. is currently in the business of selling various foodstuffs at a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more rice and beans to sell. Aciy is 30 years old and is married with a husband that is an engineer. She has 6 children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more rice and beans

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Mrs. Sopheap S. is a villager in Sophy village in Takeo province. She is farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Arn Samruol, is a construction worker.  He needs some construction supplies to support his work. Thus, Mrs. Sopheap S. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She will use the rest of money to buy eight piglets and pig food. She is 30 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Diénaba

texts.fr: Diénaba M. est une femme de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Boucotte Face Néma depuis 7 ans et y a bénéficié de 16 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans problème. Avec ce crédit elle va approvisionner sa cantine en marchandise telle que de l'oignon, carottes, et autres légumes et de l'huile de palme. Les bénéfices qu'elle réalisera lui permettrons de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Diénaba M., 42, is married and the mother of 5 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Boucotte Face Néma for 7 years and has received 16 loans that she has always reimbursed without problems. With this loan she is going to replenish merchandise in her little store, for example, onions, carrots, and other vegetables, and palm oil. The profit she will make will permit her to contribute to improving living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: improving her little business

loans.name: Kor

texts.en: Mrs. Kor P. is a villager in Krang Krochang village in Takeo province. She is a Khmer cake maker. She is also a weaver. Her husband, Mr. Kar Kim, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Now Mrs. Kor P. is applying for a loan to buy raw materials, fertilizer, and rice seed. She hopes to increase their income and improve the family living conditions with this loan. She is 30 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy raw materials, fertilizer, and rice seed.

loans.name: Beda

texts.en: Beda F. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. Beda is 21 years old and is married with a husband that is a clerk. She has 2 children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en: Mrs. Nuon P. is a villager in Sdol villager in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. Her husband, Mr. Phin Rann, is a taxi driver. This couple also owns a business by using the rice to make wine to sell. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn less income to support the family living. Thus, Mrs. Nuon P. decided to ask for a loan to buy ten piglets, pig food, and fertilizer to support the rice field. She is 43 years old and the mother of five children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is on the rice of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy ten piglets, pig food, and fertilizer to support the rice field.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Mrs. Sang S. is 55 years old and she lives in Sophy village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Chea Sa Roeun, is a palm juice collector. Now Mrs. Sang S. is asking for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income to support the family living. She is a mother of four children, two of whom are construction workers while the others two are employed in a hotel and the remaining is attending the local school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income to support the family living.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en: Yawa M. is currently in the business of wholeselling charcoal in bags and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.  Yawa is 30 years old and is Married with a husband that is a fisherman. She has 1 child and her child goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to esterblish charcoal burning industry BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. loans.name: Chhoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Chhoeurn S. is a villager in Trapaing Chrey village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Since her breeding pigs business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more fifteen piglets and pig food for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Meas Seng, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Chhoeurn S. is 61 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a track driver while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fifteen piglets and pig food for breeding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He want to completed his stocks

loans.name: Nouv

texts.en: Mrs. Nouv P. lives in Sophy village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare field of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field is far from an irrigation system. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump machine and hoses. Her husband, Mr. Srey Pheap, is a construction worker. This couple has six children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while another is a laborer; one is attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine and hoses.

loans.name: Marles

texts.en: Marles M. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at her restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase more chickens for food in the restaurant. Marles is 26 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Marles hopes to be able to extend the floor space of her restaurant. Yasser sells products like rice, canned foods and drinks, candies, evaporated milk, etc. He is requesting a loan with which he will increase his merchandise and provide his customers with a diversity of products. He would appreciate your assistance very much.

loans.use: Increase his merchandise

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.
