loans.name: Twezebbe Namasaba Scovia Group

texts.en:
N. Scovia is thirty-eight years old and is representing her group loan. She is married, blessed with four children, all schooling, and is also looking after three dependents who are schooling, too. She has been operating a little restaurant for five years. She is lacking enough capital to boost her business.

She is requesting the loan to increase the daily food menu for her customers, to purchase a variety of drinks and fresh foods for cooking to accommodate the many customers who may stop over for meals. And due to increasing customer demand she is hoping for a big return. Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: vary the daily menu for her customers

loans.name: Benkadi. Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Benkadi de l’association Sabali sont  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 1enfant et  vivant la plupart dans des familles monogames à Mancourani II un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur troisième  prêt solidaire, tous les prêts précédents  se sont bien dénoués. 
Elles font  comme activité l”achat et la vente d’atiecké, de savons modernes, de médicaments, de chaussures,  de cosmétiques, d’encens, etc. 
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 1sac de 100kg d’atiecké, 4 emballages de pommades cosmétiques, 30 paires de chaussures (talons) et 15kg des graines de (mangnon + guénin) + 5 types de parfums pour préparer de l’encens. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et effectuent leurs ventes à domicile, dans les différents marchés et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante, au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne, les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie réinvestie dans les activités.
Elles ambitionnent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager un point de vente.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers.

loans.name: Ndèye Coumba

texts.fr: Ndèye Coumba D. est une femme de 40 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BOUCOTTE FACE BEMA depuis 2 ans et y a bénéficié de 4 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficulté. Ndèye Coumba développe un petit commerce de tissu teinté et les bénéfices générés par son activité lui serviront à participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: renforcer son petit commerce

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en: Salt is a very in-demand condiment in all households and is a very salable commodity. But making salt is not as easy as it seems. Yes, all you need to do is leave sea water under the intense heat of the sun, wait until all the water evaporates, and then all you need to do is gather and pack the crystal residue into sacks and haul it off to the market to sell. It may sound like such a laid-back job but when you factor in what havoc even just a little rain could do to the end-product, then it wouldn't sound so easy anymore. This is the business of Cecil C., a 52-year-old married woman who lives in the village of Tabao Baybay, San Enrique, Negros Occidental. Her husband, Jose, helps her with her business. They have four adult children: the oldest, who is 30 years old, already has a family; the two middle children are gainfully employed and help with the family expenses; while the youngest, who has also finished college, is still looking for a job. Cecil and her husband, Jose, have been in the salt business for over fifteen years, and they have persevered in spite of the many problems they have encountered along the way. They pushed on, traveling from town to town to sell their product, even when it just earned enough to pay for the basic household expenses with some left over for the education of their four children. But when their children were nearing college age, Cecil knew that if she did not increase her income, it would certainly not be enough to send the children to get their higher education. This was her motivation in joining NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000. The additional capital provided by each loan enabled them to increase their income and afford the college education of their children. Cecil now earns PHP 9,000 average monthly income for all her efforts, and is a big help to the family. The last time she borrowed from NWTF-Project Dungganon, her loan was PHP 12,000, and she used it as additional capital and it earned a good income. She paid each installment on time and fully paid the loan within its term. Now for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000 that she intends to use as working capital for her salt-making business. In the attached picture, Cecil and Jose pose in front of a few sacks of salt they are readying to sell. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To use as working capital for salt making

loans.name: Plumkor Community Development Project. Group

texts.en:
Plumkor Community Development Project is a group of five borrowers led by Momo K., a 43-year-old married man. Momo has three children aged 8 to 13 years old with educational levels of 4th to 7th grade.

Momo is a high school graduate but could not continue to university due to lack of financial support. He then decided to get into business. He lives in Plumkor Community which is a very poor and crowded community where people strive for their living. It is south of Monrovia, the capital of Liberia.

Momo's business is timber. He buys timber whole from rural Liberia and sells to the residents of Monrovia. He started this business through the efforts of friends. Because it was during the Liberian civil crisis that Momo started his business, he used to face difficulties from rebels that always seized his goods. But, because he kept his head up, he was always trying to succeed.

Momo maintains his customers by selling good timber. He has been running this business for nine years and is hoping to improve his business to a better standard. He needs this loan to buy more timber to improve business.

Momo dreams of assisting his family in generating funds that will provide upkeep and change their lives.

loans.use: To buy more timber to improve his business

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en: Phoebe F. is a hardworking mother who dreams to improve the quality of life of her family by providing them with the necessary tools to become independent and self-supporting when they grow up. She is a 54-year-old woman who lives in the village of Barangay Maytubig, Isabela, Negros Occidental, with her seven children. When she was widowed in 2004, Phoebe was almost devastated as she was left to support the five who were still living at home. Even with the help of one of her older children, who was already gainfully employed, life was hard for the family, especially as all of the younger kids were still in school: one in college studying criminology to get qualified for a law enforcement job, and the rest were still in high school. Phoebe thought long and hard about ways to earn more for her family. She knew that she needed to get more capital to increase her income, and this is why she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 so that she could add more stock to her general store and therefore increase her income capacity. As she paid off each loan and borrowed a bigger one, she was able to slowly expand her business while continuing to almost single-handedly raise her younger children. The business now earns an average monthly net income of PHP 6,000. For her previous loan, Phoebe borrowed PHP 15,000 and used it as additional capital for her general store. She used the earnings to pay back her loan each week until she completely paid it off. Now, for her 8th loan, she is again borrowing the same amount of PHP 15,000 so that she is able to maintain the volume of her stock. She plans to use the profits in another venture to increase her income potential. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine T., who lives in the village of Barangay Maytubig, Isabela, Negros Occidental, is 29 years old and married to Benny T. who works with her in managing their fish-vending business. They have two young children who are 6 and 8 years old. Her highest aspiration for her family is that her children be able to go to school, earn their college degrees and have all the opportunities to attain a bright future for themselves and their families.

This is what motivated Christine and her husband Benny to engage in their fish-vending business, selling fish to regular customers in their community and even further to the neighboring barangays and sugar plantations. Delivering the fish to their customers was made easy with the aid of their tricycle - a motorcycle with a sidecar attached that can carry the fish containers. They were quite happy with their achievements at that point but then, in 2004, they knew they had the opportunity to expand their business if only they had the necessary capital.

Christine joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to access the new capital she needed to expand the business. As she paid off each loan and borrowed a larger one that she could afford to pay back, Christine and her husband's business improved. Later, with the extra capital, she was able to put up a general store adjacent to her house to cash in on the income opportunity that it offered. The two businesses now earn an average monthly income of PHP 12,000.

For her previous, 11th, loan Christine borrowed PHP 29,500 that was used as additional capital for her business and this loan was fully paid on time without any delays in the weekly installments. For her 12th loan she proposed the same amount of PHP 29,500 to be used for her fish vending and general store businesses. The income from it will be used as savings for her two young children’s future.

In the picture Christine is shown standing outside her store window while her two young children peek out from inside her general store.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her general store and fish-vending businesses

loans.name: Emilia  Custodio

texts.pt:
Emilia nasceu na cidade de maputo, distrito de boane, tem 38 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 3 filhos com 13,06 e 03 anos de idade que freqüentam escola publica de boane na excepção do mais novo. Vive na casa própria com marido, filhos e sem ninguém mais por sustentar. Fez a 9 classe tendo parado devido à gravidez precoce.

Nunca saiu do distrito e cresceu na companhia dos seus progenitores. Seu marido continua a estudar e também faz actividade comercial. Emilia tem 9 anos de experiência na venda de roupa usada e nova (cortinas, roupa uni sexo para todas as idades). Vende mais fatos para homens e senhoras que adquire na áfrica do sul a 740.00MT e 1.500,00MT e revende a 1.500,00MT e 2.000,00MT, respectivamente. Obtém um rendimento aprox. de 20.000,00MT proveniente das vendas.

Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos e teve informações sobre as actividades da Hluvuku-Adsema através da sua irmã, também cliente da instituição.
Este é o primeiro empréstimo da Emilia no valor de 25.000,00MT para compra e venda de roupa e nova para todas as idades, principalmente fatos para homens e senhoras.
Vai poder satisfazer a demanda e ganhar mais receitas. 

Vem construindo em fases uma casa de alvenaria, juntamente com o seu marido, para confortar a sua família. Sonha concluir a casa para posterior apetrecha mento e para tal propõe se a reembolsar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos.
texts.en:
Emilia is from Maputo, in the district of Boane, in Mozambique. She is 38, married and has three children aged 16, 6 and 3. The two older ones go to public school in Boane. She studied until 9th grade but had to drop school due to an unplanned pregnancy. She never left Boane. Her husband still goes to school and works in retail. Emilia has 9 years of experience in the clothing retailing business (new and used clothes for people of all ages). Her main profit comes from the suits she buys from South Africa and sells to the gentlemen in town. She makes around 20.000,00MT (U$700) per month selling clothes. This is Emilia's first loan and she is asking for U$900 to buy more inventory for her clothing business. She hopes to be able to fill up the demand and get more clients. Meanwhile, she's been builiding a house with the help of her husband, and she dreams of the day their home will be ready.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for reselling

loans.name: Jhasmin Noelia

texts.en:
Jhasmin is 19 years old, single, and lives with her mother. She works as a dairy farmer, selling the milk that her cows produce. She lives in the municipality of Asiru Marca, in the Cercado Province of the Cochabamba Department of Bolivia.

With this loan from CIDRE, Jhasmin will purchase more fodder for her livestock, such as soy and cattle feed. She believes that this loan will help her provide more food for her livestock so that they can become better producers of milk.

Jhasmin is studying to become a professional, and she is paying for her education with the income she gets from selling her cows' milk.

loans.use: To purchase fodder for her cows

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 38 years old, lives with her boyfriend, and has one 15-year-old daughter.  She is a dairy farmer, and with the milk that her cows produce, she makes and sells yogurt and soft cheese.  Gladys has worked with dairy cows now for over 20 years.  She lives in the center of Maica, a community about 40 minutes outside of the city of Cochabamba.

Gladys is going to buy soy husks with her loan, to augment the food for her livestock.  With the help of this additional food, she can continue producing more milk.  Her products are well known in the area for their great quality.  Gladys sells her products in all of the different markets of the city of Cochabamba.

loans.use: To purchase soy husks

loans.name: Elina Rabeca Armando

texts.pt:
Elina nasceu na província de maputo no distrito de boane, tem 36 anos de idade, divorciada e mãe de 2 filhos com 19 e 14 anos de idade e todos freqüentam escolas publicas de boane e no ensino secundário. Não foi para alem da 7 classe devido à gravidez precoce que lhe impossibilitou de continuar com os estudos. No antigo currículo não se aceitava aluna grávida nas escolas em todos os turnos.
Vive na casa própria no distrito de boane com seus filhos e sustenta também seus irmãos que vivem noutra cidade (cidade da matola no bairro de khongolote).

Nunca saiu de boane e cresceu na companhia dos seus progenitores e juntou ao ex-marido no ano de 1990, casamento que durou apenas 9 anos.
Logo depois que se casou começou a fazer actividade de rendimento. Tem um negocio forte de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade numa mercearia na vila de boane e rende por mês aprox. 4.500,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e encontra se a construir a sua casa de alvenaria em fases.

Já teve empréstimos numa instituição similar (FDM) e tendo pagado as dividas decidiu, através das informações obtidas da oficial de credito da Hluvuku-Adsema, abandonar a instituição (FDM) e aderir a hluvuku.

Este vai ser o primeiro empréstimo da Elina na instituição no valor de 15.000,00MT para compra de material de construção (cimento, blocos, areia e outros) com intuito de concluir a sua casa.
Propõe se pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos para comprar mobília e fortificar o negocio.
texts.en:
Elina was born in the district of Boane in the Maputo province. She is 36 years old, divorced, and the mother of two children. The children are 19 and 14 years old and both attend secondary school in the public schools of Boane. Elina did not study beyond 7th grade because her early pregnancy made it impossible for her to continue her studies. The old school system did not accept pregnant students in their classes. Elina lives with her children in her own house in the district of Boane and also supports two siblings who live in another city (in the Khongolote neighborhood of Matola city).

Elina grew up with her parents and never left Boane. She got together with her ex-husband in 1990, for a marriage that lasted only 9 years. Soon after she got married, she began to earn an income. She has a steady business selling basic necessity items at a market in Boane. It earns approximately 4,500 MT (meticais) per month, which she uses to sustain the family and with which she is building a brick house in phases.

Elina previously had loans from a similar microfinance institution (FDM). After having paid them back and getting information from a Hluvuku-Adsema loan officer, she decided to leave the other institution (FDM) and join Hluvuku (Kiva's Field Partner).

This will be Elina's first loan with this institution and consist of 15,000 MT for her to buy construction materials (cement, blocks, sand, and other things) to finish the construction of her house. She intends to pay back this loan successfully and to qualify for future loans to buy furniture and to strengthen her business.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials (cement, sand, blocks, etc)

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
Genaro de ocupación pequeño agricultor y productor de leche, la que  comercializa con Pil Andina, para su posterior transformación en productos derivados del mismo (queso, yogurt, etc.), la esposa es su principal apoyo en el trabajo que desempeña; tiene 2 hijos 1 en colegio, viven en casa propia ubicada en la comunidad Tipampa Achacachi Provincia Omasuyos (a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad para poder aumentar la producción de leche e incrementar sus ingresos familiares.
 
Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, el  crédito anterior fue cancelado puntualmente, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Genaro.
texts.en:
Genaro is a small farmer and milk producer. He sells the milk in Pil Andina to be made later into dairy products (cheese, yogurt, etc.). His wife is a great help to him in his work. They have two children. One is in school. They live in their own house, which is in the Tipampa Achacachi community in the Omasuyos province (three hours from the city of La Paz). The loan is to buy a dairy cow of medium quality to be able to increase milk production and increase family income. This is his second loan with IMPRO. He repaid his previous loan punctually. The completed evaluation shows that Genaro is qualified for the loan he is soliciting.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow to increase milk production

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
Eloy de ocupación albañil y además es  pequeño agricultor y productor lechero mismo que lo comercializa con Pil Andina, para su posterior transformación en productos derivados del mismo (queso, yogurt, etc.), la esposa le ayuda en los quehaceres de la casa, tiene 3 hijos  2 en colegio y 1 en el Cuartel, viven en casa propia ubicado en la comunidad Tipampa Achacachi Provincia Omasuyos (a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad para poder aumentar la producción de leche e incrementar sus ingresos familiares.
 
Es el tercer crédito con IMPRO, los créditos anteriores fueron cancelados puntualmente, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Eloy.
texts.en:
Eloy is a bricklayer. He is also a small farmer and milk producer. He sells his milk to Pil Andina to be made later into dairy products (cheese, yogurt, etc.). His wife helps him with the household chores. They have three children. Two are in school, and one is in the barracks. They live in their own house in the Tipampa Achacachi community in the Omasuyos province (three hours from the city of La Paz). The loan is to buy a dairy cow of medium quality to be able to increase milk production and increase family income. This is his third loan with IMPRO. His previous loans were repaid punctually. The completed evaluation qualifies Eloy for the loan he is soliciting.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow to increase milk production

loans.name: Telesforo

texts.es:
Telésforo se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche  comercializa a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche), También trabaja como albañil en pequeñas construcciones en su comunidad. Su esposa se dedica al cuidado de sus  hijos y colabora con los cuidados del ganado en la ausencia de su esposo. Tienen seis hijos el mayor de 23 años estudia en un Instituto Superior para Profesor, y los demás se encuentran en edad escolar, 
Residen en la localidad de Ancocagua de la Provincia Los Andes ubicado a cuatro horas de La Ciudad de la Paz.

El crédito lo destinara a la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar la producción de leche para poder tener mejores ingresos.

Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, el primer crédito lo cancelo satisfactoriamente, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Telésforo.
texts.en:
Telésforo raises cows. He sells his milk production to Pil Andina (Industrializad Milk Plant). He also works as a bricklayer on small construction in his community. His wife takes care of the children, and she takes care of the livestock when he is not there. They have six children. The oldest is 23 and is studying at college to be a teacher. The other children are school aged. They live in the Ancocagua area in the Los Andes province, which is four hours from the city of La Paz. The loan is to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production and be able to have improved income. This is his second loan with IMPRO. The first loan was paid back satisfactorily. The completed evaluation qualifies Telésforo for the loan he is soliciting.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow to increase milk production

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El señor Edgar C.  vive en casa en Anticretico, en la zona  Villa Exaltación de la ciudad de El Alto, con su esposa, y sus dos hijos.
El señor Edgar es chofer de transporte público y su esposa se dedica a las labores de casa.
El crédito solicitado es para la reparación del motor del vehiculo que es su herramienta de trabajo y así poder continuar con sus actividades.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Edgar C. lives in a house by an arrangement called “anticretico” (a system by which the tenant pays a fixed sum considered a loan to the property owner which they receive back in full when the rental period is over). He lives with his wife and two children in the Villa Exaltación area of the city of El Alto. Edgar is a public transportation driver. His wife devotes herself to the house work. The loan he is asking for is to repair the motor on his vehicle, which is his work tool. This way he will be able to continue with his activities. This is the second time he has asked for a loan. The completed socioeconomic analysis qualifies him to access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the motor on his public transportation vehicle

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel A. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Sopocachi, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa.
El señor Miguel es rentista del magisterio, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de pisos en dos habitaciones  que por el pasar del tiempo se deterioraron.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Miguel A. and his wife live in their own house in the Sopocachi neighborhood on the west side of La Paz. Miguel is retired and supports his family with his pension. This loan will be used to repair the floors in two bedrooms in his house, which have deteriorated over time.

This is the second time Miguel has applied for a loan. He has been rated favorably by the socioeconomic analysis of the lender, so he qualifies for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of floors in two bedrooms of his house

loans.name: Ebenezer # 5 Group

texts.en:
Ebenezer #5 is a group of five borrowers led by Emmanuel P., a 30-year-old single father of a 13-year-old child. The child’s educational level is 5th grade.

Emmanuel is a university student but decided to get into business. He lives on the Camp Johnson Road which is a crowded community; the people who live there are petty business people. It is close to downtown Monrovia, the capital of Liberia.

Emmanuel's business is his phone-center. He does commercial calls and money exchange in downtown Monrovia. He started running this business six years ago but faces unstable price problems. But, because he kept his head up, he is maintaining his customers by giving them good service. That has brought him this far.

Emmanuel is hoping to improve his business by establishing branches around Monrovia. He dreams of making himself and his family successful and changing their lives.

Emmanuel needs this loan to buy more recharge call cards to acquire more profit.

loans.use: To buy more recharge call cards

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
La señora Jesusa Q. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Tupac Amaru, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo y su hijo.
La señora Jesusa es comerciante de frutas en un puesto de venta y su esposo trabaja como conductor en el transporte urbano de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de una cocina y la instalación de gas domiciliario.
Esta es la quinta vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.

loans.use: Costo de construcción de una cocina en su casa y costo de instalación de gas a domicilio.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Guillermo vive con su esposa e hijos en la calle 5 de agosto de la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene un taller en casa de sus suegros, la ctividad que realiza es la elaboración de agendas junto con su esposa; trabajan los tres últimos meses del año, de esta manera en diciembre el stock es grande y solo se dedican a vender, el crédito que solicitan es para comprar papel y otros materiales.

Es cliente de Impro y pago muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Guillermo lives with his wife and children on 5th of August Street in the Pasakeri zone in the city of La Paz. He has a workshop in his parents-in-law's house – there he and his wife produce journals. They work the last three months of the year, so that in December they have a large stock, so they just focus on sales. They are seeking this loan to buy paper and other materials. Mr. Guillermo is a client of Impro, who has paid well in the past in order to to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de papel y otros insumos para su negocio de elaboración de agendas.

loans.name: Tota

texts.es:
La señora Tota vive en la calle Miguel de Cervantes la zona Sopocachi en la ciudad de La Paz
 
Ella, vive en casa propia junto a sus hijos, se dedican a la venta de repuestos para movilidades.

Gracias a los préstamos otorgados anteriormente, cuenta con un pequeño capital de trabajo con el cual tiene  mejores ingresos y condiciones de vida.

El crédito que solicita será utilizado en la compra de repuestos de movilidades, para mantener su stock y poder servir mejor a su clientela.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tota lives on Miguel de Cervantes Street in the Sopocachi zone in the city of La Paz. She lives in her own house with her children, and she sells vehicle replacement parts for a living. Thanks to the loans she has already repaid, she has saved a little capital, which allows her the ability to make better investments and have a better lifestyle. She will use the loan she is soliciting to buy vehicle replacements to maintain her stock and to better serve her clientèle.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de repùestos de vehiculos, para su negocio de venta de los mismos.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Jhonny vive en el Pasaje Maria Auxiliadora de la zona Sopocachi en la ciudad de La Paz
 
El señor vive en alquiler junto a su familia, trabaja con su propia movilidad, su esposa se dedica a la confección de ropa para muñecas de navidad.

El préstamo que solicita será utilizado en la compra de materiales, telas, encajes, para la confección de su producto.

loans.use: compra de telas, encajes y otros insumos para el negocio de confección de ropa de muñecas para navidad que tiene su esposa.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Cesar vive en casa de su suegra en la calle las flores de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene una niña pequeñita, la actividad que el realiza es la de chapería por tal razón instaló un taller en la Av. Jaimes Freyre de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito que solicita es para comprar herramientas (martillos, combos y soldadores) y de esta manera dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.

Es cliente de Impro  desde el año 2008 y tiene un buen historial de pagos, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Cesar lives in his mother-in-law's house on Flores Street in the Tacagua zone in the city of La Paz. He has a young daughter. His business is car repair, which is why he has set up a workshop on Avenue Jaime Freyre in the Tembladerani zone in the city of La Paz. He is soliciting a loan in order to buy tools (hammers, kits, and soldering irons) and thus provide better service to his clients. Cesar has been a client of Impro since 2008, and he has a good record of repayment, which is why he has been able to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra herramientas, comoser martillos, combos y soldadores para su negocio de chapería.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Enrique vive en anticrético con su mamá y su hermano en la Av. Buenos Aires de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que el realiza es el servicio de amplificación, animando todo tipo de acontecimientos sociales. Con esta actividad él mantiene a su familia; el crédito que solicita es para compra de parlantes y juego de luces, de esta manera tener mas clientes y ofrecer un mejor servicio.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien, también fue parte de Kiva por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Enrique lives in a leased home with his mother and sister on Buenos Aires Ave. in the City of La Paz. He is engaged in the business of providing amplification services, where he is able to liven up many types of social events. With this business he supports his family. The loan that he requests is to purchase loudspeakers and lighting so that he can have more customers and offer them better services. He is a client of IMPRO has also worked with Kiva previously. He makes his payments well so that he can access additional loans.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy loudspeakers and lighting for his amplification business which amplifies many social events

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es:
El señor Celestino vive en casa propia con su esposa e hijos en la calle junta vecinal de la zona de Villa nuevo Potosi de la ciudad de La Paz; en su casa instaló un taller el cual tiene de Nombre pollereria Soto donde ellos confeccionan polleras y trajes de varón y con esta actividad ellos mantienen a su familia y el crédito que solicitan es para comprar material ( telas, forros, broches, botones, etc.) ya que tienen muchos pedidos.

Es cliente antiguo de IMPRO con un buen historial de pagos, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Celestino lives in his own house with his wife and children on the street next to the Villa Nuevo Potosi neighborhood of the city of La Paz. He has a workshop set up in his house called "Pollereria Soto." In this workshop, they produce polleras (traditional skirts) and men's suits, and with this activity they are able to support their family. The loan that he requests is to purchase supplies (fabrics, linings, snaps, buttons, etc.) since they already have many orders. He is an old client of IMPRO with a good payment history, so that he is eligible to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabrics, lining, snaps and buttons for a business that produces skirts and men's suits

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos vive en casa propia en la calle Juan Granier de la zona 14 de septiembre de la ciudad de La Paz, vive con su esposa y su hija menor; la actividad que el realiza es la de sastre, ya que desde muy joven se dedicó a esta profesión, la cual es su única fuente de ingresos y además genera empleo ya que tiene a su servicio dos operarios que le ayudan con la costura; el crédito que solicita es para comprar material (telas, forros, botones, cierres, etc.) y atender a  su clientela.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2002, con un buen historial de pagos, de manera que califica para acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos U. lives in his own house on Juan Granier Street in the September 14th area of the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife and his young daughter. Carlos works as a tailor, and has been involved in this business from a young age. This job is his only source of income, but the business also provides jobs for two other workers that help with the sewing. The loan that Carlos is asking for would be used to buy materials (fabrics, linings, buttons, closures, etc.) and to see to customers' needs. Carlos has been a client of Impro since 2002 and has a good history of payments, qualifying him to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics, linings, closures, buttons, etc. for tailoring business.

loans.name: Danaya. Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Danaya sont tous des femmes mariées  ayant en moyenne  40 ans, 3 enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des familles monogames à Mancourani II un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur troisième  prêt de groupe, tous les prêts antérieurs se sont  bien dénoués. 
Elles font comme activité l’achat et  la vente d’atiecké, de savons modernes et de médicaments. 
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 100kg d’atiecké, 20 cartons de savons modernes et 4 emballages de médicaments.  Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et effectuent leurs ventes à domicile, dans les marchés et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante, au comptant  souvent à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille; l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elles ambitionnent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager un point de vente.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Rosario vive en casa propia en la calle Landaeta de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposo e hijos; el esposo trabaja en el supermercado Ketal donde percibe un salario muy bajo, ella se dedica a la elaboración de queques (cakes) de diferentes sabores los cuales los vende en las puertas de los colegios. El crédito que solicita es para ampliar su negocio y comprar insumos, como harina, azúcar, levadura, etc., para ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes actuales como a los potenciales.

Es cliente antigua de IMPRO desde el año 2004 y tiene un buen historial de pagos lo cual le da la posibilidad de acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosario lives in her own home on Landaeta Street in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz with her husband and children. Her husband works at the Ketal supermarket where he receives a very low wage. She makes cakes of different flavors, which she sells at school entrances. The loan that she is requesting is to grow her business and to buy supplies such as flour, sugar, yeast, etc. to offer more variety to her current as well as future customers. She is a long-standing client of IMPRO since 2004 and has a good payment history, which offers the possibility of access to a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour, sugar and yeast for her cake-making business

loans.name: Excellent Group

texts.en:
Excellent group is composed of five borrowers led by Mark N., a 33-year-old single father of a year-old child. Mark is a high school graduate but, due to the civil crisis in Liberia, he could not further his education so decided to go into the business field. He lives and work in Lynch Street, Monrovia, Liberia.

Mark's business is molding bricks. He buys cement by the bag, molds it and sells the bricks to the residents of Monrovia. He started this business 15 years ago, with $350.00 LRD but later borrowed some funds from his friends to improve his business. Mark molds good quality bricks so that his customers are encouraged to always buy from him. He is requesting a loan in order to buy more cement to improve his business. Mark's goal is to grow his business so that he and his family can be successful in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cement

loans.name: Jekafo. Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Jekafo (cinq femmes mariées  et une célibataire) ont en moyenne  39 ans, 3 enfants et  vivent majoritairement dans des familles monogames à Hamdallaye  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république  du Mali. 
Elles font la vente de tissus de draps, de bois de chauffe, de friperie, de cosmétique et de la restauration.
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Avec  ce prêt, elles comptent acheter,  50 kg de tissus de draps, des chaussures, 1sac de 100kg de riz,  5 paquets de condiments alimentaires, 120 sachets de caqueur, 1 chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 4 balles de friperie, et 3 cartons de cosmétiques. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages environnants. Elles vendent,  à domicile, dans les marchés  sur place  et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante, au comptant  souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille; l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elles ambitionnent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager ou avoir leur point de vente.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers.

loans.name: Soutoura. Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe Soutoura sont tous des  femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, 3 enfants et  vivant dans des familles monogames à Hamdallaye  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative  de la  république du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  et  font  de l’achat vente, d’atiécké, de bois de chauffe, de la pâte d’arachide  et  de  la restauration, comme activités génératrices de revenus.
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter, 1sac de 50 kg d’atiécké, 1sac de 50 kg de riz, 4 paquets de condiments alimentaires, 1 chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe et 1 sac de 100 kg de graines d’arachide (pour en faire de la pâte d’arachide).  
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages environnants. Elles vendent à Sikasso ville  à domicile, dans les marchés, et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante, au comptant  souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille; l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elles ambitionnent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager ou avoir leur point de vente.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers.

loans.name: Claveles Community Bank Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Claveles está formado por 12 clientes, pertenecen a la Zona de Pampahasi Bajo y Pampahasi Alto, están ubicados alrededor de la Sub alcaldia  de alto San Antonio, las socias se dedican a la venta de Comida, Viveres, pan, Cerveza, Abarrotes, juguetes, Cosméticos Durante su permanencia en Emprender, que son 5 ciclos se reestructuro en un 30% de las socias
Mery C. B. Es la líder y presidenta del banco desde hace 2 ciclos teniendo en cuenta que el banco ya tiene como antigüedad 5 ciclos, la socia tiene una  tienda de abarrotes. 
En su banco comunal ha aprendido a ser una líder responsable con sus compañeras, exigente con sus cuotas de sus compañeras a la hora de pago, amigable, alegre. con el préstamo que se le ha otorgado a podido aumentar su capital en la tienda aportar de esa forma con ingresos para su familia.
Irene C. A. La señora es la Tesorera del Banco es una de las fundadoras que dio origen a la conformación del banco claves se dedica a la venta de comida, en feria, fiestas y en diversas actividades sociales que se presentan no contaba con capital para emprender su propio negocio, sin embargo ahora con el préstamo que se le dará  ella podrá comprar  materia prima para  iniciar su propio negocio.
Sofia M. S. Socia bastante dinámica, alegre, es la secretaria del Banco, durante su permanencia en el banco siempre se encuentra animando a sus compañeras, a seguir adelante, actualmente se dedica a la venta de carteras, el crédito solicitado, lo requiere para la compra de mercadería.
La señora Sofia S. tiene un  hijo, sin embargo esta no es una limitante para ella ya que sale a comercializar sus productos en compañía de su niño debido a que no tiene con quien dejarlo mientras va ha trabajar.
texts.en:
The Claveles Community Bank consists of 12 members that live in the Pampahasi Bajo and Pampahasi Alto areas, located around the Town Hall of upper San Antonio. The members sell food, supplies, bread, beer, groceries, toys and cosmetics. During their tenure with Emprender, which has been 5 cycles, they are restructuring to 30% of the members. B. Mery C. is the leader and president of the bank for the past 2 cycles, given that the bank already has completed 5 cycles. That member has a grocery store. In her community bank, she has learned to be a responsible leader with her friends, requiring the shares of her colleagues at the time of payment, being friendly and cheerful. With the loan that has been granted, she will be able to increase store supplies, thus providing income for her family. Mrs. Irene C. A. is the Treasurer of the bank and is one of the founders that led to the formation of the bank. She sells food at fairs, festivals and social activities that occur. She had no capital to start her own business, but now with the loan that she will be given, she will be able to buy raw materials to start her own business. The member Sofia M. S. is rather dynamic, happy and is the Secretary of the bank. During her tenure at the bank, she is always encouraging her colleagues. To move forward, she now sells handbags, and the requested loan is required for the purchase of merchandise. Mrs. Sofia S. has a son, but this is not a limiting factor for her as she sells her products in the company of her son because she has no one with whom to leave him while she goes to work.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in capital

loans.name: Gleider

texts.es:
Gleider se dedica a la venta de perfumes y cosméticos como también suplementos alimenticios.
Vive en la zona de San Jorge  de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa alquilada
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de perfumes, cosméticos, batidos, vitaminas y otros). Con este crédito podrá mejorar sus ingresos y condiciones de vida
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.

loans.use: Compra de perfumes, cosméticos, vitaminas y otros para su negocio de venta de los mismos al por menor.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: Elisabeth N. est une femme de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants en sa charge elle est également membre du Banc Villageois de BOUCOTTE FACE NEMA depuis 7 ans. Elle y a bénéficié de 14 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés avec succès. Avec son crédit elle vend du poisson fumé qu'elle transforme elle-même. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: reforcer son activité de commerce

loans.name: Mame Ndoumbane

texts.fr: Mame Mboumbane G., 50 ans, mariée, est mère de 2 petits enfants qui fréquentent tous l'école. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BOUCOTTE PLACE GAO depuis 3 ans. Elle a eu 5 expériences avec le crédit, et chaque fois elle rembourse sans difficulté. Avec son crédit elle va s'approvisionner en marchandises pour le renforcement de sa boutique. Elle partice à la prise en charge de la famille.

loans.use: renforcer son activé de petit commerce

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Maria D. los Ángeles inicia su cuarto ciclo con 21 socias.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes en general, salchipapas, verduras, comidas, golosinas, artesanías, cereales, quesos, ropa, medicamentos.
Sus ventas los realizan en sus casas, en locales alquilados, en mercados D. la ciudad y D. manera ambulatoria.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 450 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, 1000 soles, haciendo un total D. 12600 soles en prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite, papa, carne, cereales, quesos, artesanías.
Los sueños D. las socias son ampliar sus negocios, tener local estable, tener casa propia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, papa, carne, cereales, quesos, artesanías.

loans.name: La Paloma Group

texts.en:
The formation of the Liz C. neighborhood started with María Auxiliadora from C.D.E. She contacted her neighbors and friends to form a committee in her area. The committee is called “La Paloma” and is made up of 18 women very active in their zone. 
They all have different things to sell: pants, shoes, tomatoes, lettuce, apples, bananas, soda, caramels, melons, watermelon, sugar, milk, oil, and other things. 
The women took out a credito of Gs 300,000 to 500,000. They are in their second cycle and have a savings of Gs 925,000.
The credit is to buy merchandise and things that are needed to sell in their neighborhood.
Liz C. is the head of the committee and she wants to use her loan to buy and sell clothes.
Nelly O. wants to use her loan to buy and sell grocery ítems.
Mirian L. wants to use her loan to buy and sell fruit.
Gregoria O. wants to use her loan to buy and sell chicken.
Marciana M. wants to use her loan to buy and sell clothes.
Abelina E. wants to use her loan to buy and sell clothes.
Lucina G. wants to use her loan to buy and sell vegetables and chicken.
Liz M. wants to use her loan to buy and sell clothes.
Anastasia M. wants to use her loan to buy hens.
Juana R. wants to use her loan to buy and sell clothes.
Basilicia B. wants to use her loan to buy and sell clothes.
Esmilce

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Bella Amistad Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal BelL. Amistad inicia su primer ciclo con  24 socias.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. comidas, abarrotes en general, medicina natural, leña, repuestos, comida, jugos, ropa, bebidas, también brindan servicio D. transporte D. pasajeros, servicio mecánico D. carros.
Sus ventas los realizan D. manera ambulatoria, en sus casas, en locales alquilados, D. casa en casa.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 1050 soles haciendo un total D. 12150 soles en prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. leña, carne, arroz, azúcar, medicina natural, repuestos, ropa, frutas, bebidas.
Los sueños D. las socias son ampliar sus negocios, tener casa propia, local estable, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The "BelL. Amistad" (Beautiful Friendship) Comunal Bank began its first cycle with 24 members. The members have different businesses such as selling food, general groceries, natural medicine, firewood, spare parts, juice, clothing, and drinks. They also proviD. passenger transport services and auto mechanic services.

They conduct their sales in an traveling manner, in their homes, in rented premises, and from house to house. The members need different loan amounts such as 300 Peruvian soles, 600 soles, and 1,050 soles, for a total of 12,150 soles that the comunal bank is borrowing.

Their loans will be used to buy firewood, meat, rice, sugar, natural medicine, spare parts, clothing, fruit, and drinks. The members dream of expanding their businesses, having their own homes and a fixed location to do business, and providing a good education for their children so that they may become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, meat, rice, sugar, natural medicine, spare parts, clothing, food, and drinks

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.en:
Eusebio is a 27 year old businessman who sells cereals in Majengo Nairobi. He has been running this business for four years. He is requesting for a loan of Kes. 40,000 to start another business in Nairobi. A father of one, Eusebio hopes to own a transport company and raise the living standards of his family. He describes himself as jovial, hardworking and social.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Start a new business

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a Nairobi based businessman who deals with beauty and cosmetics products. He has been in this business for the last two years. He is requesting a loan of Kes. 70,000 to add stock of cosmetics and beauty products. A father of two, Michael hopes to grow his business into import of assorted products and buy his family a home. He describes himself as hardworking, determined and self motivated.

Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a 38 year old business lady. She operates a retail shop which stocks general products as well as cereals and beauty products. She initially operated a salon before she started her current business seven years ago. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to add stock of food stuffs and cosmetics. She hopes to educate her children and buy a home for her family. She describes herself as determined and focused.

texts.en:
Monica is a 46 year-old mother of four. For the last two years, she has sold vegetables and building materials such as sand in Nairobi. She is requesting a loan of KES 40,000 in order to add to her stock of building materials. She plans to buy a lorry for transporting sand and other building materials and to have at least four other outlets. She describes herself as diligent and determined.

Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.name: Deogratious

texts.en:
Deogratious is a 34 year-old businessman who sells new clothes in Westlands Nairobi. He was previously employed in a soft drink manufacturing company before he began his business four years ago. He is requesting a loan of Kes. 50,000 to add to his stock of clothes. A father of two, Deogratious hopes to educate his children and start a business for his wife. He describes himself as social and determined.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 46 year old mother of six. She sells household items in Kwanjenga area of Mukuru slums in Nairobi. She also sells herbal medicine at the same place. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 10,000 to add stock of household items. She hopes to educate her children and open multiple branches. She describes herself as hardworking and social.
